story:
I was on a cramped public bus in Nicaragua on my way to teach English classes, writing lyrics in my journal when I decided I was going to make this project a reality this year.

I have had the vision to combine spoken word with groovy and rock n roll instrumentals for years now, but I knew now was the time.

I wanted to tell the story of what has been heavy on my heart over the last years of travel, community development work, and just seeking to see God in the faces of people every day. This project was the perfect way to do it.

It combines two of my greatest passions by linking the experiences that have impacted me the most and using a  love I have had for musical creation since I was a little kid.

The Game plan

The money I am raising is everything I need to record, produce, and get physical EP’s into your hands. My goal is to be celebrating at an EP release show with all of you by the end of this year!

I will be traveling to Tennessee to record at the legendary Chris Riley’s studio. Chris will also be helping me write and produce the instrumentation on the album. Chris and I have written and played in music projects together for years and not only share the same musical passion, but also the heart behind this project. I really believe we can create something meaningful and hope this is the beginning of much music to come from Plight øf the Maya.

How you can Help.

Anything you are able to give financially towards this project is a massive help and I am incredibly grateful. Thank you all so much for believing in the vision that is on my heart, you all rule more than you will ever know!

Also you can help me by spreading the word of this campaign and my first track and studio video.

Much love to the moon and back friends. 

| Check out the studio video and track for "Illusion" |

Stay updated and and spread the word on FB: https://www.facebook.com/plightofthemaya/

story:
Dear World, It has been done! :-)
OneTree 2 (working title: "The Inner Kingdom") has been recorded on 21st/22nd May 2016. The upcoming album will include 10 Songs - 9 original compositions and 1 completely new adaption of a world music hit from the 90ties.

Why the campaign?
We are running low on funds due to an unforeseen other project. If you like our music kindly consider to support this campaign to ensure the proper production of the "Inner Kingdom".

If Paypal doesn't work for you but you consider to donate you can  also use the OneTree bank account and get in touch by email : purejoyrecords@gmail.com

About the Band
OneTree creates and performs music devoted to enhance religious and cultural understanding and- most of all- to elevate people towards oneness with their own Self. OneTree's compositions are built on ancient prayers and poems from all over the world. We chose the term "Spiritual Heart Music" to describe it. OneTree has recorded it's debut CD "The Golden String" in 2013.

Musicians from left to right: Ruslan Pashynskyi - Flute & Sax, Eva Maria Neubauer - Voice & Viola, Karl Breitenseher - Tabla & Udu, Ronald Subkus - Voice & Harmonium, Michael Paul - Guitar


Our other projects 

If you don't know us yet you might know other bands where musicians from our group have been active - such as Wienananda, Eve in Paradise or The Heavenly River.


Use of funds

The funds will be used for: editing, mixing, mastering, overdubs, software, printing of the CDs.

-

We kindly request your support for this project.

If Paypal doesn't work for your or you consider to donate you can do so  by using the OneTree bank account and get in touch by email : purejoyrecords@gmail.com


Thank you!

Please find below some songs from our first Album:

story:
Short Summary

This is my 11th studio recording.

To celebrate, I've written fifteen new songs.
I'm going into the studio in July to work on recording them with Hawksley Workman and Keven Breit (engineered by Stew Crookes, mixed by Greg Dawson).

I'm excited to share this new recording with your great support.  Thanks for your patronage, it means the world to me, and I am humbled by your belief in what I'm doing!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I require $7,500 to help make this recording, top to bottom.  This will help pay for studio costs and manufacturing, there is no label or grant support, so your patronage is crucial!

  • If you give $25, you will receive a copy of the new recording, and thanks on social media.
  • If you give $75 or more, your name will be recognized on the liner notes of the new recording, you'll receive a signed copy of the new recording, and thanks on social media.
  • If you give $500 or more to this campaign you can have dinner with Friendly Rich at his favourite restaurant of all time...Swiss Chalet! (additional travel costs to be determined), plus your name will be recognized on the liner notes of the new recording, you'll receive a signed copy of the new recording, and thanks on social media.
  • If you give $1,000 or more to this campaign Friendly Rich will visit your home and perform a duet concert with a musician friend of his choosing! (additional travel costs to be determined), plus your name will be recognized on the liner notes of the new recording, you'll receive a signed copy of the new recording, a new tour t-shirt and thanks on social media.

story:
#CSTexas2016

Short Summary

Country Strike is a country-rock band from Zagreb/Croatia, active since 2011.. Leading the band's resume are two awards from "Texas Sounds International Country Music Awards" in Jefferson/Texas/USA in 2015.: the grand prix - "Entertainer of the year" and "Personality of the year" in competition with 30 acts from around the world and this was made possible by contributors to our Indiegogo campaign last year for which we are veeeery grateful to all who helped out! The experience gave the band a big push, put us and country music on the map in Croatia as well as enabling us to record our first official release this year!
It was a trip into the unknown which makes the story even better but this year we have been nominated again and want to go all out and make the most of it and give you the whole experience to share by recording The first Croatian LIVE country music album with multimedia content from the trip to Texas. We are blessed to be given this opportunity to do something special and we want all of you who contribute to our cause to be the first to share it with us!  We want to give you, as much music and content as we can and in this case a chance to get the feeling of Texas and it's music, people, scenery.... as we experienced it.

What We Need & What You Get

We are not looking for handouts, we need a helping hand over a big step on our way up!
**Remember, anything that is available through the perks is exclusive to the campaign. None of the items will ever be printed again in this way.**
All contributors will receive their purchased perks and our gratitude for believing in us and if the money gathered will not be enough or if anything else stops our project the funds will be put into making new material and recording as well as pushing us along even further! The same goes for the case of exceeding our goal! 


Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. (Budget is based on reaching our goal).

Travel expenses:                                       5000$
Airline tickets:                                                   4000$ 
Rent-a-van:                                                         1000$
Production cost:                                             300$
Mixing (audio)                                                    100$
Mastering                                                            100$
Artwork                                                                100$
Gear purchase and rental                           200$
~Indie GoGo Fees (4%):                          220$
~Credit Card fees (3%):                              160$
Cost of Goods for Perks (20%):            1100$
----------------------------------------------------------------
Total:                                                          7000$

Risks & Challenges

Our drive and enthusiasm are huge and we enjoy what we do we do with love for music! We are aware of all hurdles in our way and that's why we need your help! :)

Any and all help received from you, our present and future friends and fans will not go unnoticed and will be put into good use!


Other Ways You Can Help

In this day and age, where money's too tight to mention we know that not all of you who would like to help can do it by contributing here on Indiegogo.
We appreciate any and all help with our project so SPREAD THE WORD! Tell your friends and family, anyone you think might be interested in helping out, give us a share on community sites (Facebook, Twitter or any other). Who knows, we might find supporters in the most unlikely places!
And please use
#CSTexas2016 
in your sharing!

Also feel free to contact us by email   info@countrystrike.com   or in our Facebook page inbox if you have any suggestion or idea that might help us gather the funds we need!

Check out our official web page for all the news on the band and on the campaign as well as for instructions on how to donate!

www.countrystrike.com


We know that we can make it with a little help from our friends!

...'cause that's what friends are for, right!? ;)

A BIG THANKS IN ADVANCE TO ALL OF YOU!


**note on shipping: for the perks that require shipping, if you forgot to add it into your contribution, please just make a no perk contribution for the correct amount

story:
GSOV - 'The Gondoliers' 2016

Our upcoming production of The Gondoliers is set to be a glittering gala of magical music, magnificent sets and majestic characters showcasing the very best of light opera. In order to make this production as sensational as it can be we are seeking your contributions and support.

This production will feature sumptuous costumes, elaborate scenery designed and sourced in-house, energetic dance scenes taking the show to a whole other level, AND of course, the glorious singing of our talented cast.

Your contribution will help make The Gondoliers not only the great success it deserves to be, but look at ensuring the longevity of GSOV, a well-established performing arts organisation in Melbourne, Victoria which has fostered the love of operetta and G&S in Australia for many decades.

Recently celebrating it's 80th year, the Gilbert & Sullivan Society of Victoria has been delighting audiences with its productions through its performing arm, GSOV - Gilbert and Sullivan Opera Victoria. Critically acclaimed as Australia's leading light opera company, GSOV performs not only in Melbourne and regional Victoria, but has also won awards on the international stage at a premier Gilbert & Sullivan Festival in the United Kingdom.

If you'd like to know more about the upcoming production of 'The Gondoliers', please visit gsov.org.au

What We Need & What You Get

  • Every $10 donation will directly assist our voluntary costume department so that they can make and fix the large quantity of costumes required for this show.
  • Every $25 donation will assist the scenery department in revitalising and refurbishing the hand painted drops and sets which were made decades ago for the society.
  • You can also make a 100% Tax-Deductible Donation to our Society; while this donation will not directly assist The Gondoliers, it will help ensure the longevity of GSOV and help us produce quality musical theatre and operatic productions at an affordable price for our audience.
    Make a Tax-Deductible Donation to GSOV


The Impact

Gilbert and Sullivan has so much to offer modern audiences. The clever and witty social commentary has as much relevance today as when it was written, and the music is complex, tuneful and undoubtedly memorable. It appeals to all ages and is ideal family entertainment at an affordable price. It also is an avenue for our opera students and newly graduated performers to hone their skills and gain experience in high quality productions before launching their careers.


We are currently planning to broaden our reach to provide social engagement across demographic and cultural boundaries. GSOV welcomes performers of all ages. There's lots of scope for principals and those who just want to be part of a theatrical experience in the chorus or as part of our stage crew.

  • GSOV helps foster Australian performing arts talent, through professional standard productions. Many performers go on to work professionally within the opera and music industry in Australia and internationally for organisations including, Opera Australia and Victorian Opera.
  • GSOV offers a financial scholarship to young performers to assist them in their artistic development.
  • GSOV maintains an enormous library of G&S and other musical scores, books, CDs, DVDs and other resources.


Our handsome Gondoliers Michael Dimovski (Marco) & Luke Belle (Giuseppe) and their beautiful Contadine Erin Towns (Tessa) & Kristen Ryan (Gianetta)

Risks & Challenges

As a not for profit organisation its raison d'etre has been bringing the love of Gilbert and Sullivan Opera to audiences across Melbourne and country Victoria. In recent years it has broadened its repertoire to include lesser known light opera works. However a forced move and increasing competition in the entertainment space has limited our ability to reach the public with the wit of W.S. Gilbert words and beauty of Arthur Sullivan's music. So much so that financially the Gilbert and Sullivan Society of Victoria is in need of support to re-launch the updated and reinvigorated GSOV, bringing its productions to a new audience.

Your financial support of the GSOV production 'The Gondoliers', helps us to re-launch and capture a wider audience, whilst supporting the development of the performing arts in Victoria and Australia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every helping hand helps us reach our goal, and we'd love it if you could:

  • Share this campaign far and wide through Facebook, Twitter, or through your favourite social media platform.
  • Tell your fellow opera loving friends and colleagues about this campaign.
  • Book a Ticket to 'The Gondoliers' for a friend or loved one.

What are the Perks

There's something for everyone, with this huge list of perks. Just follow the Perks list down and you'll see the benefits are PLUS, PLUS, PLUS.

* All Prices quoted are in $AUD.

How to Order Perks

  • 1) After purchasing your Perk please notify us either via the Comments or Contact Us to let us know your order preferences of DVD or Ticket.
    2) If you order includes a Social Shout-Out, please let us know if you would like us to mention your Facebook page.
    3) Please reference your Full Name when contacting us.
  • GSOV will endeavour to contact you, however if we do not hear from you prior to the 21st April 2016, your order will automatically opt to the DVD product preference and will be shipped in May.
  • GSOV will provide Social Shout-Out from May 2016 onwards.

Shipping & Handling

Letters & Parcels sent via Regular/International Mail are not insured for loss in transit.

Parcels sent via Registered/International Post require a signature upon arrival and are insured against loss/damage up to $100 via AusPost.

GSOV (Gilbert & Sullivan Opera Victoria) & GSSV (Gilbert & Sullivan Society of Victoria Inc.) will not be held liable for loss of goods during transit.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Rhyan Besco (Bees-Co) and I'm a multitalented musician and at the young age of 19 I've written, recorded, produced, and released three studio albums. Working with many talented voices to piece together my  strongest project to date "R.H.X." which available right now! I have a record titled "We Came to Party" and I am really passionate and confident in this record and I want to send it to radio including SirusXM and Top40! Hitting this goal will help achieve one of the many dreams I have being an artist that's independent. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The goal we need to hit is $7000, and it will go to Howard Rosen Promotions who's job is to send it to Radio and see over the campaign!
  • Awesome and Personal Perks including in donating!
  • If we do not hit the goal, all funds will go towards that project still until we are able to reach it!

The Impact

Every contribution will push us one step closer to breaking new grounds and achieving new records!
  • I really believe that music is missing this type of sound and content and this is the perfect introduction to it!
  • With over 1,000 streams already on Spotify, and getting very close to entering the Hip-Hop/Rap charts on iTunes. We Came to Party is sure to be a smash on the radio!
  • This is something I've been dreaming of my entire life and to finally be this close is surreal and I'm super grateful for the opportunity to be myself and share my music with the world.

Risks & Challenges

A major risk that will always be there until it's over come is not hitting the goal. Especially making sure people are able to see this post being from such a small town compared to everywhere else! But I am determined to conquer this and really go above and beyond what it takes! One thing I always say is that the music will always speak for itself, so if anyone is doubting or has second thoughts always show them the music! I 1000% believe in this lead single and will do everything I can to make sure it gets to where it needs to.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that is also 100% okay! Here are ways you can still be a part of this!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on social media under the hashtag #WeCameToRadio
  • Share the single everywhere!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello! My name is Rhyan Besco (Bees-Co) and I'm a multitalented musician and at the young age of 19 I've written, recorded, produced, and released three studio albums. Working with many talented voices to piece together my  strongest project to date "R.H.X." which available right now! I have a record titled "We Came to Party" and I am really passionate and confident in this record and I want to send it to radio including SirusXM and Top40! Hitting this goal will help achieve one of the many dreams I have being an artist that's independent.    What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  The goal we need to hit is $7000, and it will go to Howard Rosen Promotions who's job is to send it to Radio and see over the campaign! Awesome and Personal Perks including in donating! If we do not hit the goal, all funds will go towards that project still until we are able to reach it!    The Impact
Every contribution will push us one step closer to breaking new grounds and achieving new records!

I really believe that music is missing this type of sound and content and this is the perfect introduction to it! With over 1,000 streams already on Spotify, and getting very close to entering the Hip-Hop/Rap charts on iTunes. We Came to Party is sure to be a smash on the radio! This is something I've been dreaming of my entire life and to finally be this close is surreal and I'm super grateful for the opportunity to be myself and share my music with the world.    Risks & Challenges A major risk that will always be there until it's over come is not hitting the goal. Especially making sure people are able to see this post being from such a small town compared to everywhere else! But I am determined to conquer this and really go above and beyond what it takes! One thing I always say is that the music will always speak for itself, so if anyone is doubting or has second thoughts always show them the music! I 1000% believe in this lead single and will do everything I can to make sure it gets to where it needs to.   Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute that is also 100% okay! Here are ways you can still be a part of this!  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Share on social media under the hashtag #WeCameToRadio
Share the single everywhere!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
I have been writing songs since I was a young child. I am a mother, artist and poet as well as a singer and writer of songs. My songs are about pain and dreams, the psyche and the earth, living off grid and troubled inner and outer worlds. About healing or repairing ourselves before we can heal the world. Some are kinda funny (though often in a dark sort of way) and some are quite serious (and even darker...but there is light too!) Maybe I could start a new genre of music named "Deep, Dark, Psychological Nature Folk" :)? But for now I’ll say its alternative folk!

I live off-grid in this gorgeous little valley in Aberdeenshire (the North East of Scotland) where my family and I have planted thousands of trees and are building natural dwellings among them. I grow my own vegetables, home-educate my two children (who are now fairly self-educating at 15 and 18) and my partner and I paint for a living. I have sung and written songs from an early age and have always wanted to sing more professionally and have my words heard by a larger audience and if I could also make a little money from my music, it would please me so much, but I will do it anyway just for the love of it!

I have played a lot at parties and folk clubs/open mic’s and done a few small gigs with friends and family but now want to start gigging more professionally and would like to make this EP to sell at gigs and market online. I have thirty plus songs I would like to record eventually and would like to make lyric and art books and other hand printed merchandise, but I won't get too carried away just yet and will start small with this EP:)

I have just got a band together who seem to be enthusiastic about gigging with me which is exciting! A bass player/guitarist (my partner!), a banjo player and a drummer and genbre player. We are practicing hard ready for our first gig.

I have mucked around with recording myself and my attempts can be heard on Sound Cloud and YouTube, but to sell them I need a more professional sound as I don't really know what I'm doing with recording and would rather put my time into song writing, practice and performance, rather than learning to become a sound engineer!

I have been quoted £520 by a recording studio to record and mix 4 songs, £360 to make 200 CD's and £20 to print some lyric books so I'll start with that. If I don't reach my target I will put what money I do make towards some basic recording equipment and beg my musical friends to help me with recording!

It's hard to keep confidence levels up, but I do believe my music is relevant and worth getting out there.  song writing for me has always been a way of processing emotional events and its my hope that some of the themes will speak to people going through their own troubles, writing them is definitely a kind of therapy and I have often turned to the songs and music of others in times of need and been lifted by poetic and meaningful lyrics, beats and melodies. Its also just possible that my lyrics will make people think and question the things which are wrong in the world and in themselves...maybe I am being a little misguided there, but you never know ;)...So I am pushing through the wall of self-doubt and going for it. If people donated to this campaign or even just said nice (or constructively critical) things and shared it around with their friends, so it can be seen by as many people as possible, it would give me such a delightful kick, you wouldn't believe it!

Here is what a lovely person said about my songs once :)

"Rachel's songs are sometimes raw, personal, honest, dark and visceral and sometimes dreamy, ethereal and quirky".

I thank the friends, family and the occasional stranger, very much, who have encouraged and supported me to this point and allowed me to believe my songs and voice are worth being heard. All your nice little comments/compliments have led to this. If you are able to give to, or share my project I will love you forever and send all the good thoughts I am capable of your way!!! Thank you SO SO much in advance!!

story:
Hello to all of our family, friends, and fans and if you haven’t heard of us, we’re Mason Turner and the Reign. We are a Rock band from Seattle, WA. Our sound is rooted in the blues and infused with influences from Jazz, Funk, Soul, and R&B. If you want to learn more about our music and us please visit our website.

Over the past year we have been perfecting our craft and also playing lots of shows along the way. We have played The Stone Way Café, The Neptune Theater, Party in the Park at Volunteer Park (twice), The Eagles Club, The Red Crane, Neumos, and The Fremont Abbey. This month (May) we are part of the line up for The Sage Creek Music Festival at the Sage Creek Campgrounds near George, Washington. At these shows we always get asked the question: where can we hear your music? Do you have an album I can purchase? We believe that it’s time that we have a product to give back to our family, friends, fans, and anyone who has supported us so far. To make this dream a reality we need your help.

What is Summer Man? This album “Summer Man” is a collection of all of our music from this past year. Lots of these songs Mason has been running through drafts for years before this album was even an idea in his head. His goal was to find the perfect sound. The Summer Man idea came to Mason when his grandfather, Phillip Turner passed away. The songs off the album have either direct correlation towards this event or address how this death affected Mason and how it made him feel.

What does this album mean to us? We have started parts of the recording already and through these experiences Mason and the rest of the band have evolved as people, musicians, and artists. Mason has a stutter that has been a struggle for him throughout his life. This album and music in general has been a way for him to express himself and to share his ideas and feelings with others. Being their debut album Mason Turner and the Reign are very excited to see the opportunities that might arise from this record and are ready to put everything they have into this album and share it with all of you.

Welcome to the “Summer Man Campaign”. What is the campaign for? In response to the many requests, we recently went into Clatter & Din Studio in SODO and recorded our debut single “We Bring the Rain”. The song took us four hours to record and each hour in the studio costs $60. This comes out to $240.00, so you can imagine recording an 8 track record, adding in mixing, mastering, artwork, duplication, and distribution this is going to be pretty expensive!  

Our fans are like family to us and we want you to be as much a part of this project as we are. That’s why we want you to be a part of it every step of the way. So if you look at our rewards list you can see that they are very intimate and personal. There are many rewards to choose from for all different donation amounts. These rewards will only be available as long as the Indiegogo is active so the time is now!  

The costs of this project will cover: Recording, Mixing, Mastering, Artwork, Duplication, Video Production, and Merchandise Costs. In total all of the costs of this project will come out to $7,600. That's a lot of money for a bunch of 16 to 18 year olds in high school. We need all the help that we can get and we want to thank you for all the support you've given us so far and in the future as well.

So that's it. Welcome to the Mason Turner and the Reign family. If we can make this dream of ours a reality we can keep on doing what we love and continuing to bring music to you for as long as our human bodies allow us.


                                                  ***Added Bonus*** 

Anyone who donates to our campaign will get a invitation to our “Summer Man Campaign Party”. The invitation is not +1 so if your friend(s) want to come they have to donate too! This is another way were trying to say thanks so much for your help.

If we reach our goal you know we’re going to throw one kickass party!!    

Thank you to all of you beautiful people in advance

Mason, Ivy, Isaac, Gunnar, and the whole Mason Turner and the Reign team

#SummerMan #SeattleMovement

story:
Short Summary

As you may know, making a high-quality album is neither easy nor inexpensive. That is why Second Story Anthem is asking for your help!  After putting hundreds of dollars of our own money into this project, we thought it was time to ask our friends, family and fans for some help!

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break down what all this campaign is going to help fund:

  • Recording the album
  • Paying for various artwork (logos, album art, video work, photography, etc.)
  • Physical copies of the album
  • Digital distribution
BUT we aren't asking for handouts.  You are going to get some super cool prizes if you donate!

The Impact

It has always been a dream of this band to put out a high-quality product that we can really be proud of, and this album is it.  All of our time spent in this band has come down to this, and we are sure you will not be disappointed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe donating isn't your thing, that's cool!  You can also go to our bandcamp and pick up some merch there, and you can even add some extra money to your order as a donation!  Here's the link: https://secondstoryanthem.bandcamp.com/

story:
Greetings and Welcome!

We're Jubilant Bridge, a harmony-driven duo from Colorado who perform original and contemporary songs and instrumentals backed by dulcimer and guitar.  We're excited about being in the studio working on our new Christmas CD.  But it won't be a CD of standards.  Most of the songs are Renaissance, and pre-Renaissance, songs, songs that we have loved or sung for years, but there are also a few by 20th-century composers.  We sing in French, Spanish, Latin, and Old English, although there are certainly plenty of songs in plain old ("new") English.  Some are originally choral pieces that we've arranged for two voices.  There will also be a couple of originals, and a surprise or two as well!  All will get the (un)usual Jubilant Bridge treatment: unique harmony vocals, intricate arrangements, innovative dulcimer playing, and high-quality sound.  We have wanted to record these beautiful songs for years, and now our  dream is finally being realized.

We're Asking For Your Bridge Support

As many others are doing these days, we are seeking donations to enable us to complete our recording.  Although we've recorded the basics to many of the songs, there is still recording to be done, as well as mixing, mastering, artwork and graphics, manufacturing, and promotion.  Our goal is to raise $10,000 for all of these components.  We are excited to be able to share these songs with you, songs that are not often heard, especially by a duo.

What You'll Get For Donating

We have some fun perks in the Bridge Support categories on this page.  You will also get the satisfaction of supporting the arts, and our eternal gratitude.  And did we mention our eternal gratitude?  Help us to realize our dream!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone can contribute financially.  But if you would like to share our campaign with family or friends, or others who might be interested, that would be great also.  All you have to do to share is use the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thanks for being a Bridge Support!

Carol and Willie

story:
About it all:

This Indiegogo campaign is about raising the funds to help Elfin Bow record her debut album. The entire process will be expensive and require help from a variety of people that includes anyone from a recording engineer to producer. 

By contributing to this campaign you will not only help me achieve a great album but hopefully a name that will be recognized in the music community. 

What We Need & What You Get:

  • This full length 13 track album will require £5,000. The money will be distributed to the recording studio, producer, engineer, studio musicians and cd duplication company. 
  • For the amount you contribute, based on your donation, you will receive anything from hand-illustrated lyric sheets to a song written just for you.
  • If we somehow don't reach our goal, the funds will be used for the recording and people whom have helped in the production of the album. 


The Impact:

  • I truly believe in this project and how it will affect other people's lives. You are joining in my journey to 'follow the music', combining my twin passions of art and music and to share my creativity with the world. Whether that is in the tales about the social outcasts I encountered as a child or singing about love and renewed hope in difficult times. My narrative for imagination is also yours.
  • Some achievements I've accomplished in the last few years of my life include performing with my husband, Gary Edward Jones, working closely to record and make his self-produced debut album, running the Bow's Folk concert series, appearing on BBC Radio Merseyside, Wirral Radio and other local internet stations. I have supported Bronwynne Brent, The Sam Kelly Trio, Harp and a Monkey and Tom Kitching. I hope to make this campaign another successful chapter that I can share with other people.  
  • Throughout this campaign I hope to make real connections with people, most of whom I've never meet before, so that I can bring value and meaning to their lives in terms of new music. I want to build a community with people and gain their trust as an artist. 


Going The Extra Mile:

For this campaign I wanted to go above and beyond the typical Indiegogo campaign in terms of what I put into it in order to get the most out the campaign.

  • I wanted to overcome the many hurdles of a typical Indiegogo campaign by offering a unique array of creative perks that will be exchanged for donations that clearly demonstrate how my art and music are inextricably entwined. I want people to believe that the kind of quality and creativity they see in these offerings is the kind of quality and creativity they will see in the album. 
  • I also plan to pair this campaign with the release of a music video for my song 'The Wisdom', filmed at Lowther Castle and Gardens in the Lake District. Again, I hope that this will give a taste of what is to come on the album as well as creating as much of an impression or buzz from the music video in order to keep a constant momentum throughout the whole campaign.
  • I've already put a great deal of time into the production of the music video and campaign. But I believe going the extra mile will help me achieve my goal.  


Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help...

  • Make some noise about the campaign - share it with as many people as possible through social media, email etc.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools that are located on the campaign page.
I appreciate anything that you are willing to do for this campaign. Never stop chasing that dream.

Fear nothing, follow the music and love to all,

Elfin Bow x

story:
hi friends

we are all a part of the grand shell game. we have made an album. composed of six songs. 

we came together haphazardly. we made some noise and it was good. we became a band. we recorded in Connecticut. we played up and down the east coast. we got to know our home town of Carrboro, NC. we recorded a bit there too. we holed up for the better part of a year rehearsing and really got to know each other. and now here we are. we think it's a record.

we are ready to introduce you to our baby. precocious and coy with a grandeur heartbeat. say hello to the man on a wire.


... we have 4000 reasons to raise some dough

miles. we're talking miles. we're coming to see you in our trusty bus, the starship moneypenny. by our meticulous ballpark calculations this means we'll travel 4000 miles on our journey through (at this point) 19 stops and 20 gigs in 25 days on the east coast. 


(the starship moneypenny)

at the reasonable rate ~ for a bus ~ of 15 miles per gallon with gas at a conservative $2.50 per gallon this means we'll spend $666OHMYGODAAAAAAAAAHHHH. 

actually $666.66666666666668 to be exactish. a somewhat hefty sum.


but... that's not ten grand.

you're right. and we're not exactly sure what hitting the goal gets us on this indiegogo platform, maybe we're just missing it in the faq. but we appreciate the community here and we like the idea of having a goal. it implies that we really want to get the word out about this album, because we do. 

we would love it if you were to spread the word. we're sort of putting our money where our mouth is. the approximate cost of producing this thing was ten thousand dollars. the sooner we can recoup that cost, the sooner we as a band turn a profit with our art, which would be amazing. and the more people that learn about this campaign learn about us, which might mean we get more folks at shows. it's a win-win.

whether we make $50 or fifty grand, we get to keep these funds. you will get what you order and you are helping us grow. ten grand is a lot of dough, we know. we set the bar kind of high. but it can go a long way for a small band like us. we tried to price things fairly and we had some fun with some of the package items to make them really worth the while. 


speaking of stuff. and things. what can you get?

we have the album. currently in cd format.

digital downloads too. t-shirts. music lessons. shirtless bacon frying, dinner for four, weekday gigs, weekend gigs, and a rockstar package. sort of like Spinal Tap. but better.

plus our eternal gratitude.

all these things and more can be yours for a reasonable price. on or after June 11th. and with your contribution we will send you a digital version of the gateway to the album, the title track "man on a wire" for that immediate gratification.

what sort of risks and challenges await us?

fear. and loathing.

thus far it appears we've overcome everything else...


of course, if you're broke...

don't worry about it. we get it. maybe check out a friends' copy for a while until you get some dough and buy it from us later. just support us. come to the shows. keep in touch. and of course, tell your friends. if you dig, share this on facebook, twitter, instagram, IRC, ICQ, AOL, ACRONYM, the public events board at the grocery, wherever. anywhere good people might congregate. and thank you.

story:
Aloha friends,

Thank you so much for checking out my crowdfunding campaign to launch my debut album.  With your monetary support and pre-orders of my album, I’ll be able to share this mantra music with all of you. I invite you to be a part of the production of the Lakshmi Lullabies album, and spread this sacred music around the globe.  We can do this together!

                                                                                       Mahalo,

                                                                                       Noelani Love


Recording this album has been a fairy tale dream of mine for the last few years. My hope is that this album will be an inspiration, not only for myself, but for all of you.  I spent most of my life hiding in my truth, unable to share my opinions, and definitely didn't want to sing or speak in public.  

As a woman rising into her power at this time on the planet, I realize that it is time for us to find our voices. Singing and practicing mantra has been transformational for me. These sacred songs have activated something within me that is indescribable.  I’ve found my voice, and I realize that mantra music is a gift that wants to be shared with the world. 

As a mother, jewelry designer, yoga instructor and doula, I enjoy empowering the people around me, and I hope that my music creates a sense of peace and healing within you.

Thank you to my loving and supportive community of family, friends and fans who have encouraged me to share my music.  I would not have done this without you!


VISION

With this collection of sacred songs and chants, I imagine people will be singing along, healing themselves through the vibrations of their own resonance.  I imagine mothers nursing their babies & singing their children to sleep with these lullabies.  I imagine people dancing and feeling good in their mind/body/spirit.  We're bridging the gap between ancient mantras and sweet modern music.  These powerful sound-healing songs are the medicine that the world needs right now.

I envision between 10-15 tracks on this album.  My songwriting combines ukulele melodies with traditional chants from the languages of Sanskrit, Hawaiian, the Kundalini lineage, and more. 

I’ve already completed production of two songs at Chakya Muna Recording Studio with Producer Rob Weber.  I plan to finish recording in the upcoming months with the support from this campaign. Some songs will be acoustic style with just ukulele and voice; there will also be collaborations with other musicians.


BREAKDOWN OF THE COST OF THIS PROJECT

Because I feel that I am so supported in this project, and I want to share the creative process with everyone, I am encouraging people to pre-order the album. I am also offering other fun “perks” to inspire you to invest in this creation.  The money we raise together will go towards:

  • Production fees (with a world-class producer)

  • Recording studio costs

  • Professional studio musicians

  • Equipment rental

  • Graphics and art design

  • CD manufacturing costs (including album cover + liner)

  • Marketing and Promotion


I’d like to introduce my colorful cast of musicians and my producer who have helped me begin this project with gusto, before I even believed in myself.

Producer: Rob Weber

Vocals & Ukulele: Noelani Love

Tabla: Bill Witter

Keys: Levi Levitt

Native American Flute: Benjamin Ezekiel


Big MAHALO to my ukulele sponsor Tadashi Koutatsu of Blue Moon Craft.  He creates instruments with magical powers.


And of course,
mahalo to my handsome man Dusty, and my little monkey Aukai.


Music has the ability to cross borders and cultures, connecting us all.  It can be powerful medicine.  I have truly been guided by the Universe as this opportunity unfolds.  Sometimes when we least expect it, and we create intentions from our hearts, magic can happen. As one of my favorite musicians Nahko Bear says: “I believe in the good things coming.”

story:
Short Summary

  • Strategic has been my acoustic/alt rock "one man band" music project since 2008.  I have played over 300 shows the last 7 years!  But why?  Why do I do it? "What is my MOTIVATION?"
  • MO-TI-VA-TION: (noun) the reason or reasons one has for acting or behaving in a particular way.  MOTIVATION is the question of why we do what we do...& I've found that people need MOTIVATION too to do certain things...I want my music to MOTIVATE others to love well, pursue their dreams and live with passion & purpose!
  • You will be helping me achieve not only another album but a greater platform for me to share my music & message to others.

What's Needed & What You Get

  • $2,000 total.  Breakdown:  $800 for final studio sessions, $795 for a run of physical cds (yes people still want them!) and the rest will go towards new merch, video shoot, cd release show, travel expenses, etc...
  • Contributing is more than just saying I support your music, it's saying I support your message and I'm willing to share it!  With unique perks like a private house show or limited edition printed shirts by the band you can easily spread the positive message and MOTIVATE others!
  • If the entire goal is not met, whatever funds are raised will be used to finish recording & mixing....the release may be postponed until I can fund the mastering & reproduction of discs.  Don't let that happen - let's get MOTIVATED & meet the goal!

The Impact

  • I am extremely excited about this project because I feel it will have a greater impact than any previous release & it is consistent with my message of living out your purpose, loving well & making progress.
  • 2 previous funding campaigns did not meet their funding goals, but did help tremendously...meeting the goal means more music (and videos, etc) sooner (and more often)!!!
  • the "Choice you Make" to contribute makes a "Difference" by saying I think this is "Worthwhile"
  • one goal is to do a national tour or even travel internationally sharing my music & message, which I am confident can happen - if goal is met!!!

Risks & Challenges (DETERRENTS)

As always there are challenges; most of which being time & money...we cant get more time but we could meet the goal...Believe it or not it will be a huge challenge getting this out by the end of Nov.!

  • 12 songs this time! (which costs more and takes more time)
  • more players in the studio / coordinating players & parts (also costs $ & time)
  • I want to have more attention to details in mixing as well as do better with promotion this time around

Other Ways to Help (Additional MOTIVATION)

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • help make a music video!  if interested, email me: strategicbooking@gmail.com
  • book a show!  show $ goes toward recording costs (most of the time; sometimes it goes towards Taco Bell)
  • prayer

story:
Sobre Wiñay Wayna


Wiñay Wayna, es una palabra que esta escrita en Quechua y que significa “por siempre joven” en Castellano, es una empresa social conformada por jóvenes de Perú, Colombia y Francia. Hace un año, estos jóvenes vienen apostando por el emprendimiento social en Latinoamérica,  ayudando en la formación de proyectos sociales de diferentes rubros, teniendo como actores clave a jóvenes de las diferentes ciudades del Perú, para que estos puedan revelar su potencial y talento, y puedan ponerlo al servicio de la sociedad.

Wayna Tour Febrero 2017

"Tour de Emprendimiento Social"

El emprendimiento social es un camino que los peruanos necesitan tomar en cuenta para poder lograr un cambio positivo en la sociedad. A través de diversas fuentes, hemos encontrado que existen muchas personas con ganas de generar impacto social sostenible, pero tienen muchas barreras para conseguirlo:

  • Muy pocos pueden hacer realidad sus ideas de impacto social, principalmente porque no existen espacios para conversar y conocer las experiencias de un emprendedor social exitoso.
  • Hay muchas personas con un alto potencial, pero muchos no creen en ellos mismos, lo cual genera que muchos emprendedores se caigan en el camino. Conocerse a uno mismo es la base de un emprendimiento.
  • Hace falta que los emprendedores sepan estructurar sus proyectos. Al no existir una cultura del emprendimiento, las personas no saben cómo crecer y lograr sostenibilidad.

¿Cómo aporta este proyecto?

En este primer año como empresa, hemos podido impactar directamente a más de 55 jóvenes de entre 19 a 34 años, de más de 10 ciudades de Perú, en tres tours de emprendimiento social. Trabajamos bajo el programa pedagógico innovador: la “metodología 3i”: inspiración, introspección e innovación.

Durante este viaje transformacional, los participantes experimentan este método, el cual acompaña a los participantes en el proceso de formación de su proyecto y en el reconocimiento de su pasión y de las problemáticas sociales que quiere y puede resolver. Esta experiencia potencializa el desarrollo óptimo de su creatividad, talento, autoestima, autoconfianza e identidad ciudadana.

¿Que se hemos alcanzado hasta ahora?

  • Mentoría a más de 120 jóvenes con proyectos sociales escalables.

Formación a más de 15 proyectos sociales de alto impacto actualmente en marcha. Todos sus creadores han sido parte del Wayna Tour.

  • Orientación a proyectos sociales de alta escalabilidad. Ejemplos: el proyecto “EcoBaf” ha recibido el acojo de inversionistas de alto rango, “WarmiLab” es parte de una de las incubadoras de negocio más importantes del país.
  • Una experiencia transformacional para más de 60 jóvenes: incluidos participantes y coachs.
  • Todos los participantes directos del tour han logran aumentar su autoconfianza, creatividad y potencializado su talento para poder realizar actividades en pro de la sociedad.
  • Somos apoyados por personalidades emprendedoras peruanas, que están entre los más innovadores: Vania Masias, Cinepapaya, ASEP, entre otros.
  • La comunidad de “Emprendimiento Social” en el Perú se ha visto fortalecida por la articulación de diferentes actores (emprendedores, inversores, incubadoras, voluntarios, entre otros).

¿Para qué servirá la colecta?

Para seguir potenciando el sistema del emprendimiento social!

En febrero del 2017 tenemos que seguir trabajando, inspirando y apoyando a jóvenes  apasionados, que con sus ideas y proyectos pueden aportar al cambio positivo de la sociedad.  Por eso, para el “Wayna Tour de Febrero de 2017”, seleccionaremos a 30 jóvenes, para que, durante 8 días, puedan vivir una experiencia inspiradora y única, de desarrollo personal e innovación. Contamos con las más grandes referencias peruanas de emprendimiento, que compartirán su pasión estos jóvenes de alto potencial

Después de estos días transformacionales, TENEMOS EL RETO DE DARLE EL MEJOR DE LOS SEGUIMIENTOS A LOS PARTICIPANTES Y A SUS PROYECTOS A TRAVÉS DEL PROGRAMA “PRIMEROS PASOS”. Por eso, estamos apuntando a crear una plataforma web que pueda ayudar a los emprendedores al comienzo de sus proyectos. Buscamos implementar un business model viable e innovador, pero necesitamos TU AYUDA para lanzarlo.

Tenemos el reto de potencializar nuestro camino de auto-sostenibilidad. Para poder seguir siendo un actor clave de en la potenciación de proyectos de alto impacto que transformen realidades de todo el país, TE NECESITAMOS PARA PODER SEGUIR HACIENDO EL CAMBIO TODOS JUNTOS.

¡Su participación en esta causa nos beneficiará enormemente !Permitirá a jóvenes de Perú y Colombia desarrollar proyectos para servir y transformar positivamente a la sociedad!

 

About Wiñay Wayna

Wiñay Wayna, which means "forever young" in quechua, is a social enterprise, made up of young people from Peru, Colombia and France. These group of youngsters have dedicated to social entrepreneurship in Latin America, for over a year, being part of the formation of several social projects, having as key players young people from different cities all over Peru. This way, they can develop their potential and talent throughout a transformational journey, where they will create a high-impact project for society.

 

"Wayna Tour Frebruary 2017"

Social Entrepreneurship Tour

Social entrepreneurship is a path peruvians need to consider in order to achieve a positive change in their society. Through various sources, we have found that there are many people wanting to generate sustainable social impact, but they have many barriers to achieve this:

  • Few people can accomplish their goals of social impact, mainly because there is no space to discuss and learn about the experiences of successful social entrepreneurs.
  • Many high potential entrepreneurs fail to accomplish their goals due to their lack of self-confidence. Getting know your self is fundamental for this kind of ventures. 
  • Entrepreneurs need to know how to structure their projects. In absence of a culture of entrepreneurship, people do not know how to grow and achieve sustainability.

 

What’s the impact of this project?

During our first year, we have worked with more than 55 young people (between the ages of 19 and 34), in over 10 cities of Peru, through our three social entrepreneur tours. We work with an innovative educational program based on the "3i methodology”: inspiration, introspection and innovation.

During a transformational journey, the participants experience the 3i methodology which supports them during the formation process of their project, helping them to realize their passion and the social problems that they can and want to resolve. This experience potentiates the optimal development of their creativity, talent, self-esteem, self-confidence and civic identity.

 

What have we achieved so far?

  • Mentoring more than 120 young people with scalable social projects.
  • Training more than 15 current projects with high social impact. All of its creators have been part of Wayna Tour.
  • Orientation to highly scalable social projects. I.E. "EcoBaf" project has been well received by senior investors; "WarmiLab" is part of one of the most important “business incubators” start-ups of the country.
  • A transformational experience for 60 young people, including participants and coaches.
  • All direct participants in the tour have manage to increase their self-confidence, creativity and potentiated their talent to perform activities for society.
  • We have the support of highly recognized peruvian entrepreneurs, such as Vania Masias, Cinepapaya, ASEP, among others.
  • The community of "Social Entrepreneurship" in Peru has been strengthened by the articulation of different actors (entrepreneurs, investors, incubators, volunteers, etc.).

What are we raising this funds for?

 

TO SUSTAIN THE FULL POTENTIAL OF THE SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP SYSTEM! 

 

On february 2017 we have to continue working, inspiring and passionately supporting youth, with their ideas and projects that can bring positive change in society. So for the "Wayna Tour february 2017", we will select 30 young people who will live an 8-day unique and inspiring experience of personal development and innovation. We have the support of the best entrepreneurial references who can share their passion to young people with high potential.

 

After these transformational days, WE HAVE THE CHALLENGE OF MONITORING THE PARTICIPANTS AND THEIR PROJECTS, THROUGH THE PROGRAM “FIRST STEPS”. Therefore, we are aiming to create a web platform that can help entrepreneurs make their first steps of their project. We seek to implement a viable and innovative business model, but we need your help to launch it.

 

Our challenge is to take a big step into self-sustainability. We need you in order to remain as a key player for propelling high-impact projects that transform realities across the country, so we can continue making change all together.

Your participation in this cause benefit us greatly! It will allow young people from Peru and Colombia develop projects to serve and transform society positively.

Hace falta que los emprendedores sepan estructurar sus proyectos. Al no existir una cultura del emprendimiento, las personas no saben cómo crecer y lograr sostenibilidad.

¿Cómo aporta este proyecto?
En este primer año como empresa, hemos podido impactar directamente a más de 55 jóvenes de entre 19 a 34 años, de más de 10 ciudades de Perú, en tres tours de emprendimiento social. Trabajamos bajo el programa pedagógico innovador: la “metodología 3i”: inspiración, introspección e innovación.
Durante este viaje transformacional, los participantes experimentan este método, el cual acompaña a los participantes en el proceso de formación de su proyecto y en el reconocimiento de su pasión y de las problemáticas sociales que quiere y puede resolver. Esta experiencia potencializa el desarrollo óptimo de su creatividad, talento, autoestima, autoconfianza e identidad ciudadana.
¿Que se hemos alcanzado hasta ahora?
Mentoría a más de 120 jóvenes con proyectos sociales escalables.
Formación a más de 15 proyectos sociales de alto impacto actualmente en marcha. Todos sus creadores han sido parte del Wayna Tour.

Orientación a proyectos sociales de alta escalabilidad. Ejemplos: el proyecto “EcoBaf” ha recibido el acojo de inversionistas de alto rango, “WarmiLab” es parte de una de las incubadoras de negocio más importantes del país.
Una experiencia transformacional para más de 60 jóvenes: incluidos participantes y coachs.
Todos los participantes directos del tour han logran aumentar su autoconfianza, creatividad y potencializado su talento para poder realizar actividades en pro de la sociedad.
Somos apoyados por personalidades emprendedoras peruanas, que están entre los más innovadores: Vania Masias, Cinepapaya, ASEP, entre otros.
La comunidad de “Emprendimiento Social” en el Perú se ha visto fortalecida por la articulación de diferentes actores (emprendedores, inversores, incubadoras, voluntarios, entre otros).

¿Para qué servirá la colecta?
Para seguir potenciando el sistema del emprendimiento social!
En febrero del 2017 tenemos que seguir trabajando, inspirando y apoyando a jóvenes  apasionados, que con sus ideas y proyectos pueden aportar al cambio positivo de la sociedad.  Por eso, para el “Wayna Tour de Febrero de 2017”, seleccionaremos a 30 jóvenes, para que, durante 8 días, puedan vivir una experiencia inspiradora y única, de desarrollo personal e innovación. Contamos con las más grandes referencias peruanas de emprendimiento, que compartirán su pasión estos jóvenes de alto potencial
Después de estos días transformacionales, TENEMOS EL RETO DE DARLE EL MEJOR DE LOS SEGUIMIENTOS A LOS PARTICIPANTES Y A SUS PROYECTOS A TRAVÉS DEL PROGRAMA “PRIMEROS PASOS”. Por eso, estamos apuntando a crear una plataforma web que pueda ayudar a los emprendedores al comienzo de sus proyectos. Buscamos implementar un business model viable e innovador, pero necesitamos TU AYUDA para lanzarlo.
Tenemos el reto de potencializar nuestro camino de auto-sostenibilidad. Para poder seguir siendo un actor clave de en la potenciación de proyectos de alto impacto que transformen realidades de todo el país, TE NECESITAMOS PARA PODER SEGUIR HACIENDO EL CAMBIO TODOS JUNTOS.
¡Su participación en esta causa nos beneficiará enormemente !Permitirá a jóvenes de Perú y Colombia desarrollar proyectos para servir y transformar positivamente a la sociedad!
 
About Wiñay Wayna
Wiñay Wayna, which means "forever young" in quechua, is a social enterprise, made up of young people from Peru, Colombia and France. These group of youngsters have dedicated to social entrepreneurship in Latin America, for over a year, being part of the formation of several social projects, having as key players young people from different cities all over Peru. This way, they can develop their potential and talent throughout a transformational journey, where they will create a high-impact project for society.
 
"Wayna Tour Frebruary 2017"
Social Entrepreneurship Tour
Social entrepreneurship is a path peruvians need to consider in order to achieve a positive change in their society. Through various sources, we have found that there are many people wanting to generate sustainable social impact, but they have many barriers to achieve this:

Few people can accomplish their goals of social impact, mainly because there is no space to discuss and learn about the experiences of successful social entrepreneurs.
Many high potential entrepreneurs fail to accomplish their goals due to their lack of self-confidence. Getting know your self is fundamental for this kind of ventures. 
Entrepreneurs need to know how to structure their projects. In absence of a culture of entrepreneurship, people do not know how to grow and achieve sustainability.

 
What’s the impact of this project?
During our first year, we have worked with more than 55 young people (between the ages of 19 and 34), in over 10 cities of Peru, through our three social entrepreneur tours. We work with an innovative educational program based on the "3i methodology”: inspiration, introspection and innovation.
During a transformational journey, the participants experience the 3i methodology which supports them during the formation process of their project, helping them to realize their passion and the social problems that they can and want to resolve. This experience potentiates the optimal development of their creativity, talent, self-esteem, self-confidence and civic identity.
 
What have we achieved so far?

Mentoring more than 120 young people with scalable social projects.
Training more than 15 current projects with high social impact. All of its creators have been part of Wayna Tour.
Orientation to highly scalable social projects. I.E. "EcoBaf" project has been well received by senior investors; "WarmiLab" is part of one of the most important “business incubators” start-ups of the country.
A transformational experience for 60 young people, including participants and coaches.
All direct participants in the tour have manage to increase their self-confidence, creativity and potentiated their talent to perform activities for society.
We have the support of highly recognized peruvian entrepreneurs, such as Vania Masias, Cinepapaya, ASEP, among others.
The community of "Social Entrepreneurship" in Peru has been strengthened by the articulation of different actors (entrepreneurs, investors, incubators, volunteers, etc.).

What are we raising this funds for?
 
TO SUSTAIN THE FULL POTENTIAL OF THE SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP SYSTEM! 
 
On february 2017 we have to continue working, inspiring and passionately supporting youth, with their ideas and projects that can bring positive change in society. So for the "Wayna Tour february 2017", we will select 30 young people who will live an 8-day unique and inspiring experience of personal development and innovation. We have the support of the best entrepreneurial references who can share their passion to young people with high potential.
 
After these transformational days, WE HAVE THE CHALLENGE OF MONITORING THE PARTICIPANTS AND THEIR PROJECTS, THROUGH THE PROGRAM “FIRST STEPS”. Therefore, we are aiming to create a web platform that can help entrepreneurs make their first steps of their project. We seek to implement a viable and innovative business model, but we need your help to launch it.
 
Our challenge is to take a big step into self-sustainability. We need you in order to remain as a key player for propelling high-impact projects that transform realities across the country, so we can continue making change all together.
Your participation in this cause benefit us greatly! It will allow young people from Peru and Colombia develop projects to serve and transform society positively.

story:
Ce projet sera relancé en Février 2017

 

Le hockey subaquatique c'est quoi ?

C'est 2 équipes qui s'affrontent, 6 joueurs de chaque côté du terrain et 4 remplaçants dont l'objectif est de marquer le plus de buts possible dans un temps imparti de 2 mi-temps de 15 minutes en moyenne. Nous somme équipés d'un bonnet de la couleur de notre équipe + notre numéro, d'un gant, d'une crosse, de palmes et d'un tuba! Et tout ça en apnée!

Du 15 au 23 Juillet 2017, nos équipes françaises jeunes de -19 et -23 ans, filles et garçons, vont partir en Tasmanie à Hobart pour tenter de décrocher une médaille. 

Aux derniers championnats mondiaux en 2015, nos jeunes ont brillé et nous ont rapporté 2 médailles: Les filles - 19 ont décroché le bronze tandis que nos garçons -19 ont remporté l'Argent, les garçons -23 finissaient 5ème, une place très prometteuse. 

Cette saison nous avons pour but le podium et donc la plus haute marche avec de l'OR !

La délégation française est fière de porter ses couleurs et de représenter la France lors d'une compétition aussi prestigieuse!

Pour partir à l'aventure, la FFESSM (Fédération Française d'Etude et de Sports Sous Marins) finance une partie des frais, mais ne peut financer la totalité. Pour que nos jeunes puissent profiter de cette expérience au maximum et atteindre leurs objectifs, nous avons besoin de vous pour nous aider à financer ce projet!

Devenez supporters des Equipe de France Jeunes de Hockey subaquatique!

En devenant supporter, vous aidez l'ensemble de la discipline, grâce à vous on entendra davantage parler de notre sport trop peu connu aux yeux de tous.

Grâce à votre participation, nous aurons un soutien financier pour le voyage et l'hébergement mais également cela nous permettra de faire parler de notre sport ! Pour le moment les frais estimer à la charge de chaque joueur sont de 1000€.

Sur les 7500€, environ 1000 à 1500€ seront dédiés à l'achat de maillots de bain. 

Vous pouvez suivre nos évolutions, notre aventure à venir sur les différents réseaux sociaux/média, n'hésitez donc pas à partager notre campagne sur ces mêmes réseaux également !

Mais vous pouvez aussi nous aider si vous connaissez des médias qui pourraient nous soutenir ou d'éventuels sponsors ? Alors envoyer nous un petit message sur : Hockeysubhobart2017@gmail.com

Merci d'avance et on se retrouve l'été prochain pour suivre nos mondiaux !

Ps: suivez nous sur Facebook :

 https://www.facebook.com/Equipes-de-France-de-H...

https://www.facebook.com/Equipe-de-France-U23-f...

 

Merci à nos aînés de nous montrer l'exemple et de nous pousser à faire encore mieux pour vous !

story:
These last 3 years and 4 months, has been an epic challenge, to say the least. 

Travelling and camping in the wild, the vast majority of the time. Overcoming Testicular Cancer.  Pushing myself continuously to the limits, and being broken, from the journey many times.

I've made many friends that have kept me motivated, to find the inspiration for this 2nd album. 

If you can help by supporting a hard working, but still broke street musician, I will be eternally grateful :) Helping can be just sharing my campaign or even a few words of support means a lot to me :) 

Thanks so much in advance :)

story:
My name is Diane Ward and I'm a singer/songwriter based out of South Florida and Nashville. Throughout my music career, I have recorded and independently released 5 albums. For my 6th album, I'm doing things a bit differently and asking ya'll to help make this recording become a reality! My awesome band & I are shooting to record 12 new songs written by yours truly and will also feature a couple of co-writes with some incredible songwriters from my latest Nashville sessions! This will also be another team Ward / Jack Shawde co-production.

  • We got PERKS! They are all listed right here on my Indiegogo page. I will be adding a few more throughout the campaign just to keep things spicy.
  • You can opt-in to get access to the "Diane Ward - New Album Project" Facebook group. It was made to provide you an inside look at the recording process via videos, pictures, demos, and to post updates on the progress of the campaign.
  • Hugs along with my eternally grateful & love-filled heart!

All dollars raised for this project will go directly to PHASE 1 which are the musicians, recording studio, sound engineer, mixologist, mastering, shipping, manufacturing costs, and the Indiegogo platform and processing fees. I do not pay myself nor will my awesome co-producer and friend, Jack Shawde be paid with any of these funds. 

Upon reaching our goal, the love train won't stop there! Ongoing contributions will be used to help go toward PHASE 2 which is promoting the album ie. creating videos, hiring a publicist, social media & print advertising, touring, and the Indiegogo platform and processing fees. Basically, this is what it looks like to be your own record label.

YES! You have the option to simply contribute, buy a perk, or buy a perk for MORE than the asking price at checkout!

I’m going to make this album happen no matter what, but if we don't reach our goal, I’ll reassess what needs to be done to fit into our financial constraints. Hitting our goal, on the other hand, will ensure that quality control is held to the highest of standards established by my past albums, and what my music fans are accustomed receiving. Success also means that from recording to delivery, the entire process will go much more quickly.  We are shooting for an early fall release of this year 2017.

Hopefully, with your awesome help, the success of this project will serve as a continuum of my decades bringing music to the world. <3

If you are unable to pre-order at this time, not to worry! You can still help in many important ways.

  • Direct people to my IndieGoGo campaign page by SHARING THIS PAGE via email, text, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! Here's the direct link: https://igg.me/at/DianeWardMusic or alternatively, you can simply use the wonderful share tools that Indiegogo provides right here on this page.
  • Tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about my project.
  • Tell your friends directly (old school style... offline, over a few cocktails =P).

Thanks so much for checking this all out and for your consideration participating in this campaign. I'm really excited about having you come along for an awesome ride!

With much love & gratitude, Diane

story:
Thank You! 

Many of you contributed to my Quartet Plus here on IndieGoGo back in 2014. Thanks to you, the album featuring original music for quartet and nonet was warmly received by critics and led to great opportunities including a sold out CD release concert, a standing ovation at the 2015 San Jose Jazz Summer Fest, and many other great moments. 

Your support will help fund the follow up to that record, to promote it to a wider audience, and will help make an impact on the Bay Area jazz scene and beyond. 

What did critics say about Quartet Plus? 

"Razavi is a thoughtful player and composer that offers the listener an introspective experience of deeper meaning, his latest offering is mature rendering of masterful playing and ideas. Razavi is definitely one to watch." - H. Allen Williams, Jazz Times

"Razavi's charts are frequently written halfway between Gil Evans and Either/Orchestra . . . his playing, though, tends mainly to the old George Benson School, carefully chosen notes predominating, rather than pyrotechnics and whizbangery" - Mark Tucker, FAME

"Evocative storytelling (of which opener "Moonlit Message" is a prime example) is the hallmark of Razavi's music. So evocative, in fact, that one hardly needs individual track titles to suggest appropriate interpretations." - Tyran Grillo, All About Jazz 

"Remember when you were a youngblood and first discovered Duke Ellington while trashing around in grandpa’s basement.  You heard of Ellington, but the records gramps had kind of amazed you since the music was wonderful but it wasn’t on the charts or familiar and it was your first trip off the beaten path.  Razavi has captured that vibe here. " - Chris Spector, Midwest Record

"Most of all there is the showcase of Razavi as guitar enchanter, a player who picks his notes wisely and comes through with the classicism of Benson, Burrell, maybe Hall, a subtle way but soulful too when he chooses and the music fits it. There's a little boppishness and lots of postbop . . . Mason Razavi is serious! Seriously good. Seriously talented." - Grego Applegate Edwards, Gapplegate Guitar and Bass Blog

Quartet Plus: Volume 2

This record will feature brand new music including pieces debuted at the 2015 San Jose Jazz Summer Fest. There will be original music and a familiar standard or two. Almost all of the players are returning from the previous record, and it will be recorded at the same incredible studio - 25th Street Recording in Oakland, CA - with their team of master engineers. 

Your Support Matters

Your contribution will go towards: 

Musician fees

Recording 

Mixing 

Mastering 

Album art/packaging

Promotion

Contribute How You Can

If you are unable to contribute financially to the project, you can still help out by:

  • Sharing this campaign on Facebook and other social media
  • Forwarding this campaign to anyone you know who is a jazz lover, music lover, or supporter of the arts
  • Follow me on social media

story:
Here's My Story

 

My name is Christina Christian. I picked a guitar up at age 12 but never really got serious about playing until i was 15. My dad was one of my biggest inspirations and he taught me a few southern rock songs and i was hooked. By age 18 i was performing live shows in my home town.  

I have been writing and cowriting my own music for 8 years. I have also been performing live and touring the southeast for the last 6 years. Currently i have logged over 800 live shows and written and cowritten over 100 songs.

 

"Silent Sea" is my debut album featuring 12 of my original songs. I have hand selected some of my best songs with the help of some of my great cowriters. Not only is the album important to me it is also important to my family of cowriters that have helped me along the way. Hearing these songs come to life will be a dream come true for all of us. 


Music should be shared, and this album will be my way of sharing my music with the world. The album will also help fund my tour in 2017. "It's hard out here for a musician!" I've been touring for the passed 6 years without an album. Having a full length album done, to me, feels like a huge step forward into the right direction for my career. We'll be making waves soon enough!
