story:
Short Summary

At the start, Silversyde was just a dream, an idea I had that matched a vision from my youth: An avenue to express myself; the pain i'd suffered, the pain I'd inflicted, and all the brokenness in between through the beautiful whirlwind of music and poetry. A specific type of poetry that could cross generational gaps and penetrate cultural differences, that could be shared in families and enjoyed by young and old alike, but most of all, be relatable!

YOU, our listeners can be passionate about the music we create because we are passionate about it! You can get behind this project because we've gotten behind it, and we have given everything we have to make sure that our albums get into the hands of those drowning in self image issues, to those who are struggling with seeing their self worth, or who have been bullied so much that they are blinded by their own anger, or have turned to self-harm as a way to release their pain.  To those who just lost a parent and are in a pain so real it's suffocating them. These are the broken, the ones our music is designed and crafted for... 

Music has always been an emotional outlet for me, a way to express how I'm feeling. Since we created our first album in 2011, we noticed how our songs struck an emotional chord with our listeners. It was through the healing I was experiencing as I wrote that made the topics so raw and real. I feel as though my healing continues through each new song or lyric we write, and will continue to help me heal along with so many others as long as we have the opportunity to create. 

There is no exception for our new album 'In The Dark'. It's being written and constructed for YOU, your kids, your friends, co-workers, and their families. Together with your help we can leave a mark on lives that will resound through eternity! -Laura 

What We Need & What You Get

Our champaign will span the course of two months (60 days) where we will raise the $15,000 needed to make our full length album. We have a network of professionals who will assist us along the way helping to create 'In The Dark', SILVERSYDE's newest full length album.

We anticipate a mid November 2017 release to give ourselves time to finish the writing process, record demos, track vocals and then record with our team of greats in order to make the best product that we have to date. Of course the summer is reserved for us to tour as we write and test our new material out for YOU! The cost of recording is estimated at $12,000, $1,500 for duplication and disc manufacturing and $1,500 for marketing and unexpected costs.

Along with some awesome items to thank you for your support we will also be offering some one of a kind exclusive perks that you can only receive through this campaign.

With our flexible goal in place all funds received will go to directly to album production as specified above. 

The Impact

Honesty...
Honesty and transparency are the building blocks of what makes our music, well, 'Silversyde'...   So, to keep in theme, lets have a little honesty about this fundraiser. Are we nervous about putting our needs and goal into one platform? Yes! Do we feel intimidated as we take this step towards making an album that will embody the emotion and feeling of our new music and message? Yes!  Are we nervous about the response and support that we may or may not get? Yes. But, we trust in the mission that we've been on; bringing hope to those who are without, bringing a message of healing through the One who has commissioned us to serve a world that is hurting and broken. And to love! Love unabashedly, unashamedly and without remorse.

This album is going to reach deep lyrically, hit hard emotionally, and sonically deliver the refined sound that you know and love from our band with an evolved, modern hard rock edge and thunderous riffs!

Risks & Challenges

As some of you may know, our lead singer Laura and bassist husband Nathan, have recently brought a beautiful baby girl into this world and into our lives. Although touring with an additional member in diapers does pose it's challenges, this new journey is one we will not shy away from. Since we spend the majority of our year on the road touring the country, it makes it harder for us to pause and take time to record a new album and especially fund it.

We thouroghly believe in seasons of life, and more recently, a season of growth. This growth in our band and ministry has only just begun to blossom over the last few years. It has come from years of pursuing a dream we were told was impossible, persevering through personal loss and pain, and persistence when we were told to give up. Though our surroundings and circumstances may change, are "calling" and mission has not. The time and effort we spent on the road ministering to people, sharing our stories and building relationships with people from all walks and faiths is imperative to what we do. The road is hard, thankless and at most times unforgiving, but it makes the progress we see in lives changed worth it, and gives us the strength its going to take to make this new season of life work. Every dime raised towards our goal goes directly to make this album and it's expenses, to change lives and make an impact in this generation!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand more than most that your hard earned money is a priceless commodity, and some of you cannot give in the way you wish you could. If you fall into this category there is hope for sure!

First, know that we covet your thoughts and prayers as we embark on this new journey, and second, we need YOU to help spread the word to your friends, family, and co-workers alike, to help reach our goal today! If a lyric or melody we've created has touched your life in some way, just think of how many others we could reach with your help, and how many more hearts can be touched in the same way! 

So what are you waiting for lets change the world together; one album, one tour and one day at a time! Share this campaign on your social media outlets and let's get started together!
story_txt:
Short Summary
At the start, Silversyde was just a dream, an idea I had that matched a vision from my youth: An avenue to express myself; the pain i'd suffered, the pain I'd inflicted, and all the brokenness in between through the beautiful whirlwind of music and poetry. A specific type of poetry that could cross generational gaps and penetrate cultural differences, that could be shared in families and enjoyed by young and old alike, but most of all, be relatable!
YOU, our listeners can be passionate about the music we create because we are passionate about it! You can get behind this project because we've gotten behind it, and we have given everything we have to make sure that our albums get into the hands of those drowning in self image issues, to those who are struggling with seeing their self worth, or who have been bullied so much that they are blinded by their own anger, or have turned to self-harm as a way to release their pain.  To those who just lost a parent and are in a pain so real it's suffocating them. These are the broken, the ones our music is designed and crafted for... 
Music has always been an emotional outlet for me, a way to express how I'm feeling. Since we created our first album in 2011, we noticed how our songs struck an emotional chord with our listeners. It was through the healing I was experiencing as I wrote that made the topics so raw and real. I feel as though my healing continues through each new song or lyric we write, and will continue to help me heal along with so many others as long as we have the opportunity to create. 
There is no exception for our new album 'In The Dark'. It's being written and constructed for YOU, your kids, your friends, co-workers, and their families. Together with your help we can leave a mark on lives that will resound through eternity! -Laura

story:
Short Summary

We should take value in contributing to positive additions in our communities. 'Still I Rise' is not only a positive contribution, but a necessary one. It calls for peace and love, while drawing attention to problems that still need to be fixed. And youth in the community are part of this project, so you'll be supporting them:

  • About Me: Maurice Conner, from Sacramento, CA. Teacher, activist, DJ & producer.
  • About 'Still I Rise': An art project, culminating in a concert and art display, and positive space for community members, in particular the youth.
  • What Happens: Youth and community members come together in a space promoting love, peace, and unity in a safe environment.
  • What We Need: Funds to rent a venue, and provide other necessities for community members. *All Funds Will Be Going To This Project, No Matter How Many Donations*
  • What You Get: Based on your donation, and location, you can get a free album copy, free show entrance, free clothing, a behind-the-scenes DVD, and more.
  • The Big Outcome: Inspiration. The youth involved will feel and see the support to continue becoming positive members of their communities. The adults involved will be reminded of how important our involvement is within our communities and with our youth. The entire community will see the benefit of having positive events, and come together to make more.

So help us out, that's how #WeAllRise

story:
We are Ohmwork. A power trio from Norway emphasizing great performance - hard hitting drum grooves, thunderous bass, heavy and energetic guitars and vocal lines with great melodies and hooks. The music is characterized as loud and bombastic with an attitude of 'take no prisoners'! This is classic rock merged with metal and a trace of prog!

Ohmwork was established in April 2012, and has already released two albums, one EP and three singles. Over the years we have toured the Norwegian rock circuit multiple times, including support slots for JORN and Bente Smaavik. We have also played a handful of festivals.

In 2017 we'll make our dream come true with a release of a double concept album. It will without a doubt be our biggest achievement to date.

Extreme effort has been made over the past two years. It started with a vague idea of a pirate queen from a sci-fi/steampunk world. It took a year and a half to come up with the storyline, all the lyrics and the music for eleven songs. A fearful challenge where much of it got trashed or altered multiple times before it at last came into place. Four of the songs got recorded already in May 2016, and we released them as an EP in June titled, ‘Mother City’ (as a taste of what's to come…). As for the seven remaining songs we needed more time. After 5-6 months of rehearsing we now feel ready to record. We plan to hit the studio again early in 2017.

This will surely be a unique and groundbreaking release coming from the Norwegian hard rock and metal community! A concept album, packed with great songs telling a story all wrapped into a double LP with spectacular artwork! Maik Beiersdorf, an incredibly talented artist is working on the LP artwork as we speak. The gatefold; front, back and inside will be packed with spectacular artwork from the world of Alyssa Drone! Visit Maik here: https://www.artstation.com/artist/maikbeiersdorf 

There is still a long road ahead before Alyssa Drone can see the light of day. This project only deserves the best that it can get; the songwriting, the musicianship, the engineering, the artwork, the promotion etc. When the mix and master is set and done, the next giant step is to wrap the music into the most awesome double gatefold LP that we can muster. It's in this department we need help from our fans - to fund the artwork design, and the pressing of the 500 LPs. And it will certainly not come cheap. To make the release even more awesome we want to offer our fans the chance of purchasing really cool Alyssa Drone t-shirts.

What We Need & What You Get

To make it happen we need to fund the following:

- Hiring a designer to do the artwork, and make all this into a double LP gatefold. Approximately 1000 $.

- Pressing of 500 copies of double LPs: 4000 $. 

- Printing of 50 t-shirts in different sizes: 1000 $. 

To make this more interesting and fun to fund, we offer you some pretty cool perks: This includes all of our releases (rare ones too!), all of the Ohmwork t-shirts, and more.

We WILL reach our goal! All of the money from you will of course be earmarked for this project ONLY. If we don't reach our goal after 30 days, well..., then we'll have to look at other ways to get the remainder of the funds. To be honest, at the time being, we haven't got a clue what else to do other than this crowdfunding. Maybe, somewhere down the line there are other solutions. Probably time-consuming ways for this project to land. We surely hope that this will not be the case because the timing of Alyssa Drone is really important. We want to do this now, and the hard rock and metal public will love it. Guaranteed. If we have to postpone the release to 2018 or 2019 the whole project will lose its momentum. Let's not hope for that...

The Impact

We are one of those bands who will forever fight to keep the old metal-heart pumping. We want to offer our fans the best possible experience, the escapism into a fantasy world of great storytelling, powerful music and consuming artwork. The incredible feeling of holding a LP in your hands, looking at an insanely cool artwork while playing it on your turntable. And don't forget that lovely smell…  

As mentioned above, Ohmwork has released two albums and one EP over the course of three years. All of them were very well received by the critics. There are no other reasons to except nothing but greatness when Alyssa Drone hit the stores. Here are what some of the critics had to say about ‘ShadowTech’ from 2015:

"This is a good, old fashioned rock album, which is bound to get your feet tapping and head nodding. Big things are expected of these lads." (Classic Rock Society, January 2016 by MC)

 "From 'Burning Question' to 'Veil Of Sanity' and the seven spammers in between, nitrogen is burned up faster than the engines can fill as they fly across everything from Iron Maiden, Sabbath to Slayer back and forth. Frontman/guitarist Anders Rasmussen adds mightily to the mix with authentic seventies British metal range, not to mention his mighty blues soloing..." (Metalliville.com, December 2015 by Dave Attrill)

"You can hear it in their music, sophomore album 'ShadowTech' boasting influences such as Sabbath and Lizzy. And then there's their playing; this is a band full of the kind of swagger that's born of miles on the road and hours in the studio. They're tight, too: the kind of tightness that only three-pieces seem able to muster; the instruments practically breathing together." (Powerplay, October 2015 by Wayne Simmons)

Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks associated with a breathtaking challenge like releasing a double album on vinyl. The biggest hurdle is to come up with the money to pay the designers, the pressing companies, the promoters etc. Another hurdle is to find the right people to work with. We only work with individuals and companies that have a record of delivering great work, and are reliable (keeping deadlines, for example). These individuals and companies are understandable more costly than the average ones… We always strive to give our fans the best possible experience of Ohmwork. Therefore - 'Alyssa Drone' will come with a hefty prize. For that we hope our listeners and fans can help us remove some of the burden.

Ohmwork will sign a new record deal in 2017. The hard rock/metal label, Rob Mules Records will be the perfect place for us the take this band and music to greater heights. The new album will get full backing in terms of marketing, promotion and physical and digital distribution all over the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we still hope you can help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tell your friends! Thanks.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for visiting my campaign page. My name is LitaMarie and I am a Singer/Songwriter that enjoys creating positive music as well as Christian music. I am currently working with D-Major, of Kingdom Reggae Productions to produce my first EP - "READY FOR THIS", to be released this spring 2017. I am very excited about this project and look forward to its completion, but I NEED YOUR HELP!

In order to produce the very best quality ORIGINAL MUSIC, investments must be made. To record/produce and promote this album, and get the reach we need to build our listening audience; (and ultimately grow Kingdom Reggae as a Production company in the UK), requires capital. Projects like this do not come cheap, and the cost of promotion alone is enough to bring the overall project to a halt. Rather than delay this project for another year or more, I decided to reach out to the very people who have been pushing me, and pushing me for years, to do more with my gift. 


When producing Christian Music, the goal differs from that of the "ordinary singer/performer". The music created, has a divine purpose to reach as many people possible. There are people out there in search of something that has the power to heal, encourage, and inspire them. Music is powerful when it is created and influenced from God. It is my belief that my music has the power to change lives; and that the more lives I'm able to reach, the more change I can influence. When I pray, I pray for God to show me how to use my gifts and talents in order to please Him. Being able to create music is more than a vision...this is my purpose.

Testimonies aren't testimonies if they are kept to ourselves. - LitaMarie 


In advance, I would like to thank all those who believe in what Kingdom Reggae and I are doing, and want to be a part of this journey by making a donation. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The total project cost is estimated at £20,000 (25,000 USD). Some of the things we are hoping to cover with these funds are: recording & production costs for all 6 songs, promotion, outreach & resources for the EP as well as select singles, transportation to various locations within the UK, Music videos for selected songs and merchandising. 
  • We are giving investors an opportunity to pre-purchase this album. Not only will you secure your order, but it will provide additional funding towards the production costs etc. 

The Impact

There is a shortage of positive music available, and I want to contribute to changing this.

My gift of writing has touched many, many lives in the past, and I do not doubt that this will only increase with professionalism and promotion lead by spiritual guidance. I have a desire to influence people positively. 

Those who know me, know me to be pretty transparent. I am not perfect, and do not make any claims to be. I am flawed, I struggle to stay on the path God has for me, and fall short more often than i'm proud of. But I love God, and I try my best to rely on Him for guidance; even after my mistakes.

I believe people can better connect with someone who never tries to present themselves as perfect. Someone who can make mistakes publicly without hiding away in shame until they feel they are perfect enough to show their face. Being bold isn't a part of my make-up, but being honest is. Feeling ashamed of things to the point of self destruction isn't my struggle.

What makes me a Christian? I believe in Jesus Christ as Lord, and at the end of my flaws, guilt, mistakes, shame, arrogance, pride or whatever sinful traits are in me; I have a relationship with a God who see's through all of that. I know the ONLY One who is able to make the repairs necessary in my life; and as many times necessary in order to build me up as a person who He can use as a Light in a very dark world. 

Risks & Challenges

If the financial goal isn't met according to our target date, the funds received will remain invested into this project as we continue to find innovative ways to raise additional funds. The lack of funding could have influence on the completion date. The standards of the production will not be lowered to accommodate the limited funds, and the project may be forced to be extended.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone sits in a different place on the financial pyramid. If you are unable to contribute financially, there may be other ways to help.

  • Help to spread the word. Share my music, comment, like and share my updates and any other info I may post pertaining to this project and upcoming promotional material.
  • If you know of investors that may be interested in this project, send them the link to this campaign.
  • Become a follower on Facebook and YouTube so that promoters and sponsors can see I have the support. 

To find out other ways you can help, please email officiallitamarie@gmail.com.

THANK YOU...THANK YOU...THANK YOU!!

When I pray, I pray for God to show me how to use my gifts and talents in order to please Him. Being able to create music is more than a vision...this is my purpose.
Testimonies aren't testimonies if they are kept to ourselves. - LitaMarie 
In advance, I would like to thank all those who believe in what Kingdom Reggae and I are doing, and want to be a part of this journey by making a donation. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

The total project cost is estimated at £20,000 (25,000 USD). Some of the things we are hoping to cover with these funds are: recording & production costs for all 6 songs, promotion, outreach & resources for the EP as well as select singles, transportation to various locations within the UK, Music videos for selected songs and merchandising. 
We are giving investors an opportunity to pre-purchase this album. Not only will you secure your order, but it will provide additional funding towards the production costs etc. 


The Impact
There is a shortage of positive music available, and I want to contribute to changing this.
My gift of writing has touched many, many lives in the past, and I do not doubt that this will only increase with professionalism and promotion lead by spiritual guidance. I have a desire to influence people positively. 
Those who know me, know me to be pretty transparent. I am not perfect, and do not make any claims to be. I am flawed, I struggle to stay on the path God has for me, and fall short more often than i'm proud of. But I love God, and I try my best to rely on Him for guidance; even after my mistakes.
I believe people can better connect with someone who never tries to present themselves as perfect. Someone who can make mistakes publicly without hiding away in shame until they feel they are perfect enough to show their face. Being bold isn't a part of my make-up, but being honest is. Feeling ashamed of things to the point of self destruction isn't my struggle.
What makes me a Christian? I believe in Jesus Christ as Lord, and at the end of my flaws, guilt, mistakes, shame, arrogance, pride or whatever sinful traits are in me; I have a relationship with a God who see's through all of that. I know the ONLY One who is able to make the repairs necessary in my life; and as many times necessary in order to build me up as a person who He can use as a Light in a very dark world. 

Risks & Challenges
If the financial goal isn't met according to our target date, the funds received will remain invested into this project as we continue to find innovative ways to raise additional funds. The lack of funding could have influence on the completion date. The standards of the production will not be lowered to accommodate the limited funds, and the project may be forced to be extended.

Other Ways You Can Help
Everyone sits in a different place on the financial pyramid. If you are unable to contribute financially, there may be other ways to help.

Help to spread the word. Share my music, comment, like and share my updates and any other info I may post pertaining to this project and upcoming promotional material.
If you know of investors that may be interested in this project, send them the link to this campaign.
Become a follower on Facebook and YouTube so that promoters and sponsors can see I have the support. 

To find out other ways you can help, please email officiallitamarie@gmail.com.
THANK YOU...THANK YOU...THANK YOU!!

story:
Hello friends, family, musical reprobates and industry:

I spent some of September 2015 in Nashville, TN for the Americana Music Conference. I saw the strip and bolted in the opposite direction. I fell in love with the East end. Backyard record trades, vintage shops, food trucks and live music in every corner, support for the locals and artistic energy unlike one I've felt before. These were people living on the fringes of country music, abhorring the popular norms and crafting something true and real. Since long before and ever since, modern roots and alt-country have made an impact on my artistic direction in a very noticeable way.

The songs are done, crafted and ready to go. I'm going to send them out to my crack team of musicians and producer. We're going to make an album, my sophomore attempt. It's going to be called "Driving In The Dark", and I couldn't be more excited to FINALLY get into the studio.

The album is being recorded in Lethbridge at the Rebeltone Ranch, home of Leeroy Stagger. I wanted to make the gutsy roots record that's been brewing inside of me in my home province, with some of the best musicians this country has to offer. 

I don't have a label behind me. I have a small amount of grant funding from ATB and I've raised a few greenbacks after sloughing away at my recently former full-time job, but I'm nowhere near my goal yet. Here's a breakdown of the kinds of cost challenges I'm facing:

Recording

  • Musicians
  • Engineering
  • Production / mix / master 
  • Accommodations, travel, per diem

$18,500

Publicity

  • Radio / print / online campaign (executed over 6 months)

$12,000

Pressing

  • Vinyl: 500 copies
  • CD: 1000 copies

$5150

Video (single)

  • Producer / equipment
  • Venue rental

$5300

CD Release Events, Calgary and Edmonton

$800 (not including musicians fees*)

For all of this to happen, plain and simply: I need help. 

The minimum cost for me for a project of this undertaking is nothing short of substantial. Production fees, pressing, mix, master, musicians: that's merely the beginning. Album release, pre-release, video, radio single, graphic design and album layout: the pre-amble. The release night, impending three month tour and hopeful residencies out East: follow up. Showcase opportunities, travel and marketing: doing due diligence. It's an all encompassing meal deal. I've gotten some of the way there, but I need another push. This fundraising isn't just for recording, it's going towards the full meal deal of having something very professional put in your hands and shared all over.

Make no mistake: I'm not riding the pogey-pony of unemployment and waiting for my bank account to fill up, make a record and send it out. It's a fickle feeling opening your hands to the public who already supports so much on a regular basis, especially in my hometown. What I'm hoping for is that this campaign will reach beyond the borders of just Alberta. If you believe in this project even one iota as much as I do, a simple share or like on Facebook, an email to a family friend who might really enjoy this brand of alt-country music, or simply $10 brings me that much closer to my goal. I'm asking you to invest today so that I can give back later.

The amount listed is a flexible goal, meaning I can keep whatever is raised. Rest assured that every penny raised will be accounted for and used to market and produce a quality recording that I can't wait to share with you. This album means so much to me and I'm working so hard to get it ready for my friends, family, supporters and music listeners everywhere.

Take it easy, and if it's real easy: take it twice.

Cheers,
Bucks

story:
Crossing Borders together...I need your support and I am so thankful to know you'll be on this journey with me.

 

 

I was born into a musical family that exposed me to Soul, Funk, Flamenco, Opera and Jazz. While Jazz is my mainstay, I create music that goes beyond conventional parameters and genres. 

It took three years to put this album together. It began when I decided to leave my home country of Spain and moving to NYC. It took time in making the adjustment, but I am now very happy to have made it my home. While here, I have had the honor to work with musicians on this album, that I have admired for many years. - Roby Ameen :Drums,  Jon Cowherd: Piano,  Pepe Rivero: Piano,  Luques Curtis: Upright Bass, Marvin Sewell: Guitar,  Luisito Quintero: Percussions,  Roman Filiu: Sax/ Flute,  Doug Beavers: Trombone, Jonathan Powell: Trumpet, Christian McBride: Upright Bass.

The title track Crossing Borders, was inspired by an event that took place on October 03, 2013, off the southern Italian island Lampedusa, where a boat containing African migrants caught fire and sank. 300 of the passengers had drowned  or were feared dead as a result.

This will be my seventh  album. One that shows my continued growth as an artist, touches on my thoughts and feelings of the world today and sends out positive energy and good vibes for all to enjoy.  

 

 

Cruzando Fronteras juntos!

Necesito vuestro apoyo y estoy muy muy agradecida de saber que estaréis conmigo en este viaje.

 

He crecido expuesta a muchos estilos musicales... (Flamenco, Opera, Boleros, Soul, Funk...) Supongo que mi familia y mis circunstancias han provocado que aunque el Jazz es un componente esencial y prominente en mi música, haya muchos sabores diferentes en mis composiciones. Mi música pretende ir mas allá de los parámetros convencionales de los géneros en sí , podría decirse.

He tardado 3 años en configurar este proyecto. Todo comenzó cuando decidí  dejar Madrid y mudarme a Nueva York. El ajuste me costó algo de tiempo, pero estoy muy contenta de haber conseguido sentirme como en casa. Una vez aquí en NYC he tenido el privilegio de poder trabajar con musicos a los cuales he admirado desde siempre. Roby Ameen : Batería ,  Jon Cowherd: Piano,  Pepe Rivero: Piano,  Luques Curtis: Contrabajo, Marvin Sewell: Guitarra,  Luisito Quintero: Percusión ,  Roman Filiu: Saxo/ Flauta,  Doug Beavers: Trombón , Jonathan Powell: Trompeta,  Christian McBride: Contrabajo.

El título del tema "Crossing Borders", que también es el nombre  del álbum , fue inspirado por un hecho terrible que ocurrió el 3 de Octubre de 2013, cerca de la costa de Lampedusa; donde un barco de emigrantes provenientes de diferentes países Africanos, se incendió y se hundió.

300 pasajeros murieron en la tragedia.

Este álbum sera mi séptimo trabajo. En el encontrarás a la Eva que conoces, con elementos nuevos agregados en estos últimos años y que me han hecho crecer como persona y como artista. Encontrarás mis pensamientos y sentimientos reflejados en las letras y en la música además de mucha mucha energía positiva y combatiente :). Espero que te guste!!! xx

 

How your contributions helps /

Cómo se empleará vuestra ayuda?

 

 Your contributions to this campaign will go towards paying for:

 Vuestra contribución en esta campaña sera destinada a pagar:

  • Studio Time.  
  • Compensation For Musicians.   
  • Mix
  •  Mastering.  
  • CD Production.
  • Graphic Design. 
  • Marketing.

Other Ways You Can Help/ Otras maneras de ayudar

Maybe you are not able to purchase any perks, but you can still make a great contribution in other ways.

  •  Share the page with friends, family, co-workers and the like.
  •  Sharing word about the campaign during a friendly conversation....
  •  Emailing the campaign link to those you believe would be interested in being apart of our journey. 

You are essential !!

Thank you so much for your support!!!!!

 

Quizás no dispongas de dinero para apoyar esta campaña,

pero puedes hacer muchísimo por ayudar!!!! Si compartes esta pagina con familia y amigos facilitas que mas gente la vea lo que será muy veneficioso para el proyecto.

Eres indispensable!!!!!  

Muchísimas gracias por tu apoyo !!!

story: The world of Baroque music is still not fully appreciated in our time, and not well-known by the public at large.  The main reason is that the majority of the scores are unavailable to musicians.  The purpose of this project is therefore to put a large number of Baroque scores online (never previously published), at accessible prices for musicians and music students, and to highlight the value of these musical treasures.  Obviously, it is necessary to undertake a huge amount of research: initially, to track down the original manuscripts, then to edit and correct them - the surviving manuscripts were often created by copyists, and contain errors.  We therefore need to ask for a contribution to our costs, in order to launch this new publishing house that will specialise in Baroque music, whether instrumental or vocal, including in particular the music for castrati. For more information, please visit our website : http://www.lesarchivesbaroques.com/

story:
Will You Be a Friend of the Festival?

We have a grand vision: create a festival to bring together Bluegrass fans and great artists together for several days of musical in Whatcom County.  We have the location: historic Hovander Homestead Park. Now we need to find generous Friends who are willing to pitch in $1,$5,$15 or more to help us bring this vision to life.  

About the Hovander Homestead Bluegrass Festival

The inaugural Hovander Homestead Bluegrass Festival  (HHBFG) is scheduled for Labor Day Weekend, September 2-5, 2016.  This is a fresh new event coming to Whatcom County, WA. In an area that supports many music festivals and a vibrant year-round music scene, the HHBGF will add the excitement and top-notch musicianship of Bluegrass music to the local mix.

The Festival will include:

  •  On-site camping Friday - Monday
  •  Live performances on Saturday and Sunday from 11 am-8 pm
  • National, emerging, and local artists will be featured
  •  Instrument picking contests
  •  Instrument and vocal workshops
  •  Children's entertainment
  •  Bluegrass "jam" areas
  •  Craft and food vendors
  •  And so much more!

In addition to providing a fantastic experience for die-hard bluegrass fans and casual listeners alike, the HHBGF will provide much-needed financial support to local parks, trails, and recreation opportunities in the area.  Proceeds from the Festival will benefit the Whatcom Parks and Recreation Foundation and support improvements to the farm animal contact area at Hovander Homestead Park. 

Fund the Festival

The Festival needs seed money to keep moving forward with our ambitious plans.  With your help on our first fundraising campaign, we will have essential funding to:

  • Get our major contracts in place for stage, lighting, sound, security, etc.
  • Pay deposits to book our wonderful Bluegrass artists
  • Launch our marketing campaign
  • Plan other pre-festival fundraising events in Whatcom County

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can chip in a few dollars or a few hundred dollars, we appreciate your help and support.  Here are a few ways to help the Festival:  

  • Make a donation to the campaign today!
  • Forward the campaign to your friends and family - Indiegogo has great tools to share on your favorite social media platform
  • Follow the Festival on Facebook or visit our website to learn more. Use #hhbgf when posting and sharing.
Thank you,
The Hovander Homestead Bluegrass Festival

story:
ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY: (previously titled Negativland: The Cut-ups)

There is a common thread among certain bands, such as Devo, The Residents and Negativland. Each has approached the notion of a band in unique ways, in a sense redefining what we think of as a band. Each have had critical success in their own way. Each of these groups deconstructs song structure, creating beautiful mind-bending alternatives. These bands use technology as an experimental canvas, where new and older electronics act as brushes. They are as versed in musicality, as well as, multimedia, theater and film. The most important thread among these groups is longevity, each has existed for over 36 years and have never steered from the path of celebrating the unusual for the success associated with commercialism.

I was first introduced to the band when Mark Hosler and Ian Allen approached me after I had just come off stage performing with my band Problemist. This was circa 1982 and a very different world. A year later I started Unsound magazine and Negativland were featured in a number of articles. Fast forward, many years later, and I am making documentaries: The Negativland project is born. With a project of this scope it was important to find a collaborator, and soon Leah Gold and I were working together. Leah and I both relish difference, strangeness and come from an outlier culture. We also both understand the historical significance of Negativland.  

So far we have great footage , which includes recent performances, and extensive interviews with Mark Hosler, Peter Conheim, Don Joyce and David Wills. Also interviews with fans and collaborators, such as, Steve Fisk, Amy Denio, David Minnick. We have access to all of Negativland's archive, so the film will have photos and videos that have never been seen before. 

This campaign exists to help us finish the film. We have it about 1/2 shot, but still have some crucial interviews to do, which constitutes traveling to many locations around the country. We also need to buy more hard drive storage, which is so essential to the editing and archival process. Help us finish this much needed documentary about one of America's greatest bands. 

THE NEGATIVLAND STORY 

(from http://www.negativland.com/news/?page_id=250)

Since 1980, the 4 or 5 or 6 Floptops known as Negativland, a performance and recording group based in the San Francisco Bay Area, have been creating records, CDs, video, fine art, books, radio and live performance using appropriated sounds, images, objects, and text. Mixing original materials and original music with things taken from corporately owned mass culture and the world around them, Negativland re-arranges these found bits and pieces to make them say and suggest things that they never intended to. In doing this kind of cultural archaeology and “culture jamming” (a term they coined way back in 1984), Negativland have been sued twice for copyright infringement.

Over the years Negativland’s “illegal” collage and appropriation-based audio and visual works have touched on many things – pranks, media hoaxes, advertising, media literacy, religion, the evolving art of collage, the bizarre banality of suburban existence, creative anti-corporate activism in a media-saturated and multi-national world, file sharing, intellectual property issues, wacky surrealism, evolving notions of art and ownership and law in a digital age, and artistic and humorous observations of mass media and mass culture.

While it is true that, after being sued, Negativland became more publicly involved in advocating significant reforms of our nation’s copyright laws (more recently finding themselves being brought to Washington DC and Capitol Hill as citizen lobbyists for copyright and art issues), Negativland are artists first and activists second. All of their art and media interventions have intended to pose both serious and silly questions about the nature of sound, media, control, ownership, propaganda and perception in the United States of America. Their work is now referenced and taught in many college courses in the US, has been written about and mentioned in over 150 books (including “No Logo” by Naomi Klein, “Media Virus” by Douglas Rushkoff, and various biographies of the band U2), cited in legal journals, and they often lecture about their work here and in Europe.

THERE'S SO MUCH MORE - visit the Negativland website to learn more about the band: negativland.com

ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS: The Negativland movie is a collaboration between William Davenport and Leah Gold. 

Leah is a Filmmaker, Musician, Radio host, Conceptual, Textural and Performance artist. Her background includes Visual Art, Radio, Music and Video projects throughout the USA and Europe. She studied Dada in Berlin as part of her BA from Evergreen State College and created a Conceptual Art Cookie Company in Portland, Or. as part of her social work helping homeless, at-risk youth. She has made a number of short films that have been screened internationally and has won numerous awards.  Her website: www.vaginajones.com

William Davenport is an independent filmmaker, teacher, writer, interdisciplinary artist and musician. He was the publisher and editor of Unsound magazine from 1983 to 1987. He was also the founder of the innovative band Problemist, who released many recordings internationally, most notably their LP critically acclaimed “Nine Times Sanity”, through the French label Sordide Sentimental. More recently he has worked on many award winning film productions and has shown his work at film festivals around the world. William was the Executive Director of the Autism Social Connection, where he created a unique filmmaking program for teaching social skills to children, teens and adults on the autism spectrum. In 2011 he released the feature documentary “Too Sane for This World”, and 2013 he released “Citizen Autistic”, both films explore the world of autism. Recently he completed three feature documentaries about musical culture, “The New Punks” and “The Great American Cassette Masters” and "Ziners".  He holds advanced degrees in technology, education and art.

His website: http://www.talkstoryfilms.net/


BIG TIME MEDIA QUOTES ABOUT NEGATIVLAND’S WORK THAT MAKE THEM SOUND LEGIT- 

Declared heroic by their peers for refashioning culture into what the group considers to be more honest statements, Negativland suggests that refusing to be original, in the traditional sense, is the only way to make art that has any depth within commodity capitalism…– NEW YORK TIMES

Negativland isn’t just some group of merry pranksters; its art is about tearing apart and reassembling found images, objects, and sounds to create new ones, in an attempt to make social, political and artistic statements. Hilarious and chilling.– THE ONION

It’s an often ignored request, but you may pay more attention to the phrase “Please remember to take all your belongings” after seeing Negativland’s eerily mesmerizing new project…– NEWSWEEK

Negativland is arguably the preeminent audio collage collective of our time.– HI FRUCTOSE

Negativland argues persuasively that creators should be able to appropriate bits and pieces of anything and incorporate then into their work without fear of legal action.– UTNE READER

Negativland, longtime advocates of fair use allowances for pop media collage, are perhaps America’s most skilled plunderers from the detritus of 20th century commercial culture…the band’s latest project is razor sharp, microscopically focused, terribly fun and a bit psychotic.– WIRED MAGAZINE

For more than 20 years, Negativland has earned renown for manipulation of both tape and media.– LOS ANGELES TIMES

Negativland…known for their media pranks….– TIME MAGAZINE

Fearless artistes or foolhardy risk-takers….by constantly haranguing the listener with authentic advertising spiel and highlighting its transparency, they kill the messenger, kill the message and produce highly entertaining art simultaneously.– ART IN AMERICA
story_txt: ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY: (previously titled Negativland: The Cut-ups)There is a common thread among certain bands, such as Devo, The Residents and Negativland. Each has approached the notion of a band in unique ways, in a sense redefining what we think of as a band. Each have had critical success in their own way. Each of these groups deconstructs song structure, creating beautiful mind-bending alternatives. These bands use technology as an experimental canvas, where new and older electronics act as brushes. They are as versed in musicality, as well as, multimedia, theater and film. The most important thread among these groups is longevity, each has existed for over 36 years and have never steered from the path of celebrating the unusual for the success associated with commercialism.I was first introduced to the band when Mark Hosler and Ian Allen approached me after I had just come off stage performing with my band Problemist. This was circa 1982 and a very different world. A year later I started Unsound magazine and Negativland were featured in a number of articles. Fast forward, many years later, and I am making documentaries: The Negativland project is born. With a project of this scope it was important to find a collaborator, and soon Leah Gold and I were working together. Leah and I both relish difference, strangeness and come from an outlier culture. We also both understand the historical significance of Negativland.  So far we have great footage , which includes recent performances, and extensive interviews with Mark Hosler, Peter Conheim, Don Joyce and David Wills. Also interviews with fans and collaborators, such as, Steve Fisk, Amy Denio, David Minnick. We have access to all of Negativland's archive, so the film will have photos and videos that have never been seen before. This campaign exists to help us finish the film. We have it about 1/2 shot, but still have some crucial interviews to do, which constitutes traveling to many locations around the country. We also need to buy more hard drive storage, which is so essential to the editing and archival process. Help us finish this much needed documentary about one of America's greatest bands. THE NEGATIVLAND STORY (from http://www.negativland.com/news/?page_id=250)Since 1980, the 4 or 5 or 6 Floptops known as Negativland, a performance and recording group based in the San Francisco Bay Area, have been creating records, CDs, video, fine art, books, radio and live performance using appropriated sounds, images, objects, and text. Mixing original materials and original music with things taken from corporately owned mass culture and the world around them, Negativland re-arranges these found bits and pieces to make them say and suggest things that they never intended to. In doing this kind of cultural archaeology and “culture jamming” (a term they coined way back in 1984), Negativland have been sued twice for copyright infringement.Over the years Negativland’s “illegal” collage and appropriation-based audio and visual works have touched on many things – pranks, media hoaxes, advertising, media literacy, religion, the evolving art of collage, the bizarre banality of suburban existence, creative anti-corporate activism in a media-saturated and multi-national world, file sharing, intellectual property issues, wacky surrealism, evolving notions of art and ownership and law in a digital age, and artistic and humorous observations of mass media and mass culture.While it is true that, after being sued, Negativland became more publicly involved in advocating significant reforms of our nation’s copyright laws (more recently finding themselves being brought to Washington DC and Capitol Hill as citizen lobbyists for copyright and art issues), Negativland are artists first and activists second. All of their art and media interventions have intended to pose both serious and silly questions about the nature of sound, media, control, ownership, propaganda and perception in the United States of America. Their work is now referenced and taught in many college courses in the US, has been written about and mentioned in over 150 books (including “No Logo” by Naomi Klein, “Media Virus” by Douglas Rushkoff, and various biographies of the band U2), cited in legal journals, and they often lecture about their work here and in Europe.THERE'S SO MUCH MORE - visit the Negativland website to learn more about the band: negativland.comABOUT THE FILMMAKERS: The Negativland movie is a collaboration between William Davenport and Leah Gold. Leah is a Filmmaker, Musician, Radio host, Conceptual, Textural and Performance artist. Her background includes Visual Art, Radio, Music and Video projects throughout the USA and Europe. She studied Dada in Berlin as part of her BA from Evergreen State College and created a Conceptual Art Cookie Company in Portland, Or. as part of her social work helping homeless, at-risk youth. She has made a number of short films that have been screened internationally and has won numerous awards.  Her website: www.vaginajones.comWilliam Davenport is an independent filmmaker, teacher, writer, interdisciplinary artist and musician. He was the publisher and editor of Unsound magazine from 1983 to 1987. He was also the founder of the innovative band Problemist, who released many recordings internationally, most notably their LP critically acclaimed “Nine Times Sanity”, through the French label Sordide Sentimental. More recently he has worked on many award winning film productions and has shown his work at film festivals around the world. William was the Executive Director of the Autism Social Connection, where he created a unique filmmaking program for teaching social skills to children, teens and adults on the autism spectrum. In 2011 he released the feature documentary “Too Sane for This World”, and 2013 he released “Citizen Autistic”, both films explore the world of autism. Recently he completed three feature documentaries about musical culture, “The New Punks” and “The Great American Cassette Masters” and "Ziners".  He holds advanced degrees in technology, education and art.His website: http://www.talkstoryfilms.net/BIG TIME MEDIA QUOTES ABOUT NEGATIVLAND’S WORK THAT MAKE THEM SOUND LEGIT- Declared heroic by their peers for refashioning culture into what the group considers to be more honest statements, Negativland suggests that refusing to be original, in the traditional sense, is the only way to make art that has any depth within commodity capitalism…– NEW YORK TIMESNegativland isn’t just some group of merry pranksters; its art is about tearing apart and reassembling found images, objects, and sounds to create new ones, in an attempt to make social, political and artistic statements. Hilarious and chilling.– THE ONIONIt’s an often ignored request, but you may pay more attention to the phrase “Please remember to take all your belongings” after seeing Negativland’s eerily mesmerizing new project…– NEWSWEEKNegativland is arguably the preeminent audio collage collective of our time.– HI FRUCTOSENegativland argues persuasively that creators should be able to appropriate bits and pieces of anything and incorporate then into their work without fear of legal action.– UTNE READERNegativland, longtime advocates of fair use allowances for pop media collage, are perhaps America’s most skilled plunderers from the detritus of 20th century commercial culture…the band’s latest project is razor sharp, microscopically focused, terribly fun and a bit psychotic.– WIRED MAGAZINEFor more than 20 years, Negativland has earned renown for manipulation of both tape and media.– LOS ANGELES TIMESNegativland…known for their media pranks….– TIME MAGAZINEFearless artistes or foolhardy risk-takers….by constantly haranguing the listener with authentic advertising spiel and highlighting its transparency, they kill the messenger, kill the message and produce highly entertaining art simultaneously.– ART IN AMERICA

story:
Short Summary

  • Sample Station is the result of four young entrepreneurial students, Liam, Dan, Joel and Todd. Our skill sets stem from audio production, web and graphic  design which have all fed into every aspect of what we do.

  • The reason we started this venture is because we are currently unhappy with the packages already in place and we think there is a better way.
  • With your help, we will be able to host the website for a year, have written legal contracts for collaborators and staff and be able to offer third party producers a nominal fee for content. Any remaining money will be used for advertising and sponsoring events which we will be working at, also improving our company reach.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for £1000 to cover website hosting, professionally written legal documents, third party contributors and advertising
  • Our perks are completely unique to Sample Station. Every donation will earn you a thank you on our website with a page displaying the name of every generous individual. While different contributions will earn you different perks, any donation over £5 will earn you a sample collection completely free of charge (usually £9.99).
  • If we don't reach the goal (sad face) then the money will be used to keep the website up and running as this will be the source of our income and point of contact with our customers. The rest can all be done in time and the perks will still be upheld.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you aren't quite ready to help us or you aren't able to contribute, have no fear, you can still help us by sharing our campaign and visiting our social media pages for updates.

 Our perks are completely unique to Sample Station. Every donation will earn you a thank you on our website with a page displaying the name of every generous individual. While different contributions will earn you different perks, any donation over £5 will earn you a sample collection completely free of charge (usually £9.99).

 If we don't reach the goal (sad face) then the money will be used to keep the website up and running as this will be the source of our income and point of contact with our customers. The rest can all be done in time and the perks will still be upheld.    Other Ways You Can Help
  If you aren't quite ready to help us or you aren't able to contribute, have no fear, you can still help us by sharing our campaign and visiting our social media pages for updates.

story:
The Story

If I had to choose three things I'm interested in as an artist, I might say sound, chance and process. In January of this year I had an idea to create a series of soiree-style events centered around ice as a way to draw attention to the connections between artistic processes and geological processes. Before long I became especially interested in one of those events: blocks of ice hang from a support structure and drip onto surfaces of various materials. The surfaces are fitted with microphones and amplified. This was the kernel of what would become thaw.

Soon after, I got a sneak peek at Music for Icebergs, a new album of ambient music by my fellow Rutgers alum Mike Sayre. I was struck not only by the beauty and originality of the music but also by how well it would meld with my budding ice project. Thanks to Mike's inspiring music, it's now become an immersive event with original music scored by myself, dance, painting, and spoken word, featuring some of the best artists I know. 

The Concept

I am interested in sound for sound's sake and in the role chance plays in life and art. In addition to the ice sound-sculpture, my original score for this project will utilize elements of indeterminacy, leaving certain parameters up to the performer. Some timings are exact, others are more free. Some content is prescribed and notated, other content is improvised by the performers.

This event simply wouldn't exist in its current state without Mike Sayre's Music for Icebergs, a 45-minute audio journey through the imagined soundscapes of Antarctica. In Mike's words, it "pays tribute to a place that is transforming before our eyes" due to the terrifying reality of climate change. We hope our art in part fosters conversations about the Earth and our place in it. #ClimateArt

The Event

thaw will be a 90-minute event, divided into two halves. The first half features a playing of Music for Icebergs, in conjunction with the sounds of the melting ice structure. Attendees will be encouraged to inspect the structure up close and reflect on connections to the music while enjoying the summer evening with food and drink. When the album has played through, it will start again to begin the event's second half, but this time the music and ice sounds will occur simultaneously with live music, dance, and spoken word, all created specifically for the event. My goal is to create a multi-dimensional sensory experience that is truly one-of-a-kind.

I am so lucky to have an incredible team of artists working together on this project and we're ready to bring it to life, but we need your help to get there!

What We Need

The event is set to take place Saturday August 12 at a private residence in Beaverton, OR. We need to raise at least $1400 to cover our production costs, equipment rental, processing fees and most importantly, to pay all of the amazing artists involved for their contributions to this collaborative project. This amount makes sure everyone gets paid a nominal fee; any funds that exceed our goal will go directly to our artists in further appreciation of their dedication to their respective crafts and their commitment to making this event a reality.

I think that artists should be the biggest supporters of other artists. Wealthy benefactors can be hard to come by. Who will support us if we don't support each other? If you are an artist, won't you consider contributing? I will happily help promote your latest endeavor on my platform.

The Perks

Be sure to click on the perk you want on the right side of this page! You can also donate without ordering a perk by clicking the "Back It" button.

$25 - Admission to the event! I like the idea of audience members becoming stakeholders in the event they are attending. In addition, I will post a thank you on social media, and if you're an artist, I will happily promote your latest project. Let's help each other!

$50 - All of the above perks plus our very talented painter Phoebe Rivas will create a unique, hand-painted 4x6" postcard, then I'll write you a thank you note and mail it to you!

$100 - All of the above perks plus as a very special thank you, I will write a brand new piece for you! It will be a short work incorporating indeterminacy, and you can even have a say in a few details concerning its creation. Please allow until September for completion of this perk.

Featured Artists

Mike Sayre - composer, sound artist

Matt Cichon - dancer, choreographer

Phoebe Rivas - painter

Bri Nelson - poet, speaker

Rebecca Olason - musician (horn)

Alexis Mahler - musician (cello)

Grayson Fiske - musician (percussion)

Justin Bulava - event designer, composer, musician (clarinet and percussion)

Thank you for your support!

I already appreciate your support just for reading our story. Even if you can't contribute, please share this page with your friends and family and help us bring this one-of-a-kind event to life.

Thank you!

Justin Bulava

 

Music for Icebergs: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/music-for-ice...

story:
What I do as a musician:

  • Why do we need to label music? Labels tell us for whom and to what purpose a product is intended but music, like air and water, should be for everyone. Early in my career I was labelled a “classical” saxophone performer. I later became interested in contemporary composition and was then labelled then a “young” composer. However, by developing my skills in both fields, I shed both labels to create a synergy between my technical ability as a performer on the saxophone and my creativity as a composer. Within this context, I use my knowledge of saxophone technique to exploit the instrument to its full potential and then benefit from exclusive new repertoire that’s tailored to my specifications and ability. 
  • After fifteen year of composing, my works have been performed in Canada, the United States, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Germany, Russia, Brazil and South Korea and have received accolades from the performers and the audience alike. Despite all this success, there are still no professional studio recordings of my saxophone music available for purchase. It's time to change this.

Where I am and what I need :

  • My project is already partially funded by the Ontario Arts Council and, according to their guidelines, I must complete it this year or I have to return the funding. There is basically no risk of this project not being completed. All the pieces we're recording have been rehearsed, the producer, a recording engineer, the additional musicians and the recording studio have all been booked and we start recording August 4th 2017. This is all fantastic but, I need an additional $3000 to cover the post-recording costs associated to mastering, graphic design and manufacturing.

What I'm recording:

With your help, I'll be recording the following works:

  • Tango à trois, composed in 2006 for violin, alto saxophone and piano
  • Rhapsodie en hommage à Debussy, composed in 2012 for clarinet, alto saxophone and piano
  • Through the Ethereal Gate, composed in 2015 for soprano saxophone/theremin
  • On the Shores of Eternity, composed in 2017 for soprano saxophone/theremin
  • Twelve Tone Rag, composed in 2014 for alto saxophone and piano
  • Élégie automnale, composed in 2014 for soprano saxophone and piano
  • Trio concertant, composed in 2009 for violin, alto saxophone and piano
  • The Four Elements, composed in 2014 for solo alto saxophone

What you get:

    • I don't see this campaign as begging for your money. I'm offering you the opportunity to invest in advertisement, reserve a signed copy of my CD for the price it will cost once it's printed and acquire a limited reproduction of a manuscript of a historically important work.  As a backer you will have access to the following unique perks:
      • Tier 1: For a donation of $5 your name will be added to the list of benefactors on my website. If you desire, I will also enable a hyperlink on your name so that visitors to my web page can click on your name and consult your website. Donations under the $25 mark are appreciated but do not get you a copy of the CD.
      • Tier 2: For a donation of $25 you will receive an autographed copy of The Road to the Ethereal Gate CD, the project for which I'm running this campaign. You will also get the perks from Tier 1.
      • Tier 3: For a donation of $100, you will receive a framed facsimile of a handwritten page of my composition Though the Ethereal Gate with a signed and personalized message thanking you. This makes an excellent conversation piece and is a wonderful decoration for your office, your study or your living room. You will also get the perks from Tier 2 and Tier 1.
      • If I do not reach the goal of $3000, I will use the funds raised during the campaign towards my project and I will keep looking for other sources of funding. All backers will receive all the perks to which they are entitled regardless of the outcome of the campaign.

    Your Impact:

    • Beyond the entertainment value of the music I will record, this project has a massive impact on my career and Canadian music. This recording will not only help with the visibility of my performance and compositions, but will have an exponential impact on the sale of my sheet music. This recording will be used by institutions such as the Canadian Music Centre who will promote the CD and the sheet music it publishes. This CD will also serve as a reference recording for all the saxophone players interested in new Canadian repertoire.
    • In short, this project is happening. There will be a professionally recorded CD of my compositions released through the Canadian Music Centre's Centrediscs label in late 2017- early 2018. The question is: Do you want to be part of it and how much do you want to help?

story:
Hola, soy Leslie Patten, multi-instrumentista, compositora y arreglista peruana, con más de 20 años dedicada a la difusión de nuestra música peruana y latinoamericana.    Vengo conduciendo varias propuestas musicales, como el proyecto SANDUNGA de recuperación, desarrollo y difusión de la música afro-peruana y sus vínculos con otras expresiones afro-latinas, que se plasmó en el cd SANDUNGA, Cantan los Tambores;  la conducción del conjunto KALIMBÁ en el cual se combina la participación de niños junto a reconocidos músicos del medio, interpretando ritmos criollos, afroperuanos y andinos en torno a composiciones propias y composiciones colectivas hechas con los propios chicos;  y, entre otras, el proyecto FESTEJO que combina música, danzas y zapateo afro-peruano, con percusiones en vivo sustentadas en una base musical electroacústica especialmente compuesta para ello.   A ello se suma la formación de niños, jóvenes y adultos de todas las edades, tarea en la cual doy énfasis a la revaloración de nuestra tradición musical.

Dentro de esta tradición, en el Perú el 31 de octubre celebramos el Día de la Canción Criolla,  lo que conlleva una difusión más amplia de nuestra música a lo largo de todo el més.  Pero en los últimos años, esta festividad ha contado con una decreciente participación de la población más joven, que se ha venido sintiendo cada vez más atraída por una fiesta foránea como es el Halloween, que les resulta más divertida en tanto combina disfraces, maquillaje y confites.

Cómo cultora de la música peruana y educadora musical, no he podido dar la espalda a esta situación y vengo trabajando ya hace varios años en la integración de ambas festividades, componiendo y compartiendo con mis alumnos canciones habitadas por fantasmas, brujas, vampiros y demás, a ritmo de vals, polca, festejo, tondero o marinera.

El resultado ha sido la creación de un divertido conjunto de composiciones propias y arreglos en aires peruanos de un par de temas de otros compositores latinoamericanos.  Niños y jóvenes amarán estas nuevas canciones donde las brujas son jaraneras y los fantasmas, vampiros y demás personajes del Jalogüín tocan el cajón peruano, las cucharas, la cajita, la quijada, la guitarra criolla e, incluso, el charango andino, entre otros.  

Son 13 las canciones incluidas en el disco, las mismas que ya han sido grabadas con la participación de reconocidos músicos peruanos.  Así, con mucha dedicación y entusiasmo hemos podido completar las dos primeras etapas: la de pre-producción (diseño, selección y arreglos) y de producción (grabación de voces e instrumentos); quedándonos pendientes las tareas de la etapa de post-producción.  

La campaña que lanzamos a través de INDIEGOGO nos permitirá culminar estas tareas,  para lo cual esperamos contar con la colaboración de ustedes.  De esta forma, todos juntos haremos realidad esta propuesta en la hemos puesto tanta alegría, creatividad y amor a lo nuestro.   ¡Contamos con ustedes!

Estoy segura que con los fondos recaudados, podremos asumir la post-producción, incluyendo:

  • Mezcla del material grabado
  • Masterización
  • Arte, diseño gráfico e impresión de tapas
  • Multicopiado y estampado de los discos

¡Muchas gracias por ser parte de este CD y del esfuerzo por revalorar lo nuestro entre las nuevas generaciones!

story:
Who Am I ? I'll Tell Ya:

For those of you who don't know me I'm Twinkle -I'm a Bilingual Kindie Rocker for Kids!  I'm super lucky to tour the nation  rocking it out TWINKLE TIME style with my band!  With over 200 shows a year performing in schools,libraries,malls,fairs,performing art centers,festivals and so much more! I have 2 albums currently out TwinkleTime and Made In The U.S.A. (neither album had  a marketing campaign behind them)

Why you ask ???? O.k. ....fine ill tell ya....MORE back story.....Meet Twinkle's alter ego Alitzah "like Pizza"...

Back Story: 

I grew up in show business performing at the young age of eight in numerous musical productions, voiceovers,and commercials. As a tween,I became a series regular in the first Spanish family comedy Sanchez of Bel Air for the USA network and recurred on NBC's My 2 Dads.

I also formed a girl band after high school called Nobody's Angel, we were signed to Hollywood Records.Releasing our debut album in 2000, opening up for Britney Spears and The Backstreet Boys and sang on movie soundtracks like ParentTrap, Pokemon, The Wedding Planner and 102 Dalmations. In 2002, we earned our very first gold record for two of our songs on the Princess Diaries soundtrack.

SO, from my experience I always  thought the ONLY time you hire a marketing and pr firm  is when you have a network tv show or are signed to a major label. After releasing two albums and learning that most of my fellow indie kindie artists actually are ALL paying for marketing and pr I was like WHOA! Who Knew?

I must say, Im super proud of both amazing albums that were released and a HUGE shout out  to ALL the families who have been supporting me from day one because of all the families and kids who have attended my Live Concerts they are the ones who helped me grow to the masses, they are the ones who spread the word and who opened doors for me !

How it all began for Twinkle Time:

In 2007 -I  had this vision this dream of being a musical artist for kids and teaching kids positive messages through song and dance. I said to myself I want to be like Oprah for the children's market ! I realized that kids and parents were listening to the same kid songs that I grew up with. I wanted to hear new sounds,introduce a whole new vibe to the kindie world! 

From my vision in 2007 it took over a year for me to finish  writing songs with hubby James Dallas (Former Lead Singer Songwriter-Producer of Boy Band Youngstown who was also once signed to Hollywood Records) to actually putting my show up on its feet.

Twinkle Time is a Family Affair !

As Twinkle I made my first television appearance on FOX LA morning news in April of 2009 which caught the eye of Main Stream Music on Warner Music,which then signed me to a distribution deal only -What does that mean- they basically pressed the album for me (NO marketing dollars or budgets)  I as an indie artist  with two pennies to rub together now just became the record company,booking agent,pr,social media director,producer and artist all rolled into one. In November 2009, Twinkle's debut CD Twinkle Time was released.

May 2010 I was featured in a national commercial for Toyota as Twinkle which helped to bring funds to produce some online content and purchase music gear for my local shows to continue building and growing Twinkle Time.

I released  my second CD, Made In The USA, in 2012. (STILL no marketing dollars) The album won two Global Music Awards for Best Children's Song ("Made In The U.S.A") and Best Children's Album.

From performing my live shows in LosAngeles I caught the eye of an executive in  2013 that was able to place my new music videos in the children’s clothing retailer Gymboree and Crazy 8, resulting in my music videos streaming in more than 1,200 stores worldwide. In addition was honored when National Council of La Raza (NCLR)asked me to be a brand ambassador and perform for their Family Expo in New Orleans.

Thats when we started our first Indie Go Go to help raise funds to bring us to New Orleans, LA

(We totally hit our goal THANKS to ALL of you!)

As my Live Touring show started to grow in 2013 I have since appeared on CNN Espanol, Telemundo, Azteca TV, WGNO- ABC ,Univison and KTLA and was interviewed on LA's #1 radio station 102.7 KISS FM.

In  March 2015, I was super stoked to  be able to write the song KIDZ ROCK with a long time producer friend Emmy award winning song writer Matthew Gerrard he wrote the theme songs for Hannah Montana, both High School Musicals and  Dora the Explorer and so much more.The big plan was to have the 3rd album  released in late fall of 2015 or at the beginning of 2016.  I had a huge deal that ended up falling through (Waa,Waa,Waa) SOOOOO.....most people would've thrown in the towel but not me!  "A winner never quits and quitter never wins! You just gotta DREAM BIG and NEVER GIVE UP!" Thats my motto.

Im like that little engine that could...I totally believe in what I do, I believe in keeping music,arts and education alive.The best thing I hear from parents is that I'm their kids first introduction to music and that even the adults can rock out to TWINKLE TIME!

Since 2015  we have been touring the nation, growing our fan base one city at a time with over 200 shows a year headlining at performing art centers,state fairs,Legoland and more!

The Big Picture- Drum Roll

I have a 3rd album waiting in the wings to be released in both English and Spanish(I'm Peruvian-American)  

That's why I'm here folks ... cause being an indie artist /record company rolled into one is not easy!  As we all know, major labels have major pockets  to promote artists and their albums to the masses with all the right accoutrements to release everything simultaneously with most importantly a marketing  and  pr campaign!

Let me tell ya  it ain't cheap!

To complete an Album :

*Mix and Master *

*Photography and Art work design*  

*Press the album  *

*Copyright*

(only a few of the things one has to do)

Music Videos 

*Choreography*

*Glam Squad ( uber important- HELLO)*

*Director*

*Cinematographer*

*Location/Camera Equipment/ Lights/*

*Editor*

Webisodes

Our  10 min - 15 min webisodes  usually  are 2 day  12 hr shoot days

*Choreography*

*Glam Squad ( uber important- HELLO)*

*Director*

*Cinematographer*

*Location/ Camera Equipment/ Lights/*

*Editor*

*Props*

*Sets*

*Animator*

*Green screen expert* (To key in my awesome ORANGE hair-OH they love all my colors lol NOT!)

To pay ALL my peeps for their time! (You can only pull so many favors in a life time)

Pr / Marketing Campaign 

TO FINALLY HIRE  A  FIRM!!!!! -NO LONGER MYSELF !!!

If your not in show business  PR/Marketing firms can be  anywhere from  1,500 to 3,000 a MONTH~

(Hence this is why I never in a million years thought that my fellow indie  kindie artists were paying for this service) BUT we are all brands and their is a reason why its called Show Business ! You're investing in yourself and your product to reach the masses.

What does this include you may ask? Well, from someone who has been doing her own PR this entire time and being an artist on the road  ALL the time its SO much work. Did I say its a lot of work ?!!

You are constantly writing and emailing press releases, pitching  over the phone to everyone that will pick up the phone putting together media kits and SO much more!

To actually hire a firm will be something Ive been praying for since day one.

It will give me more time to be an artist and be creative.

 So many parents, teens and kids all over the nation  have  been saying we want to see more webisodes, more music videos ..... well, here is your chance to be  a part of our 3rd Album,our NEW music videos, and webisodes !

 

We need YOU!

We want YOU to be a part of the process in helping to grow TWINKLE TIME globally!

Since I'm the C.E.O. of Twinkle Time Records/Production Comp. you all will be like  my A&R  team, social media team, street teams etc.

I set our goal at a number... a flexible one .Now, technically to do all things mentioned in that number we'll have to budget very carefully but I have an awesome track record cause I literally started Twinkle Time with pennies and a red cd player.  

Its because of all of you that I've been fortunate to live my dream .

Lets keep building this on our own together you and I ...cause  the next dream would be to take this to digital platforms and be like HEY .... Here is your NEXT hit album and family TV show ! It's all done,completed,you just have to distribute it!!!

Think of me like Chance the Rapper in the Kindie World (Except with orange hair and a tutu) LOL

In a build it yourself world..I've laid the foundation but it takes a village to raise the roof! WOOT WOOT!

Every like,comment and share on social media truly does helps me big time!

Spreading the word  and supporting me means the world !

Every little bit will add up to make TwinkleTime SHINE!!

 

So Cmon Everyone Lets Do It!!!

Big Hugs and Tons of LOVE!

story:
English Below

Apres la sortie de notre nouveau maxi " Raw Fucking Power"  , il est emportant  pour nous de passer à l'étape suivante et de partir sur les routes à la rencontre de notre public.
Totalement indépendant jusqu'a maintenant ,nous avons toujours effectuer les démarches de recherches de dates seul avec plus ou moins de succès.
Mais trouver des dates est un metier et aujourd'hui nous souhaitons intégrer une agence de booking afin que notre musique soit proposer aux plus grands événements et festivals.
Nous avons démarcher de nombreuses agences et avons sélectionné une d'entre elle.
Mais comme tout dans la vie, cela à un cout.
Nous recherchons donc aujourd'hui un financement afin de pouvoir collaborer avec cette agence durant 2 ans.

Cet argent permettra de rémunérer un agent qui effectuera l'ensemble des démarches de recherches de dates à notre place par le biais de son réseau et continuer notre professionnalisation dans ce domaine.

English

After the release of our new maxi "Raw Fucking Power", it is important for us to go to the next step and  go on the roads to meet our audience.
Totally independent since always , we always carry out the searches of dates alone with more or less success.
But finding dates is a business and today we want to integrate a booking agency so that our music is offered to the biggest events and festivals.
We have contact se real agency  and have selected one of them.
But like everything in life, this at a cost.
We are now looking for funding to work with this agency for 2 years.

This money will make it possible to remunerate an agent who will carry out all the searches of dates in our place through his network and continue our professionalisation in this field.
