This money will make it possible to remunerate an agent who will carry out all the searches of dates in our place through his network and continue our professionalisation in this field.

story:
Since my first performance in Stroud I have been in love with the town, it's people and the art community thriving there. 

I've had this idea of releasing a limited edition vinyl accompanied by a music video shot in Stroud on my mind for a long time. This campaign will help me achieve exactly what I have created in my mind - A 10" Limited Edition Vinyl + a Music Video that *feels like Stroud*.

(Photo - Screenshot from the music video)

Summary:

I want to produce a 10" vinyl single (X2 tracks : 1 song either side - Side A. Vocal version // Side B. Instrumental) that is going to look and sound beautiful. With this campaign, it will enable me to do just that. The final release will have hand-drawn pencil drawings on double sided artwork on the record sleeve as well as CLEAR vinyl and text on the spine so you can find it on your shelf (I've lost count of how many records I have misplaced over the years because there is no text on the side ('spine') of the artwork!)

With your help I will be able to get excellent artwork, sound production and pressing rather than producing a black vinyl, with no artwork and a sound that doesn't quite cut it. 

I just want to cover costs and MAKE IT HAPPEN :) The bulk of the campaign cost is solely to have the physical vinyl pressed.

(Photo - Screenshot from the music video)

Costings Breakdown:

1. Vinyl pressing and production (£1550) :

[10" CUTTING & PRODUCTION OF METALWORK (2 SIDES) 5 X TEST PRESSINGS 200 10" STANDARD WEIGHT (110G) VINYL - #14 FROSTED CLEAR
200 LABELS (1/0 K)
200 BLACK PAPER INNERS - 2 HOLES (WHITE INSIDE)
200 OUTER SLEEVES (1/0 K) 300GSM WHITE/WHITE CARD WITH GLOSS MACHINE VARNISH 200 3.5MM SPINE

200 SLEEVING/INSERTION
200 SHRINK-WRAP
200 BOXED AND DELIVERED

+ MASTERING X2 TRACKS

Total Breakdown:

  1. Vinyl Pressing + Mastering : £1550
  2. Music Video - expenses for travel to and from Stroud + production time : £300
  3. Hand Drawn Sleeve Artwork + labels : £100
  4. Music Production / Recording / Songwriting : £0 (all fulfilled by myself)

TOTAL - £1950

(Photo - Screenshot from the music video)

How you can get involved:

Hopefully the perks sound reasonable and fair in pricing :) I really like the idea of people who contribute to having their names credited in music videos and on artwork supplied with vinyl, so here's a chance to be credited at the end of the music video... or BOTH! I also love doing house shows, so if anyone out there wants The Uplifter in their front room, garden (or any venue)... I'm all yours! I've printed a whole heap of merchandise to coincide with this crowdfunding campaign. The prints have come out lovely : on the Tshirts, mugs and bags :)

Stroud - A town worth visiting:

For those of you who are not familiar with the town of Stroud (I recommend a visit to the town and an event at SVA (Stroud Valley Artspace), there will be a purely instrumental version of the tune on Side B.

(Photo - Screenshot from the music video)

Release date & when your vinyl will arrive:

I have pressed vinyl before and know too well that things do not always go exactly to plan with pressings and artwork... So with this in mind, once (and only then) the finished product is in my hands I will book in a show at Stroud Valley Artspace as the official record launch. They've given the big thumbs up and I'd love you to be there. I am aiming to have these dispatched and on their way by Christmas.

Don't have a record player?

Perhaps this record could be the first of your record collection :) I remember my first record deck, it's still going strong as well as the records I bought with it... I love all formats of listening: CDs, Cassettes, Digital downloads but vinyl has to be right up there as my favourite way to experience music. Especially clear vinyl. 

(Photo - Screenshot from the music video)

Any help is very much appreciated:

Whether you can contribute or not to the campaign, any help sharing the link and spreading the word would be wonderful...

Thank You. Really, it means a lot. 

Tom x

http://www.theuplifter.co.uk

I've had this idea of releasing a limited edition vinyl accompanied by a music video shot in Stroud on my mind for a long time. This campaign will help me achieve exactly what I have created in my mind - A 10" Limited Edition Vinyl + a Music Video that *feels like Stroud*.

story:
Music and people are things that make me smile the most. As a 25 year old Brazilian American lass who grew up in Mississippi, it's been my absolute dream to bring sunshine to people's broken lives and social change to the young generations of the darkened world. 

Coming from a large multicultural family of 6 kids, we were always jamming out music together with whatever instruments and props we could find. I began writing music from the age of 8 and knew it was part of my calling. I've now traveled to over 15 countries including Bulgaria, Dominica, New Zealand and England, to name a few. I've been so honored to traverse with my music, playing to young and old singing heartfelt songs and speaking motivational words. My music is said to be "life-affirming", "sunshine to my soul", "organic and raw", "vulnerable and melodic". It infuses acoustic roots, ukulele based folk, and soul-pop melodies. 

After traveling back to Brazil for multiple family trips and mission endeavors, my heart for my Brazilian home grew larger and larger.  Te amo muitoooo familiaaa e amigos! Meu coração sempre esta com vcs. Abs e bjs pra tudo mundo!!!  I began to see poverty and misplacement on every other corner and knew that there was something I could do about it. A dream and calling was being birthed within me. If I could make music and have profits that could benefit hungry, fatherless and uneducated boys and girls, then my love cup would be full!

So, now is the time. I am embracing my purpose in life, creating art that is producing social enhancement and healing in the country I care about the most. 

I moved to Sydney, Australia and brought with me 40 songs. My producer (Billy Otto) and I chose 10 songs that we feel are fitting for this album. I desire that the profits of this album would go towards the non-profit organization that I founded this year. 

Here's a run-down of the non-profit I've established: 

 Project LEO (Loving Everyone Openly), the name is short for Leonardo - a young child in Brasil I was able to help. The movement and mission is about helping the disadvantaged and displaced children of Brazil. We aim to raise funds for orphanages & safe houses, serving children by "embedding value, instilling hope, and inspiring futures".  Project LEO has been donated land by several state governors and is in the process of becoming an official non-profit organization.

The Brazilian officials have recognized the need of what I'm offering in aid. Thus, they have been so generous with offering up land in areas of great need, especially in Pernambuco.

With fatherlessness, child abuse, malnutrition and all-round poverty on the rise, Project LEO needs sustainable financial support to make it happen. My music is one of the major vehicles for providing fund flow into the healing hand of Project LEO.

 

"Judy’s super-bubbly personality and authentic way of expressing her faith will resonate with the young people. She sang a couple of her originals for me with her ukulele and they’re faith-filled, vulnerable and sometimes fun songs in a much more contemporary folk style. Many of the songs come with a story of the challenges or answers to prayer that inspired them."

Kent Kingston HOPE CHANNEL SOUTH PACIFIC

 

What We Need & What You Get

It takes so much time and effort and heart to create a full length album. I really don’t care about that – I love doing this – but unfortunately it also costs quite some dollars. There are costs for renting a studio, paying the musicians, paying the mixing and master engineers, artwork, pressing the album, promoting it etc. Let me show you:

AUDIO 

Preproduction, tracking/Recording $7500

Studio hire, musician hire, random expenses (petrol, studio food.) $1180

Mixing $970

Mastering $550

Total = $10,200

GRAPHIC DESIGN 

For album art, shirts, and website. We will be working with Melbourne designer Wes Hendricks. 

$1400

ONLINE PUBLISHING 

Yes, putting your songs on iTunes and Spotify costs money! 

$65 

PRINTING CDS (first batch) 

Manufactured by Media Movers (Sydney). 

$1100 

PRINTING ETHICAL ORGANIC SHIRTS AND TOTE BAGS (first batch) 

Manufactured by Organic Tees http://www.organictees.com.au/ep03-slim-fit.html

$950 

WEBSITE 

$1300

MUSIC VIDEO 

$800 

The Impact

When I commit to something, I give it my whole heart. You speak to anyone who has worked with me in Brazil or in American summer camps, I'm all in! 

The quicker we can get the desired funds the faster I can move with getting the recording done. 

If we don't reach the full financial target, I will still make an album. However the quality will not be the standard we are wanting, and the duration of production will most definitely be prolonged. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It would also be really helpful if you tell your friends about this campaign or, even better, share it on social media. 

Thank you so much in advance for your support!

 

How do I claim a perk?

Review the list of perks on the right-side of the campaign page. When you see a particular perk on the campaign page that you're interested in, click on the perk itself. This will have selected the perk for you to continue with the contribution check out process. 

When will I receive my perk?

You will receive all physical perks at the beginning of September. However, the digital download of the new album will be distributed to you mid August 2017.

Can I choose T-shirt size?

Yes, you can. I offer 'normal' shirts and girly shirts. All can be ordered in sizes Small, Medium, Large and Xtra Large.

How can I pay?

You can only pay with creditcard these days. Unfortunately, IndieGoGo took down the Paypal option last February.

 

Live long and prosper! 

Love Juju xx abs e bjs

story:
Hi everyone!

The official IndieGoGo campaign has ended! If you're just finding this and want to support the project, please go to: http://www.tanyapluth.com 

I believe in music as a tool for social change and healing. My first album, Saving Graces, explored themes of family, inheritance, and place in society.

I didn’t expect my next album to have a theme, but then, 5 years ago, I had an idea: what would I find if I zeroed in on masculinity, and expressed what I found through music? The question led me on a journey, and the result is my sophomore album, All the Men I Love.

Songs from a broad range of styles and messaging.

For All the Men I Love, I carefully chose songs and artists whose work reflects an aspect of masculinity that I value, or that I’ve adopted and reflected in my own life. From the love songs of George Michael and Cat Stevens, to the protest songs of Poison, and Stevie Wonder, the album travels through broad styles and messages. Recorded in an intimate setting, the album is built to sound like I am playing in your living room.

Join me in sharing messages of love and protest. 

I’m asking for $6000 to cover the cost of finishing the album. Funds raised through this IndieGoGo campaign will be used for final production (mixing, mastering, and session musicians), pressing (design, CD pressing) and promotion (publicity, booking agent, marketing) associated with releasing the album. 

I will apply all funds to final production, but cut back on promotion if I don’t reach the goal, If my goal is met and exceeded, the additional funds will provide the freedom to choose high quality eco-packaging for physical CD’s, to create videos of songs, and to play as many live shows as I can across the U.S. 

I want to thank you, so I've created the best perk packages ever!

Where else can you find a music crowd funding campaign where the musician offers to pick out a crystal for you or send original nature photographs? Other perks include: t-shirts, signed CD’s, hand-written thank you notes, songwriting coaching, the guitar I used during recording, and more! If you’d like to combine parts of one of the packages to create your own, I’d be happy to do that! Just send me a note.

Yes, any bit of help makes a difference to me. 

It’s true that I do a lot of work as a lone wolf. But every wolf needs a pack. I am asking for your help to spread the word and financially support All the Men I Love. If you don't have funds available to donate, you can: 

  • Get the word out! Share my IndieGoGo page with your networks. 
  • Translate your talents and skills into support for the album. Do you have a unique skill or some time available to contribute? Lets talk!

Thank you! I feel so excited to share this project with you. 

Tanya

story:
DREAMER

I am so excited to share this EP with you. Musically and conceptually I think it is my best, most diverse writing. In order to do this however, I need your help. That is why I have decided to launch a crowd fund campaign so that I can finish mixing and mastering the songs and take care of other release costs. I wanted to offer you something in return for your help so I will be producing a line of merch and some other material in return for your support. Feel free to explore the campaign and check out the "Perks" section for details.

In order to do this however, I need your help. That is why I have decided to launch a crowd fund campaign so that I can finish mixing and mastering the songs and take care of other release costs. I wanted to offer you something in return for your help so I will be producing a line of merch and some other material in return for your support. Feel free to explore the campaign and check out the "Perks" section for details.

story:
Nuestro sueño

A través de mi arte, me encantaría inspirar a otras personas a compartir su amor y pasión por la música, a perder el miedo a seguir sueños y a luchar por lo que uno quiere. Me gustaría abrir las puertas a la gente de mi país, Guatemala, y a la gente alrededor del mundo a compartir la pasión y buenas vibras que la música siempre tiene para dar. 

"No Sé De Donde Soy": El E.P

Con la ayuda de mis amigos, músicos y gente que me ha ayudado a través de mi vida fui capaz de encontrarme como músico y compositor. Gracias a ello, logré plasmar todo en un EP que será lanzado próximamente con la ayuda y el apoyo de maestros, compañeros de universidad que me ayudaron a grabar y producir las canciones de mi E.P. Este verano estaremos sacando dos singles, "Madrid" y "No Sé De Donde Soy". Aunque he tenido mucho apoyo de bastante gente, ahora me toca pedir su soporte para ayudarme a materializar mi sueño y ayudarme a empezar mi carrera musical. 

Cómo apoyar mi sueño

El presupuesto que se ha propuesto contiene los gastos necesarios para que el proyecto empiece de una manera satisfactoria. Vamos a estar viajando, tocando, grabando y presentando públicamente el proyecto en la mayoría de los países que vamos a visitar: México, España, EEUU, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica, y Honduras. En todos estos países ya tenemos conciertos, entrevistas de radio, grabación de videoclips y otros eventos organizados por tal de que se escuche nuestra música. 

He abierto mi corazón, mis sueños, y mi carrera a ustedes. Si están enamorados con el proyecto y pueden visualizar el proyecto del mismo modo que nosotros lo hacemos, por favor, ayúdenos a hacerlo posible!

 

Our Dream

Through my art, I’d love to inspire other people to share their love and passion for music and to lose the fear to be themselves. I’d like to open the doors to the people of my country, Guatemala, and to people from all around the world to share their passion and "buenas vibras" that music gives.

"No Sé De Donde Soy": The E.P

With the help of my friends, musicians and people that helped me throughout my life, I was able to find my musical vision through my own compositions, which have now come into play in the form of an E.P which will be released shortly. I have had the help and support of professors as well as other fellow Berklee students in order to record and produce the songs of the E.P. This summer, I will be releasing two of my singles "Madrid" and "No Sé De Donde Soy". Although I have had a lot of help from the people here, now it has come the time to ask you for help. 

How to support my dream

The budget that has been proposed is the amount of money that will be needed in order to make our project occur. We will be travelling, performing, recording, filming, and having a press release in most of the countries that we will be visiting: Mexico, Spain, USA, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica, and Honduras. In all of these countries we already have shows booked, radio appearances, music video shoots and other events organized in order to let our music be heard. 

I open my heart, my dream, and my career to you. If you are in love with the project and can envision the project like we do, please join us in making it happen! 

 

Expenses Chart

Vamos a estar viajando, tocando, grabando y presentando públicamente el proyecto en la mayoría de los países que vamos a visitar: México, España, EEUU, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica, y Honduras. En todos estos países ya tenemos conciertos, entrevistas de radio, grabación de videoclips y otros eventos organizados por tal de que se escuche nuestra música. He abierto mi corazón, mis sueños, y mi carrera a ustedes. Si están enamorados con el proyecto y pueden visualizar el proyecto del mismo modo que nosotros lo hacemos, por favor, ayúdenos a hacerlo posible! Our DreamThrough my art, I’d love to inspire other people to share their love and passion for music and to lose the fear to be themselves. I’d like to open the doors to the people of my country, Guatemala, and to people from all around the world to share their passion and "buenas vibras" that music gives."No Sé De Donde Soy": The E.PWith the help of my friends, musicians and people that helped me throughout my life, I was able to find my musical vision through my own compositions, which have now come into play in the form of an E.P which will be released shortly. I have had the help and support of professors as well as other fellow Berklee students in order to record and produce the songs of the E.P. This summer, I will be releasing two of my singles "Madrid" and "No Sé De Donde Soy". Although I have had a lot of help from the people here, now it has come the time to ask you for help. How to support my dreamThe budget that has been proposed is the amount of money that will be needed in order to make our project occur. We will be travelling, performing, recording, filming, and having a press release in most of the countries that we will be visiting: Mexico, Spain, USA, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica, and Honduras. In all of these countries we already have shows booked, radio appearances, music video shoots and other events organized in order to let our music be heard. I open my heart, my dream, and my career to you. If you are in love with the project and can envision the project like we do, please join us in making it happen!  Expenses Chart

story:
We have recorded a song at the same studio we intend to use, and you can listen to it here.

I'm Joe Willey and I've been writing songs and playing for over 30 years. I'm playing with two wonderfully experienced musicians (Dan Horowitz and Johnny Fabulous), and we are all at the peak of our talent. If you like Americana, Blues, Old-Time and Bluegrass you will most likely enjoy our music. The Movin' Men are tight and well rehearsed.

All together, the songs and tunes on this album tell a story and we think you'll have a good time listening. For some rough samples of what will be on the record you can head over to our reverb nation page: https://www.reverbnation.com/joewilleyandthemovinmen 

This disc will be packed. We plan to record two instrumental sets to open and close the record, and there will be 12 songs for a total of 14 tracks.

We will be recording here: http://www.espressomachinerecording.com

At Espresso Machine Recording

Dan Horowitz at Vic Chesnutt Tribute, April 15 2017.
Photo by Kevin Powell

Joe Willey at Vic Chesnutt Tribute, April 15 2017.
Photo by Kevin Powell

John Evans at Vic Chesnutt Tribute, April 15 2017.
Photo by Kevin Powell

story:
Hello friend-



Doxa Theo is a friendship. It is a friendship amongst ourselves & a friendship with Jesus. Doxa Theo is a Greek translation for "Glory to God". Worship is an interesting thing that we do on a regular basis, but can still feel foreign to us at times. We have been experiencing worship through creativity in songwriting. Our connection and draw to music with each other has been birthed by common musical interests, and the ability to be a part of each other's respective church community on a consistent basis. 
Each of us have poured our hearts, our time, and our creativity into the idea that we are giving glory to God through, not only our music, but our desire to seek His presence in pursuit of our identity as creatives. This is a collection of friends that have formed over many years. 
Our goal as Doxa Theo continues to draw from Abba and His heartbeat for his sons and daughters. We believe his breath can be felt in His promises through the teachings of Jesus in the bible. Doxa Theo is our attempt to offer truth of the gospel, and the incredible good news of love and grace through the sacrifice of Jesus. We believe this involves, not only ourselves, but creation around us. We are a part of a beautiful, orchestrated verse that echoes the Creator's love for us.
Here is our position- We strongly desire to offer something we have worked hard on and will continue to create. We need your help. We have reached a point in our writing and recording that requests your friendship, your generosity, and your commitment to be involved in pursuing this next step in this journey with us.
grace and peace,
-Doxa Theo
                               What We Need: 
  • The total cost of this project is 17k. Any contribution helps!
Here is the breakdown of these funds:
  1. Production costs (Engineering, Mixing, Mastering, Musicians) 
  2. Travel expense (Traveling from Charlotte to Nashville multiple times. Gas & food for the travelers.) 
  3. Media (Logo, Album Art, Video Footage, Promo Videos, Music Videos, Website) 
  4. Promotion (Ability to travel and play shows, online marketing, booking costs, online advertisement) 
  5. Distribution (Electronic distribution, and the print of hard copies and vinyls of the album)
  • We need your prayers for wisdom in the studio as we put these songs together, and prayer that these songs will effectively communicate the Gospel and bring people closer to God.
  • We could use your support to tell everyone about our new journey. You can do this by reposting information about this kickstarter to your friends and family on social media, or email! 


  • Other Ways You Can Help

    - Reposting our information and URL with the request for people to join in this journey with us means so much for this process. It means more than just a simple thank you. We couldn't ask highly enough for this. We would be so grateful.

    - Reach out to us and feel free to discuss any of this in conversation with us. We would love to hear from you and help as best we can. We desire to create a safe place for anyone seeking and knocking.

    - Stick around! Staying updated with our situation is so important to us and we would love for you to walk with us. 

    -Continue to check back with us as we will be ADDING gifts and special individual prizes that can only be purchased once. We have some exciting things in store, and we hope you'll stick around and experience this with us.

    Perks:

    ColsenKeane Custom Handmade Moleskin

    $200

    Hitsman Tie & Pocket Square (featured on GQ)
    $75

    Print #1

    Print #2

    Print #3

    Print #4

The members of this project currently include: 

Will Retherford: Acoustic, Lead Vocals

Nick Mayer:  Electric Guitar

Justin Mower: Electric Guitar

Brandon Berg: Drums 

Tim Roberts: Drums 

Corey Keith: Keys

Spencer Sharpe: Bass

Johny Claridge: Bass

David Leonard: Producer, Organ 

Seth Talley: Production Engineer

story:
Short Summary

Based out of Hilo, Hawaii and Los Angeles, California, Productive Culture is a lifestyle based music collective of audio engineers, recording artists, music producers, and music enthusiasts.

The Productive Culture team prepares its 2015 Summer launch with an innovative networking event to be held at the MonkSpace venue in the historic Koreatown area of Downtown Los Angeles, titled “The No Filter Showcase”

The event will be free, with no cover charge. Donation boxes for food and clean clothing will be available for guests to donate what they can. All donations will be forwarded to the less fortunate in partnership with those who serve our communities.

This free networking event will be open to those looking to grow their network and share their art, as well as the supporters and music enthusiasts looking to be inspired by the creativity of the night. Part artwalk, part open mic, and part music showcase, our guests will flow freely though the character filled MonkSpace venue

Your help is needed to get this event off of the ground and cover the cost of making this event happen. Keep reading to see the perks that come with contributing  to this cause!

What We Need 

Putting on this kind of event takes heart, determination, and drive. We have assembled a team of volunteers willing to contribute their time and art to make this event happen. In order to make this event a success, we will be needing your help to fund the following areas:

- Venue Rental

- Audio Equipment and PA Rental

- Security and Sound Engineer Staff

- Refreshments

- Marketing Materials & More


The Impact

Your contribution to this event will have multiple impacts. On one end,  this event will provide a creative outlet for many new, talented individuals to showcase their art and create new connections. On the other, participants involved with the event  will be able to use this new creative outlet to bring in food and clothing donations for our affected communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign! Don't forget to use IndieGogo's share functions, located on this page.

story:
The iAM Music Institute is a 501c3 non-profit for music education and a network for professional musicians founded in Durango, CO.  The Institute currently serves about 100 private students as well as DeNier Youth Services Center, Big Picture High School, Animas High School, St. Columba School, and soon to be the Liberty School.

As part of our grassroots mission to strengthen affordable live music & performance opportunities in the Four Corners region, the iAM Music Institute has teamed up with Hello Dollface to present the first ever iAM Music Fest on September 11th and 12th.

The festival will celebrate community, creativity, mentoring, and music education with the collaboration of integrated Music, Art, Dance, and Poetry featuring 25 touring bands and professional artists of all mediums.  The two-day festival will also showcase the unique food culture of Durango by partnering with local eateries and mixology vendors.

The festival will take place on 8 stages throughout downtown Durango, and sponsorships will go toward funding these stages.  Other festival needs supported by sponsorships include:
 Bookings fees and talent support for:

  • 75+ professional touring musicians
  • 20 burlesque dancers
  • 6 aerialists
  • the Executive Director of the Tucson Poetry Society and other select poets
  • 15+ visual artists
  • 5 comedians
  • Interactive film
  • 4 performance artists
  • Clinicians for educational and creative workshops

Hospitality:

  • lodging for guest artists
  • travel expenses
  • meal stipends

Event Coverage:

  • Event film- we want this festival to be bigger and better every year!
  • Event photography- make your mark at this year's festival and keep lasting memories through our iAM Music Fest social media #iAMMusicFest

    Any donations that go above and beyond the direct needs of the festival will go to the needs of the iAM Music Institute.  These contributions include support for our:

    •  free instrument lending library for students in need
    • scholarships for music lessons
    • subsidies for at-risk school contracts
    • operating costs
    • diversifying staff to provide more educational opportunities
    • expansion and growth within and beyond the Four Corners region
    • curriculum development
    • more student performance opportunities
    • guest artist and clinician experiences
    • facility growth and improvement
    The iAM Music Fest is a unique opportunity for the Four Corners region to enjoy a large live performance experience without venturing to larger city areas outside of our community.  The festival endeavors to give Durango and the surrounding area a brand new experience that will deepen the love for music and live art that is growing each year.  The iAM Music Institute believes that performing music is one of the best ways to be a passionate music educator, and this festival will enable that experience in a very meaningful way.

    As the iAM Music Institute is a new entity, any support we receive for this festival will be integral in seeing the project to completion.  We sincerely appreciate your consideration in our endeavor, and enthusiastically await the festival!

story:
About Omaha Children's Choir

Omaha Children’s Choir was founded on the premise that the study of music makes a positive difference in the lives of young people in ways that can help them socially, emotionally, and even academically.  Significantly, it gives them a unique opportunity to learn about their own and other’s cultures and the society in which they live. It helps them develop sophisticated skills and an empowering awareness that generates self-esteem. Unfortunately, it has become more and more difficult for some children to gain the same access as others, especially in our urban areas.  All of these benefits are often effectively limited to those students whose families can afford them.  Our mission is to improve access for all students by providing quality choral music instruction while uniting our city's diversity and inspiring social change. We are fully supportive of the Omaha Public Schools music program, and encourage OCC students to be members of their school choirs.

Amanda Stevenson is the founder and artistic director of the Omaha Children’s Choir. Previously, Mrs. Stevenson taught at Fort Madison Middle School in Fort Madison, Iowa and at Harding Middle School in Des Moines, Iowa. While at Harding Middle School, she grew the program from 2 choirs with 125 students to 4 choirs with over 200 students. While at Harding, she committed herself to bringing young people of all backgrounds together through music. She holds a Bachelor of Music Education from Iowa Wesleyan College (2006) and a Master of Music with an emphasis in choral music education from Western Illinois University (2010).

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to pay for the first year of the Omaha Children's Choir. Since the choir is seeking to reach children in underserved communities, many of the families will not be able to afford full tuition. In these cases, we have adopted a sliding-scale tuition policy. We are in the process of applying for our 501(c)(3) status, but until we obtain it, we are unable to apply for grants. We are seeking to raise $4,200 to ensure that no child will be turned away for financial reasons. This money will be used for the following:

  • Uniform shirt for students to wear at all OCC events
  • Music folder for each student
  • 5 pieces of music for the choir (the rest will be borrowed from other schools and/or organizations)
  • Choral accompanist
  • Bus passes for students who need to transportation to/from rehearsals & concerts
  • Materials to print programs, brochures, posters, etc.
  • Basic marketing to bring in new choir members
  • Startup costs (501(c)(3) application, operating expenses, etc.)
If we raise more than $4,200, the money will be used for purchasing more music!

The Impact

Giving to the Omaha Children's Choir will ensure that children from all cultures and economic backgrounds will be able to develop leadership skills, learn discipline, and represent the city of Omaha through choral music.

Omaha Children’s Choir exists to provide children of all cultural and economic backgrounds with high quality choral music instruction that seeks to nurture each child’s potential for artistic and personal excellence, while uniting our city’s diversity and inspiring social change.

Risks & Challenges

  • We need children! This is truly a grassroots organization. We have been making connections with teachers, community leaders, arts organizations and other nonprofits to spread the word. Without children, we do not have a choir.
  • Many children lack transportation to rehearsal. We plan to offer bus passes to children, but some may be too young or parents may not feel comfortable with this option. Right now, it is our only option for transporting children to/from events.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, chances are good you know people who can. Please help us share our campaign by sharing this page on social media!

Omaha Children’s Choir is currently pending certification of 501(c)(3) status. If we receive approval, we will contact you so that your donation will be tax-deducible. 

Thank you for supporting music as a force for change in our city!

story: It's going to be a long hot summer and our beloved students and artists will be destined to sweat it out yet again unless we make our goal. Our organization provides a home for youth therapy programs, high school classes, community events and art projects. We keep costs for artists and students low and provide many services for free, but this means we usually don't have a lot left over for improvements. With your help we can give this community a long awaited improvement to a beloved institution, and make a good thing even better!

story:
Small Town, Small Talk, Statewide Impact

a couple of 830 mile long conversations is a long hello to and from Nebraska. One mile at a time, one conversation at a time, this project is about exploring and building connections in the state. I am an expat Brit now living in Omaha who, driven by a belief in the ability of conversation to spur community, will travel the side roads of the state in an RV to engage with Nebraskans. I will set up a public conversation space in towns on the route and talk with residents about their lives, their cultures and their stories. In these conversations, I will travel through places to discover people and, in so doing, reveal Nebraska to ourselves.


Project Details

The Purpose Behind The Project
The project will journey through the Nebraska landscape and its history, approaching Nebraska with honest warmth, open acceptance and sincere curiosity. Honoring a long line of oral history tradition, from traveling troubadours to Alexis de Tocqueville to John Steinbeck to Charles Kuralt, a couple of 830 mile long conversations will seek and share those narratives that define and unite us. It will celebrate our culture and how we each contribute to it, evoking a place and its people, connecting us to Nebraskans, their stories and their lives. These are tales of joy and despair, courage and disappointment, love and loss, and good deeds and misdeeds that richly illustrate our Nebraska experience. Telling and hearing our stories is an affirmation of our common dignity and a simple act that contributes collectively to our sense of togetherness.

Why This Matters - Benefiting The Community
While there are areas of academic practice and artistic examination related to Nebraskan history, traditions, culture, community and arts, this project synthesizes several approaches holistically through the less commonly explored medium of conversation. There is little comparable work that creates and captures, at a collaborative human level, a statewide local sense of who Nebraskans are and how they speak of creating community. This project will capture the voice of Nebraska as it exists at a particular moment. Like a good conversation, it is ephemeral yet has resonance in its immediacy.

Community outcomes include:
  • Giving direct voice to Nebraskans
  • The contribution of each individual’s narrative to a larger conversational whole, so that everyone becomes an integral piece of the project outcome
  • Developing broad awareness of and appreciation for other perspectives, increasing our understanding of ourselves and of each other
  • Reflecting on attitudes and misperceptions between people, whether on a macro scale between the state’s larger urban centers and small rural communities, to divisions based on religion, wealth, education and ethnicity, for example
  • Providing a platform for consideration of the nature of Nebraskan identities and community, as well as content to energize those discussions
The Conversations
Every conversation will be spontaneous, without script or agenda. Each conversation will be allowed to take its own course, but with the two following common threads:
  1. Everyone I speak with will at some point in the conversation be asked, “How do you create community?”
  2. Every conversation will include some point of discussion from prior conversations, enabling all participants to be part of and to contribute to a narrative that progresses across the state.
The daily lives of Nebraskans will be revealed through conversation, such as their sense of connectedness with each other and the land, with family histories, economic concerns, political views, and relationships with social and other institutions. The conversational engagements will surface expressions of alienation and connectedness, individuality and commonality, what it is like to be young and old in a changing environment, and how values and social behaviors in one place are similar or different to another place.

The Project in Practice
I will drive across Nebraska, starting in Omaha and then stopping at towns on the 830 mile long route, before ending the project back in Omaha. For one day in each town, including Omaha, I will set up a conversation spot at a suitable public location identified, perhaps, with local librarians or other town residents.

Each conversation spot will feature two chairs, a small table, an open-sided canopy, a notice board inviting people to sit and speak and other necessities, such as refreshments. I will audio record the conversations as well as photographing supporting imagery.

During the project, Nebraskans and others will be encouraged to contribute and converse through contemporaneous blogging and social media communications.

Who Will Take Part?
The audience is deliberately intended to be wide and diverse. For the project itself, it will comprise a slice of the statewide Nebraskan demographic. The project is intended to speak to, with, for and about all Nebraskans. It will capture a new audience by presenting itself invitingly to any and every Nebraskan, placing itself in their towns, streets, community gathering areas and socially trafficked public spaces.

Timeline and Route
The project will take place during a four week period between August 10 and September 5, 2015. The route is detailed on the attached map. After the road trip, later in 2015 there will be four public presentations across the state.


The towns on the route were chosen through a combination of reasons including:
  • Their proximity to and distance from each other
  • Their size, offering a spectrum between 188 to 15,023 and book ended by the metropolitan sized city of Omaha
  • A variety of societal and economic features, such as being a college town, on/adjacent to a Native American reservation, in areas of natural beauty, being an agricultural community, a tourist destination and acclaimed as a great place to raise a family.
After the Project
In Fall/Winter 2015 there will be four public presentations across the state in Omaha, Lincoln, Kearney and Scottsbluff. Presentations will include:
  • Photographic, video and aural elements from the project
  • My reflections on the experience with themes and insights drawn from the conversations
  • Dialog between me and the audience and between the audience members themselves as informed by the project
  • An invitation for the audience to further consider and reflect upon the impact of the themes for them and their communities

Who Am I?

I am a British expatriate that has called Omaha, Nebraska home for the last 10 years. I have come both to appreciate and to be curious about the state beyond the city. I believe that conversation helps us to live better and well, as individuals, families, and communities.

Driven by that belief, I founded Squishtalks to design and deliver conversation programs for corporate and non-profit organizations, for public and community purposes. Corporate clients have included Woodmen of the World, Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Nebraska, First National Bank, Mutual of Omaha and Kiewit. Non-profit and community partners have included Justice for our Neighbors, Habitat for Humanity, Joslyn Art Museum, Non-Profit Association of the Midlands, Film Streams, The Kent Bellows Studio, Girl Scouts of Nebraska and the Omaha Young Professionals Council.

I have created and am implementing the project, a couple of 830 mile long conversations, with the sponsorship and support of the Omaha Creative Institute. Omaha Creative Institute (formerly "Hot Shops Art Foundation"), a non-profit organization, strengthens the creative fabric of Omaha and the broader region by offering hands-on workshops for the general public, by providing local artists the resources needed to enrich their careers, and by inspiring engagement between artists and the community to produce shared artistic experiences. You can learn more about the wonderful things Omaha Creative Institute does and about its lovely people here.

Funding and Other Support

This project has already received enthusiastic encouragement through a substantial grant from Humanities Nebraska (thank you Humanities Nebraska!) This campaign is intended to match the funds provided by Humanities Nebraska to enable the project to be realized.

What If I Exceed The Fundraising Goal?

If this campaign exceeds the fundraising goal, that will enable the project’s underlying objectives to be amplified and extended. This might include transforming the conversations into other shareable media, whether a book or online resource, that will encourage ongoing dialog. It might also provide seed money to take this project model to other communities in the state and beyond, providing similar benefits to other people and populations.
story_txt:
Small Town, Small Talk, Statewide Impact
a couple of 830 mile long conversations is a long hello to and from Nebraska. One mile at a time, one conversation at a time, this project is about exploring and building connections in the state. I am an expat Brit now living in Omaha who, driven by a belief in the ability of conversation to spur community, will travel the side roads of the state in an RV to engage with Nebraskans. I will set up a public conversation space in towns on the route and talk with residents about their lives, their cultures and their stories. In these conversations, I will travel through places to discover people and, in so doing, reveal Nebraska to ourselves. 
Project DetailsThe Purpose Behind The ProjectThe project will journey through the Nebraska landscape and its history, approaching Nebraska with honest warmth, open acceptance and sincere curiosity. Honoring a long line of oral history tradition, from traveling troubadours to Alexis de Tocqueville to John Steinbeck to  Charles Kuralt, a couple of 830 mile long conversations will seek and share those narratives that define and unite us. It will celebrate our culture and how we each contribute to it, evoking a place and its people, connecting us to Nebraskans, their stories and their lives. These are tales of joy and despair, courage and disappointment, love and loss, and good deeds and misdeeds that richly illustrate our Nebraska experience. Telling and hearing our stories is an affirmation of our common dignity and a simple act that contributes collectively to our sense of togetherness. Why This Matters - Benefiting The CommunityWhile there are areas of academic practice and artistic examination related to Nebraskan history, traditions, culture, community and arts, this project synthesizes several approaches holistically through the less commonly explored medium of conversation. There is little comparable work that creates and captures, at a collaborative human level, a statewide local sense of who Nebraskans are and how they speak of creating community. This project will capture the voice of Nebraska as it exists at a particular moment. Like a good conversation, it is ephemeral yet has resonance in its immediacy.Community outcomes include:
Giving direct voice to Nebraskans
The contribution of each individual’s narrative to a larger conversational whole, so that everyone becomes an integral piece of the project outcome
Developing broad awareness of and appreciation for other perspectives, increasing our understanding of ourselves and of each other

story:
Hey friends! My name is Donald MacLennan. For the last 9 years I've toured North America and Europe, recorded and played live with many great artists and bands based out of Eastern Canada, including Ben Caplan & the Casual Smokers, the Modern Grass, TZE, Duane Andrews, and lots more. However, I've never taken the plunge to record my own stuff, constantly (and happily) being an accompanist/sideman for some really great music. So, I am super excited to share what I've been up to the last few months... I'm currently producing and recording my first gypsy jazz record! Musically it is coming together splendidly and I can't wait to take you along for the ride!


What I Need & What You Get



I am trying to raise 5000$ CDN (or more) to help make this record happen. With the total cost of the project being approximately 7000 CDN, all contributions are integral, and will help pay for:

  • the musicians and sound engineer for their expertise and time
  • the many hours recording and mixing in multiple studios
  • mastering the record (very important)
  • album artwork concept/design
  • manufacturing minimum 1000 CD's
Please check out the perks!!! There are some cool options I put together for you!!!
I compose different kinds of music, so the personal composition perk is a piece of music that I compose, you provide a title, and I notate out on staff paper and send to you! The Youtube cover perk will be a blast; hit me with your best song, I'll do it. The Limited Edition Mishra's Dream CD perk includes a hard copy of the record I did with the first gypsy jazz group I ever played with, Mishra's Dream (which seems so long ago now, haha). I have a vase full of bows that I used at one point but have become funky ornaments in my home. You can have one with the Shredded Bow perk! The VIP perk will be awesome, can't wait to hang out! The various live concert perks are all about bringing the energy of this record into your home, for an intimate and up-close look at how we play and improvise together, and the concert + beer tasting perk is an awesome evening of gypsy jazz with a special guided craft beer tasting with the Maritimes' only Certified Cicerone, my wife Angeline MacLennan! Peruse all perks, I hope there is something that tickles your fancy.

I went for incentives that I think you, the fans, will want, and that I will be able to deliver. The exciting thing is, this is the FIRST album that I am showing my stuff, so to speak. I've got a lot more where this is coming from, but this will always be the first, and I need your help to get it out there. It’s all about the music, and the long creative process that leads up to having a finished album in hand. Again, your participation is so important! With your help, this album will be finished and mass-produced and take over the world (unlikely).

If you can't contribute financially to the campaign, don't worry! I appreciate you taking the time and checking this out, and please let your friends and family know about the project and the cool incentives (there are some share tools through Indiegogo that work well). Thanks so much, can't wait to share, see you out there!

Donald

story:
Short Summary

Luke and I met by the hands of fate in Columbia, Missouri. Within the first five minutes of meeting one another, we sang “Poison and Wine," an original by The Civil Wars. Captivated by the harmony and blend of our voices, we knew that we needed to stick together and make music. As the writing continued and the events emerged, we collaborated with Catherine Sandstedt on viola and Daniel Blake on drums. We have now been writing and performing for over a year and one of our biggest questions from fans is "Can I get a CD?" Our biggest obstacle in being successful in the music industry is getting our music out to people. Our biggest obstacle in getting our music out to people is being able to afford the cost of recording and producing an album. Now we hope to make that dream a reality with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We NEED money. Being a band without a label means that everything we do comes straight out of our band fund and our pockets. Any money we make from shows goes directly into the band fund to help us with the recording process, but that money is not nearly enough to cover our costs. Recording is very expensive and we want to get the best product out there for our fans and supporters.
  • The money that you donate will be going directly toward recording the album, mixing and mastering the songs, and making the CDs and their covers.
  • We have PERKS! These are all lined out and explained on our campaign page. However, any amount that you can give will help to produce the album and will mean the world to us. Each one of us greatly appreciate your support. 
  • If we do not reach our goal, all of the money that we do get will still go directly toward recording, mixing and mastering our songs, and making the CDs. 

The Impact

If you choose to donate and help us reach our goal, you could have a truly transforming impact on our lives. Being able to distribute our music to more people can help us to further raise our profile and have the type of career in music that we've always dreamed of. But that's the obvious part. The question is why does that matter to you. Music is about reaching people. We have all been impacted by music at some point in our lives, and that's largely why the four of us got into it in the first place. It allows us a platform to speak to people about who we are, what we value, and, most importantly, that they should value themselves. We won't pretend like we have the same impact that a teacher or pastor does, but this is how we have found a way to inspire people. We hope you'll help put us in a position to do that on a greater scale. And lets face it, having a friend or relative that could potentially be good friends with T-Swift is a nice perk as well.

Risks & Challenges

As with any business venture, there are definitely risks involved in our endeavor.  We are all well aware of the long odds that we face in becoming successful, full-time musicians. Even very good bands toil for years without ever getting the breaks they need. That could happen to us. Or people just may not like our music. Neither of those are pleasant outcomes to think about. However, even with those in mind, we have all sacrificed a lot of time, money, and opportunities to pursue this career path. We're confident that with a little help, and a lot of hard work, we can make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating is not something you can do, it's okay. We can still use your help!

  • Please get the word out about our campaign! Tell your friends, family, coworkers, neighbors, babysitters, arch-enemies, well you get the idea. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share us to your social media page!
  • Like us on Facebook and listen to and/or buy our single Something More on Spotify and iTunes!

story:
Short Summary

Hello to all of my family, friends, and followers!

I am very excited to announce that I am creating the next Billboard number-one single, “Blonde In Vuitton”. It’s essentially my blog, snapchat, and Instagram all wrapped into one. Exciting right? Here’s the thing, Mom and Dad have put me on a “budget” and this project doesn’t exactly fit into that. Which is why I need the support of all of you! I know it’s actually crazy that I am asking for your money to fund my project, but I promise that this masterpiece is really for the world, not just for me. It’s something that will truly inspire people to embrace their inner Kyle. The world could use more Kyle’s, don’t you think? Not only will there be audio of me spitting out some epic “take no prisoners” white boy rap, but there will be video. Oh yes, a music video. Professional music video, possibly on Vevo with millions of views. This project is legit (unlike my previous singles) and I legit need all the help I can get to get “Blonde In Vuitton” released by the end of August. 

What We Need & What You Get

All money raised goes directly to fund the project. I really need $6,000 to make this project perfect, the majority of which goes directly into the music video. The rest of the funds go to studio fees, the cost of the track, copyrighting and publishing costs. However, if I don’t reach my goal, the project will still happen but on a smaller scale. If you know me, you know I don’t do anything on a small scale, so please reach into your hearts and keep going until you reach your pockets, and contribute whatever you can! 

In exchange, you will obviously get a personal thank you for me and a free copy of the single, but you could also get a Instagram or snapchat shoutout to my followers, a personal thank you video, a fun ringtone, handwritten lyric sheet, producer credit, not to mention bragging rights.

Risks & Challenges

Like anything in life, there are always risks. The risks involved with this project are quality if not properly funded, lack of exposure, possibly offensive, or possible delays. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Exposure. This project cannot get enough exposure. Share this campaign on your Facebook, twitter, Instagram, in the clubs, run down the halls of your apartment screaming it, I don’t care what you do as long as we get the word out. #BlondeInVuitton

story:
Hello, my name is Karen Notovitz. I am an upcoming junior at the New England Conservatory of Music. As part of our passion and academic experience, I along with several other musicians are putting together an unforgettable theatrical experience, that we have titled Comedy in Love. 

Comedy in Love will be a performance filled with fun, laughter and beautiful, heartfelt music. This production is launched by young, up and coming artists studying at conservatories including the Juilliard School of Music and the New England Conservatory of Music. They are talented and excited to perform and share the music they love - to an audience that will be inspired.

There will be one matinee performance on August 2nd, at The National Opera Center (330 Seventh Avenue in NYC). It will feature solos and comedic scenes from well-known operas and musicals such as Carousel, Die Fledermaus, Fiddler on the Roof, The Marriage of Figaro and more. Each performer will bring something unique and special to the stage.

To make this a reality, we need to raise at least $2000 to cover expenses for renting the performance hall in New York City, paying the very talented pianists, production, design, stage materials and marketing.

If there are any funds left that are not used for this performance, we plan to make a donation to a charitable fund that supports the arts.

For young singers, it is difficult and most challenging to get an opportunity to perform on this scale. Creating it ourselves, gives us the chance to experience the challenges and rewards of starting a career in opera or musical theater.

This is why I’m asking for your help. Ticket sales will only cover a small portion of the costs required to produce a show of this caliber. We need your help - any gift you can provide will go a long way toward making this a reality. Your contribution will not only help the performers create this experience, it will also bring joy and laughter to everyone who sees this production this coming August.

We are also saying thank you, with perks and gifts for donations starting as little as $25.00. And for any contribution as little $1.00, you will get updates up until the show.

Now comes the easy part. We need your help to spread the word, and ask all your friends and family to help us. Please use the Indiegogo share tools on our campaign page. Post our Indiegogo link on your Facebook page, send details via email to everyone you know, and post on Twitter.

Tickets are on sale right now, please let everyone know - you can buy tickets through this link: https://www.ticketsource.us/date/180816. Help us get a  wonderful audience for our hardworking and dedicated team of performers.

Sincerely,

Karen Notovitz
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Karen Notovitz. I am an upcoming junior at the New England Conservatory of Music. As part of our passion and academic experience, I along with several other musicians are putting together an unforgettable theatrical experience, that we have titled Comedy in Love. 
Comedy in Love will be a performance filled with fun, laughter and beautiful, heartfelt music. This production is launched by young, up and coming artists studying at conservatories including the Juilliard School of Music and the New England Conservatory of Music. They are talented and excited to perform and share the music they love - to an audience that will be inspired.
There will be one matinee performance on August 2nd, at The National Opera Center (330 Seventh Avenue in NYC). It will feature solos and comedic scenes from well-known operas and musicals such as Carousel, Die Fledermaus, Fiddler on the Roof, The Marriage of Figaro and more. Each performer will bring something unique and special to the stage.
To make this a reality, we need to raise at least $2000 to cover expenses for renting the performance hall in New York City, paying the very talented pianists, production, design, stage materials and marketing.If there are any funds left that are not used for this performance, we plan to make a donation to a charitable fund that supports the arts.
For young singers, it is difficult and most challenging to get an opportunity to perform on this scale. Creating it ourselves, gives us the chance to experience the challenges and rewards of starting a career in opera or musical theater.
This is why I’m asking for your help. Ticket sales will only cover a small portion of the costs required to produce a show of this caliber. We need your help - any gift you can provide will go a long way toward making this a reality. Your contribution will not only help the performers create this experience, it will also bring joy and laughter to everyone who sees this production this coming August.
We are also saying thank you, with perks and gifts for donations starting as little as $25.00. And for any contribution as little $1.00, you will get updates up until the show.
Now comes the easy part. We need your help to spread the word, and ask all your friends and family to help us. Please use the Indiegogo share tools on our campaign page. Post our Indiegogo link on your Facebook page, send details via email to everyone you know, and post on Twitter.
Tickets are on sale right now, please let everyone know - you can buy tickets through this link: https://www.ticketsource.us/date/180816. Help us get a  wonderful audience for our hardworking and dedicated team of performers.Sincerely,
Karen Notovitz

story:
ABOUT 

Love is a powerful thing & making music is the thing that I love. 

If you asked me what was the most important aspect of my life, my answer would be Love. It’s something that’s always driven me, made me grow, and forced me to deal with what life throws my way. A huge part of that Love is what drives me consistently in creating music through songwriting, singing, & performing. It’s allowed me to be a storyteller through exposing the most vulnerable parts of myself in hopes of allowing others to feel connected & comfortable in doing the same while listening to my songs in their daily lives. 

I’m at new crossroads in my life where I am staring down two new directions: THE ROAD to the RIGHT will keep me self-producing and continuing to create but THE ROAD on the LEFT will allow me to take my music career to NEW HEIGHTS and that path on the left has something else standing there: YOU! 

YOU are a key component to everything I do musically. You push me to grow, you push me to listen, you push me to create something that comes from the deepest parts of my passion so that I can continue to spread that which we all need a lot more of - LOVE. 

Just like Love, the music industry is not easy & there are many trials and tribulations, but there are also amazing moments of success, joy, and triumph & this could be one of those moments we could celebrate together! With YOU, I know it’s worth the fight. 

Vincent Coleman - IndieGogo Let's Go!

I’ve been singing & writing my whole life & I’m hoping that YOU are willing to take this road with me. 

Risks & Challenges

The challenges I face, and the expenses that I must meet:

Write the songs (check) 

Record those songs (halfway check) 

Mix those songs (____) 

Master those songs (____) 

Compile the album (____) 

Promote the album (____) 

Release the album (____) 

Tour (____) 

Tour (____) 

Tour (____)

With your support, I can check the rest of these things off of my list. And, if I've done my best, hopefully you'll find something you can love and value waiting for you at the end of that list. A note, a song, a show, a PINATA PARTY FANTASY-- whatever it might be.

From every part of my being, thanks for being a very important part of this process.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, My names Elliot rose and I perform under the name of "El Jay rose"

I have been a musician all my life. I started singing when I was 5 years old singing classical until I was 12. After doing my grades In classical music I sang opera for two years until I converted to singing modern music. After school I studied at Brighton institute of modern music for two years doing a degree. I passed my audition to get in there at the age of 16 and started an early music degree at the age of 17. I have played piano for 10 years and guitar for 4 years. I am currently 20 years old. 

I have played a lot of small time gigs and recorded a couple of songs professionally, but it is hard to afford. Music is my life, I have done it from such a young age and have always pursued it. I have always wanted recognition for the songs I write but when i was younger I did not think it would be so hard. Music is my passion and is something I have always wanted to pursue. I want to live doing something that I love and to write songs that don't just make me happy but also the people who want to listen.  Here is a Link to my band page ---->El Jay Rose Music page

Donations would help massively no matter how much or how little. The donations would help me be able to afford the studio time to record my new album and promote it. It would help me be able to record six songs in the studio with full equipment and professional advice from the employees that work there. It would help also to promote my album and my band page on social sites giving people the opportunity to listen to my music. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have In the past recorded one of my original songs in a professional studio, it did take a full day to get it recorded and cost £300, I recorded it at Tunbridge wells and have put a link to the song on my campaign as I have put it up on youtube ---->Devil in Disguise by El Jay Rose. £1800 would be enough to record six songs in a professional studio which would take six days to edit and perfect. The extra £200 would go towards advertisement, promoting the album and band page. I could upload it to Itunes and send it into the BBC. For anyone who donates and want's one I will send them a copy of the Album when it's finish. I would like to record my album at a studio called "RiverRun Studios" In potton as its the closet studio to Biggleswade where I live. 

I am aware getting recognition is easier said than done. So I have been in touch with promoters and I am currently active on the gigging scene. I have a privet party gig on the 1st of august, a charity festival called "Busk till Dusk" on the 8th of august in Biggleswade for St Johns hospice, My name is on the listing in this link->BuskTillDusk Festival. I have a privet Festival on the 30th of August and few pub gigs in my area also.  I am working hard to become a musician and to be recognised in my area and beyond by keeping in touch with venues and playing in front of a crowd at every chance I get.  I organise my own gigs also. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your not interested in Donating I would really appreciate you sharing My campaign to help get people to fund me, I would really be thankful if you could share and like my band page also. I am grateful you have taken the time to read my campaign and I hope you can help in any way. Thank you.

story:
Hi all, my name is Aaron. and I own Evolving Studios.

Firstly, I am very sorry about the length of the video. I tried to make it as clear and concise as I could to ensure people knew what they were learning about, but sometimes my passion for music just takes over and I have a tendency to get very vocal about it.

I have recently graduated from Southampton Solent University with a 2:1 in Digital Music. During my final year I formulated an idea for an unmanned studio and DJ set up to allow people access to high end equipment, which they may not normally have funds to gain access to, and all at a very customer friendly price.

This campaign is to fund the final services in the studio to allow us to accommodate vocalists and to enhance our streaming service to give our customers super fast broadband allowing them to stream their music live to the world. This will all be a direct result of what you guys can help me generate and will help further peoples musical careers and endeavours.

The campaign is for £5000

  • £480   - 1 year subscription 76mb fiberoptic internet + line rental.
  • £1000 - Microphone, Headphones and accessories.
  • £3000 - Materials & labour to build the vocal booth.
  • £500    - Dedicated recording computer.
Some of the perks on offer are heavily discounted studio time, DJ lessons with no restricted amount of hours to learn and some exclusive Evolving Studios t-shirts.

If you guys are able to contribute not only will you be helping support my vision, but you will also be directly aiding and supporting other vocalist's, digital musician's and DJ's dreams and goals. There are limited services available for digital musicians to gain access to high end studio equipment un aided and even less for DJs, so not only are we trying to enhance peoples experience with what they can do, we are also aiming to make it so cost effective that they could make it a regular thing.

If you are unable to contribute please take a few minutes to share this to your friends, family, colleagues…whoever! because you never know where this could end up and who might want to get involved.

Thank you.

story:
Hi, my name is Greg Murphy and I’m a pianist and composer. I’m working on a new album and I need your help in order to record, mix and master it. I’ve been speaking with Neal Weiss of Whaling City Sound and am hopeful that he will release it on his record label.

Your contribution is vital to achieving my initial goals:

1)  Produce the album

2)  Get it in the top ten on the JazzWeek jazz radio chart

3)  Get the album promoted and distributed nationally and internationally

These are definitely achievable goals as I’ve gotten my most recent album “Blues for Miles” on the JazzWeek charts for six weeks, peaking at number thirty-six (#36).

I’m trying to raise $6,500. Here’s a breakdown of the budget:

Production costs - $4,000

·  Studio fees - $2,000 for recording, mixing and mastering

·  Musician fees - $2,000

Post-production costs - $2,500

·  Radio promotion

Post-production costs hopefully provided by Whaling City Sound - $7,000

·  Graphic design and duplication

·  Printing, mailing, promotion and distribution

When you contribute, some of the perks you’ll receive are:

·  CDs and Mp3 downloads

·  Private piano lessons

·  Name a composition

·  Private performances in the NYC metro area and beyond

Your contribution is extremely valuable - 100% of which will go directly toward the completion of this project. If we don’t reach our funding goals during this campaign, we will raise the funds through other methods.

My last two albums have been very successful; with your help, this one will be even more so.

Also, there are other ways that you can help besides contributing financially:

·  Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign

·  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I promise to keep you updated on the progress of our project throughout the campaign.

Thanks and have a great week!

Greg

BIOGRAPHY

An experienced improviser, composer, arranger and teacher, Greg Murphy has led, directed and performed with various groups around the world for the past three decades. In a 2015 review referencing “Brother, Can You Spare a Dime?” from Greg’s CD, Blues for Miles, Maxwell Chandler writes: “… not every musician can play the blues. Greg displays an authenticity not in any specific blues-based structure but in an organic soulfulness. There is a power to the performance deriving from simplicity …. Tinged with melancholy but bearable on account of its beauty, it is a rainy day with all the leaves of the trees dripping silvered jewels.” He goes on: “‘Hat Trick’ is another original. It is free jazz not in the genre sense but in the band allowing different components from several genres to meld without concern of adhering to any specific formula …. A dramatic cohesiveness is created not because all the musicians play in unison but because each of the smaller patterns executed within the piece bolster the others.” In another 2015 review of Blues for Miles, Bob Rusch of Cadence Magazine writes “… a strong ensemble [with] some very effective free playing on ‘Free Ur Mind’ and ‘Free Han Solo.’”

Greg began his musical adventures in 1971 when he joined the Ray-Fisk Grammar School Band in Chicago. His classical studies began later that year with Lucia Santini at Roosevelt University.  Between 1980 and 1984, he played with the jazz/funk band Lightning Flash Thunder Roar, The University of Illinois at Chicago Big Band, The Northern Illinois University Big Band, and other local Chicago bands.

A jazz study grant from the National Endowment for the Arts in 1984 gave Greg the opportunity to go to New Orleans and study with the eminent pianist and jazz educator, Ellis Marsalis.  He remained there and began recording and performing with The New Orleans Jazz Couriers, Percussion Incorporated, and his own group, The Fusicians.  The Percussion Incorporated album, Drum Talk, (Greg’s first recording) was recorded and released in 1987. While living in the crescent city, Greg performed with Donald Harrison, Wynton Marsalis, and countless other great musicians.

Greg moved to New York in 1987 and began what had become a long association with multi-directional drummer, Rashied Ali.  Greg performed and recorded with Ali and his various groups throughout Europe, Canada, the United States and beyond, from 1987 until Rashied passed away in 2009. 

Throughout his career, Greg has performed in Japan, China and The Philippines with his own trio and other groups. He’s also worked in New York with Ornette Coleman and in France with Carlos Santana and Archie Shepp. In 2012, Greg recorded the theme song “Brother, Can You Spare a Dime?” for the HBO documentary Redemption, which was produced and directed by Jon Alpert and Matthew O’Neill. Redemption received a 2013 Academy Award nomination for best documentary short.

Greg also performed with Arthur Taylor, Branford Marsalis, Joe Lovano, Grachan Moncur, III, Christian McBride, Flava Flav, Cindy Blackman, Terrence Blanchard, Harry Connick, Jr., Charles McPherson, and James Blood Ulmer, among many others.

story:
Welcome to the Boondocks

The goal is to open a creative, family friendly, space to expand my growing photography business in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan (right on the border of Canada.)

I am based in Sault Ste. Marie, MI and for over 10 years I have been in the graphic design/layout/editing/photo journalism/newspaper industry. Photography was always put on the back burner for this "career" path.

Changes in this industry and for my family have led me to a fork in the road. This campaign is important to me because it will help me more easily pick the road less traveled and finally do something I have wanted to do for years, open a portrait studio.

The space will also be used as a store front for my hand made photo props and custom kids hats and children's accessories which is part of how I started on this path. 4 years ago when I needed models for my Boondocks Babies Hat Shop online store on Etsy. I used my photography skills to photograph the products. Esty listings with models always sold better. I loved interacting with the newborns and the new moms on these shoots. This part time gig turned into shooting families, children, couples and bigger shoots. One of the perks is a huge discount on these custom hats.

Perks:

Some of the perks to pick from include: Limited edition prints (many never before printed or sold before, see some of the options below); Be the first in the new studio if you pick one of the discounted photo sessions; Made to order, handmade newborn photo props, kids hats and winter hats for adults/kids all at a discounted price that will never happen again (very limited number).

The big one is "Name the main studio" perk where you can choose the name of the main studio. For this one your name, or the name/nickname, you choose will be placed on the door and will be referred to daily. (Catch: Name must be family friendly but could be in the name of someone, a funny catch phrase, or simply named after you, your pick.)


Plus if you live in the EUP you can take advantage of the fall family session deal!

Where the funds will go:

I have found a beautiful place to rent in historic downtown of Sault Ste. Marie, check (see photos below); basic equipment and cameras, check; clients and word of mouth, check. 85% of what I need to start are ready to go. While I have loved working exclusively on location the time has come for me to have my own space.

There is snow on the ground almost 7 months out of the year here, Sault Ste. Marie was named one of the "snowiest" places in the nation. This alone is one of the most important reasons why I need a climate controlled place for clients.

- Remodel: Paint, floor cleaning, etc.

- Equipment: Backdrop system, some extra props.

-  Marketing: So far my brand has been moving forward with social media and word of mouth. Which has been perfect because I have only been doing this part time. To move forward into full time I need a bigger welcome mat. My location would be right downtown, has amazing light but I will need new signage and marketing to let me know I am open.

Risks:

The bulk of the planning, funding, and equipment are already in place, the location has been found, and my client base has been growing steadily and I feel strongly that this will be successful. Any challenges that arise will be handled with my creative, strong-willed perseverance and solutions will be found. The fact that I keep losing clients due to the fact I don't have an indoor studio gives me hope that once I am set up my business will only continue to grow. Any funds raised above and beyond the amount requested will only help speed up my growth, going toward equipment upgrades and any unexpected expenses.

Thank you for reading, feel free to share

Word of mouth is everything. Any help you can give with spreading the word will do more then you think.
Facebook: Boondocks Portrait Studio
Web: boondocksbabies.com
Twitter:@boondocksbabies
Instagram: boondocksbabieshatshop
