story:
Hi, I’m Paige Clem and I AM FREAKIN’ HAPPY that I am finally going to go into the studio and record my original music. To give you an idea of how long I’ve wanted to do this, above is a photo of the top of my actual bucket list that I made some time in my late teens. Even then, the driving force in my life was music....long before I could even comfortably call myself a musician.

You'll see that it's been over 20 years now since I first got on stage and performed in front of a crowd—I'll never forget that night at the War Eagle Supper Club in Auburn, AL and how my knees were knocking so hard I had to sit on a stool to make it through the song. You can also see that since that same time, I've wanted to record my own music (piano at the time because I didn't even play guitar back then!).  You'll also note that 20 years later, that top-of-the-list item is yet to be crossed off. I have since skinny dipped, had a kid, ridden a motorcycle, seen the Grand Canyon, gotten a tattoo and a whole lot more from that list--but I still haven't recorded my music.

Until now!

What I Need

I need your help raising the funds to make this happen so I can finally cross that baby off the list!  In all seriousness, it’s there for a reason—I don’t think our desires come to us by mistake. This needs to get done so let’s do it!

I’d like to raise $14,000 for this project. Hopefully my video gives a pretty good explanation of why something like this costs so much, but to further elaborate, here’s a rough breakdown of where the bread is all going to go:

COSTS

Indiegogo

$700.00

Payment Processing

$400.00

Travel costs for Production, Musicians

$750.00

Production Fees

$2,500.00

Studio Rental Fees

$1,500.00

Recording Engineer Fees

$1,000.00

Studio Musician Fees

$1,500.00

Mixing Engineer Fees

$1,200.00

Mastering Engineer Fees

$900.00

Photography

$250.00

Artwork

$250.00

First Print of 500 CDs

$800.00

Merch/Perks

$1,000.00

Shipping

$750.00

Marketing & Publicity

$500.00

$14,000.00

To help the people part make more sense, you could also think of it like this:

So that’s roughly $1300/song for just the recording, not to mention all the other costs to produce the CDS, merch, perks, marketing and more. This is just an approximation…but $50/hour/person is a pretty low estimate to make something like this happen.  Multiply that times 4 – 5 songs and it adds up!  Also, keep in mind, Indiegogo takes a cut of everything this campaign raises, and there’s a fee involved to process money. The perks are all fun and I’m stoked to spread the “I am freakin’ happy” message, but all of that will all have to be designed, ordered, shipped and shipped again to you.

What You Get

First…a big fat thank you and power boost to your karma for helping someone out!  But I obviously want to give you more than that and have a lot of great perks to offer at incremental levels. Many of these goodies tie back to the “I am freakin’ happy!” theme which I was inspired to use after making that fun spontaneous video.  Here are some of the perks offered:

- Formal acknowledgement/"thank you" on CD packaging.

- Formal acknowledgement/"thank you" on website and social media.

- Digital download of EP.

- A physical copies of SIGNED CD mailed to you.

- “I am Freakin' Happy" pocket flashlights.

- "I am Freakin' Happy" stickers.

- "I am Freakin' Happy" t-shirts.

- House concerts

- Custom songs

- Executive Producer credits

- Custom crafts and goodies made just for you by me!  Feel free to inquire directly about these if you’re interested.

But What If

Let’s be optimistic and assume all the money will be raised…right?  But just in case it doesn’t happen, I’ll use the funds raised to produce as many songs as I’m able with the budget available. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you’re not able to contribute financially at this time. I get it.  Even if you aren’t able to I appreciate anything you can do to help me get the word out and make and make some noise about this campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to post on social media and more.  Let’s make some people FREAKIN’ HAPPY!

I’ll keep ya posted on our progress!  Thanks for your support!

story:
What you can do:
Choose your favorite perks and contribute now.


Hey, it's Kev!

Tradition. It's all about tradition. Throughout the years as a working singer-songwriter I've learned so much about the craft of songwriting by learning the songs of the artists that I love... like Paul Simon, James Taylor and many other artists from the 1960's and 1970's, up until now. So, carrying on the traditions, values, and belief systems of those artists that I love and respect is something very important to me. And I keep that in mind in almost everything that I do...



About this project:

I've chosen some of my favorite songs from my favorite artists and recorded them as acoustic songs to highlight them in a new and intimate way.  It's really quite fun because it brings out a lot of the different features and meanings of each song. And in this indiegogo campaign I'm inviting you to join me on this awesome new journey! 


AWESOME REWARDS:

Autographed Poster/Bonus CD Package - NEW!

I just went through my closet and found these awesome 11 x 17 full color posters that are from my "Hi Love" album tour.  And I've decided to add them here as a perk. In addition, you get a signed BONUS CD, "Hi Love" which is my most popular cd. Both are signed directly to you (and you get a sticker from that tour too). Also includes Advance Autographed New CD and Album Download.

Limited Edition Hoodie Package - Designed by Steve Johannsen


INCLUDES: Limited Edition Hoodie, Advance Autographed CD, and Album Download.  Check out this killer new Hoodie package designed by Illustrator Steve Johannsen. Steve has done artwork for the Grateful Dead, Allman Brothers Band, Gov't Mule and a slew of other amazing, timeless bands and truthfully I feel honored he has done this new artwork for me.  He is the man and I am lucky he's involved with this project. More about Steve and the artwork below.  Pictures above show front and back print on hoodie. Hooded sweatshirt is available in many sizes and comfortably fits both men and women.

Your Name On My New CD Insert Package


INCLUDES: Your Name on My New CD Insert, Limited Edition Hoodie, Advance Autographed CD, and Album Download

Handwritten Lyrics Package

INCLUDES: Handwritten Lyrics to Any Song of Mine of Your Choice, Your Name on My New CD Insert, Limited Edition Hoodie, Advance Autographed CD, and Album Download


The Ultimate Fan Package

INCLUDES: All 7 of my Autographed CDs (including this new cd), Limited Edition Hoodie, Official Burn Away T-shirt, Official Sticker, New Album Download, and a Handwritten Letter from me directly thanking you for supporting my music


Your Own Signed Acoustic Guitar Package

INCLUDES: This amazing Yamaha FG 700S acoustic guitar signed, Your Name on My New CD Insert, Limited Edition Hoodie, Advance Autographed CD, and Album Download

So, I went down to my local music store and played one of these bad boys to make sure it was a quality guitar. And ABSOLUTELY it is! I really dig it and it reminds me so much of my first acoustic guitar ever. I was only 16 years old and played my Yamaha acoustic everyday after school until I could no longer concentrate. It is a quality guitar for every level of player and trust me, I've played a lot of guitars. And I'll be more than happy to personally sign yours if you'd like me to. My personal time with my instruments is like meditation to me, so if you get this guitar perhaps it can be that for you too.

Private Benefactor Package

INCLUDES ALL REWARDS ABOVE (Including signed acoustic guitar if you'd like one!)
If you would like to support my music career in a substantial way but don't quite know how, you can become a private benefactor. You would be a primary reason for my stability and general happiness in the next year and greatly affecting not only my life as a working artist but on a personal level as someone who sacrifices a great deal to be a working artist (please see list of where any Extra Money Raised Here will go). I will never forget such an amazing gesture.

The Artwork:

I feel very honored to have renowned Illustrator, Steve Johannsen contributing some of his original artwork and years of skill and experience to this new project. Steve's bio and list of credentials is an incredible list of national icons like:

The Grateful Dead
Allman Brother's Band
Govt Mule
Gregg Allman
Phil Lesh and Friends
Jimmy Buffett
Bob Weir and Rat Dog
Further
Warren Haynes' Xmas Jam
Bruce Hornsby and The Noismakers
Hot Tuna
and many more... 

You will see his artwork all over this campaign including this illustration that he did for me that is featured on the Limited Edition Hoodie... 


What You Can Do:


Make a contribution now

I need your help. I am an independent musician and I do all of this stuff myself. I don't have a record label or a management company or anyone to help me get my music out into the world... except you!

You are the reason that I've had the success that I have had so far.  And when you support my crowdfunding campaigns like this you are directly helping me get the cd done, released, and out into this world. 

So, if you believe in the power of this music, what it means, and what it can do in the world... I need you to contribute right now, if you can.

All amounts are greatly appreciated and I've tried to set it up so that anyone can be involved if they'd like to.

And of course I will really appreciate you for getting involved and being such a huge supporter of my music, my life as a working musician, and the purpose of all of these great artists' songs.


Where the money is going:

Where the money goes...

So primarily the money generated in this campaign will go to...

I. Album Productions Costs - $10,000 
   A. Mixing engineer fees 
   B. Mastering studio fees 
   C. Graphic designer fees
   D. CD duplication costs 
   E. Shipping and handling fees
   F. etc...

But will also go to...

II. Marketing - $3,500 
   A. Internet advertising to get the new album out there! 
      1. Facebook Advertising, Twitter, Youtube, etc.. 
      2. Internet Radio Advertising - Pandora, Spotify, etc.. 
   B. New videos made for the new songs!

III. Tour Support - $1,500 
   A. Vehicle Maintenance (my van)
   B. Equipment Maintenance 


Honestly, just by contributing to this campaign you're relieving me of a whole lot of financial stress and I'll love you forever for doing it. Thanks for reading this far down. 
sincerely, 
-Kev


Risks & Challenges


Awesome news! There are very few risks and challenges to this project. I have already recorded the songs and have a pretty clear vision of how to finish it with the help of some very skillful people... mixing engineers, mastering, graphic artists, etc...

The biggest challenge is HOW MANY PEOPLE CAN WE GET IT TO?  Really by contributing now your are helping me spread this music and this campaign to more people. By getting involved in this project they discover not only these great new recordings but all 6 of my other original albums and lots of NEW DISCOVERY takes place.

And by raising more money for this project it helps me do advertising and marketing on-line to spread these songs and videos once the album is released.  

So the biggest challenge is HOW BIG CAN WE GROW THIS?

Please contribute now and help us grow this baby huge and get this music out there!

Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools available here to help us spread the word!

III. Tour Support - $1,500    A. Vehicle Maintenance (my van)   B. Equipment Maintenance 
Honestly, just by contributing to this campaign you're relieving me of a whole lot of financial stress and I'll love you forever for doing it. Thanks for reading this far down. sincerely, -Kev
Risks & Challenges 
Awesome news! There are very few risks and challenges to this project. I have already recorded the songs and have a pretty clear vision of how to finish it with the help of some very skillful people... mixing engineers, mastering, graphic artists, etc...The biggest challenge is HOW MANY PEOPLE CAN WE GET IT TO?  Really by contributing now your are helping me spread this music and this campaign to more people. By getting involved in this project they discover not only these great new recordings but all 6 of my other original albums and lots of NEW DISCOVERY takes place.And by raising more money for this project it helps me do advertising and marketing on-line to spread these songs and videos once the album is released.  So the biggest challenge is HOW BIG CAN WE GROW THIS?Please contribute now and help us grow this baby huge and get this music out there!Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools available here to help us spread the word!

story:
Join The Occultists Family

Emerging from the darkness we’ve found the light, a conscious and spiritual movement of esoteric knowledge and techno music.  We are Occultists and we are here to spread ancient teachings through dance, music, culture and magic. Occultists is a techno brand created by James Demon, who always dreamed as a young child of the night to merge his love for the occult and techno into one entity in the form of a record label. Mixing elements of gothic and techno together into a brand of witch techno that will undeniably be dance floor music for the Occultist in all of us. The label will feature artists who will emerge from the shadows bringing us to a higher state of being through music and esoteric knowledge

Searching out artists far and wide that matched his vision for the first release he eventually stumbled upon Montreal based producer and vocalist Dugong. He instantly fell in love with her one of kind style of dark minimalistic rhythms with spiritually in-depth lyrics that speak to the audience and capture them in its spell. Occultists is proud to present Dugong's Dead Man Rising EP.

We've chosen a special 12" vinyl release that will feature Dead Man Rising and Weak & Powerless with two vinyl only remixes from other names in the world of electronic music. Woebegone Revisted, The Evil Magician, & What May Come will be featured on an extended digital release that will follow the vinyl release next year. The extended release will also feature two other remixes that won't be featured on the vinyl.


Remixes By:


Alicia Hush (HushLamb)

Alicia is also a Montreal based producer and has been making a name for herself over the past few years on labels such as Archipel, Siteholder, and her own HushLamb imprint that she runs with Sarah Lamb. She first caught the ears of James Demon a few years ago with her one of kind productions. Follow her on Facebook and hear her music on Soundcloud.


Öona Dahl (All Day I Dream)

Öona Dahl has been following the Occultists project from the very beginning. She is the one who introduced James Demon to Dugong's music which catapulted this whole journey and vision. She has been working hard over the years on her solo productions and as part of Slumber but most recently she has been entrancing dance floors all summer as the newest part of the All Day I Dream family. Follow her on Facebook and hear her music on Soundcloud.

Jamaica Suk (Face To Face Recordings)

Jamaica Suk has been working her way up the ranks since relocating to Berlin from San Francisco a few years back. Taking influence from her jazz  and rock roots she infuses and synthesizes these elements together flawlessly to create a sonic experience for the body and soul. Follow her Facebook and hear her music on Soundcloud.

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of producing vinyl in the current market is quite expensive and this doesn't even include artwork, press for artists, remix fees etc. It's also very important to us that everyone involved and the artists themselves are receiving some kind of compensation for their art and hard work. We've decided to do things this way because we really want to create a solid family of artists and make something special for all of you.

We've created a campaign goal that will help get the first two releases off the ground. The second release will be a various artists compilation featuring some of our future artists and Dugong herself titled Book Of Shadows: Various Spells but more on that later. I've chosen a flexible campaign just in case we only fund half we can still do the first release. The release will come out digitally next year regardless of the campaign output but let's just face it vinyl is more fun!

We've created a basic tier of perks where you can pre-order the digital or vinyl release plus shipping for advanced release. This means you'd get them before they hit your favorite online and physical record shops. The higher tiers offer you a hand in being a permanent part of the Occultists family by giving you all releases on digital, vinyl, or both for life. We also have our highest perk which will include receiving all the Occultists merchandise we plan to incorporate including our Occultists tarot card deck that is in the works.

Risks & Challenges

This hasn't been an easy journey and we know that we will hit some more hurdles on the way but what we have plenty of is passion for our vision. We know that were in a digital generation where a lot of people are now just getting music for free and this will be a challenge but this is why we are creating some special for you. Something that you can be happy to be a part of!

Another major risk and I must mention this since I've already received some push on this. People seem to have a negative connection with the word occult. We hope to open up peoples minds to let them know that the word "occult" only means hidden. We want to share with you the hidden knowledge that will open up your mind through music and culture. Occultists has an enormous respect for knowledge and truth and we also have respect for the beliefs of others. We hope to inspire a movement of growing consciousness, therefore we hope to be received with a open mind and heart as we explore the mysteries of this existence in this new emerging platform we are creating.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it's not possible for everyone to help! We don't demand it from you and we understand what it's like. However if you believe in us and you can't contribute you can help us by spreading the word. Nothing speaks louder than your voice! By sharing our campaign using the IndieGogo easy share buttons you are doing us a tremendous favor by getting our vision out to the world and for that we welcome you with open arms into the Occultists family.

story:
‘Who You Were’ and Who We Can Be


On the heels of my fourth album, With or Without (2014), I am bringing a new album to life for 2016 called Who You Were. I hit several benchmarks over the past year, including reaching into the hundreds of thousands of streams on sites like Pandora, Spotify, Apple Music, as well as steadily increasing airplay on terrestrial and indie stations.  My fan base has been growing exponentially and the timing is right to release what I hope to be my breakout album.



2015 has been a very busy year.  In addition to a steady stream of accolades and radio play from places as far as the UK and New Zealand, I also earned a spot in the Songwriter Hall of Fame, appeared on season 9 of NBC’s The Voice, logged tours on both coasts, and signed an exclusive music licensing deal with Platform Music Group. All of this came from a year of hard work and one album that changed the way I see music. I am continuing down that path with my next release and I need your help to do it. With or Without wasn’t a breakout album, but it has put me in a position to have one.


Who You Were was born out of songs that weren’t finished in time to make it onto With or Without and the intense experiences of the last two years. With the band and talent behind With or Without we are taking the songwriting and performance to the next level that will hopefully deliver commercial success. My career has been 20 years in the making, and I feel like I am at the top of my craft and I want to share what I have learned with the world. This business is about momentum and striking while the iron is hot. This is my moment to shine, but I need your help to do it.


What We Need & What You Get


I am looking for a partnership, not a scholarship. I am trying to raise the funds to finish recording and to properly promote my next record. There are the obvious recording and pressing costs associated with making an album, but there is much more to making a record successful than recording good tunes and printing albums. A hard truth about the music world today is that it takes money to get in front of people. From having to pay to promote your music on social media to paying to have your music played on the radio, at the end of the day it comes down to dollars. In the past I have never had a budget for promotion and because of that all of my albums have been ’slow burners’, where they actually sell more and more as the years go on because new fans find me and have never heard of them before. My goal with Who You Were is to change that paradigm and to use this album to throw myself into the spotlight. All of you can help by sharing through social media, but my hope is that some of you will be able to help financially as well.


I am hoping to raise at least $15k. Of that money $5k will be spent on recording cost and album pressing (I will be matching that number personally), and the remaining $10k will go towards a publicity firm, online radio promotion, a high quality music video, and the creation of social media campaigns to get the music into as many ears as possible. We will also be using a small part of the funds raised to submit songs from the album for award consideration and showcases at festivals and conferences to help build notoriety quickly. I believe that the music will speak for itself, I just need people to hear it.


Some of the unique perks that are available for your contributions include original artwork, chord charts and lyrics to the album, songwriting mentorship sessions, and VIP tickets to exclusive live shows including a live video recording at Ex’pression College in Emeryville, CA. If we don’t make it to the $10k mark the funds raised will still go to the promotion of the album and will be prioritized into publicity, radio promotion, and social media. If we are able to exceed the goal, we will use the funds to extend the time of the promotions and to create more music videos and farther reaching social media campaigns.



The Impact


The timing is right and the music is the best that I have ever made. Momentum is the name of the game in the modern world and momentum is on my side. I can feel the wave building and you can be a part of seeing it crest. If you are a fan of my music, this is the most effective way to help me reach a dramatically larger audience with the best music that I have produced to date. Independent artists like myself have been changing our culture’s musical conversation in unprecedented ways in recent years. I want to add my voice of self-reliance, personal growth, joy, and love to that conversation. I honestly feel like I make music that can make people’s lives better, and if I have done that for one person, I can do it for a million.


By pledging to this campaign you will be adding your voice to mine in the effort to put real music— played by real people in a completely honest way—back into the popular conscience. I have self-released four albums over the last 11 years, and each of them are open, honest reflections of me and my beliefs in the success of our humanity over the trials of life. I confront the harsh edges of the world around me and I overcome, then I sit down with a guitar and a piece of paper and I tell people how I did it (hopefully in a way that doesn’t feel like I am preaching to them). I don’t seek out fame or riches, but I do think that I have something to say that is meaningful and needs to be heard. Help me share my voice.  


Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge that I face as an independent artist is finding a way to get my music to rise above the din. There is a tremendous amount of music being produced today, and with the ever-decreasing cost of recording, we are finding that the main hurdle to get over is simply getting your music into the places where people find new music. Those barriers are actually quite affordable in the scheme of things, but they are almost insurmountable to someone like me who lives off of his music. I am putting up all of the profits from With or Without to make Who You Were, wagering that with the help of my fans I will be able to break into a much more sustainable career when my music is exposed to a much larger audience.


I don’t make this bet lightly, or without a very strong belief that all I need is for a wide audience to hear my music. Every opportunity that I have had to showcase my music has ended in success and another opportunity. I have a long track record of reaching my goals even with very meager means. No matter what, I will continue to make music because it is who I am, not what I do, but I realize that the time is right for me to show you and everyone you know what I am capable of. If we don’t make it to $15k, the album will still be made, the songs will still be sung, but my hope is that with your help I will not have to ask for help again. With the connections that I have made in the last year through The Voice, Platform Music Group, and The Songwriter Hall of Fame, I believe that I am in a position to put my music in the right hands and in front of enough people to break through the din.



Other Ways You Can Help


Some of you aren’t able to kick in money, and trust me, I get that completely. Here are some other ways that you can help!

  • Share this campaign on social media, make some loud noise out there! Visibility is the ultimate goal of this project and it starts here.

  • Take advantage of Indiegogo’s share tools

  • Share links to my videos or music to your friends and family. Don’t be afraid to tell people that you like my music. You would be amazed at how many people have contacted me and said that they heard about me through a friend playing my music at a party and then became fans.

  • If nothing else, try to be the best person that you can be all of the time and love yourself and everyone around you.

I believe that with if we hit our financial goals I will be able to put my music on a national stage, but with that said this campaign is being done with the option of going over the goal. If we pass the $15k mark here is how the money would be used. I would purchase radio play for the best songs on the album, focus more money into a large online advertising push and bring in a specialist in the field, film more high quality music videos, and finally do a vinyl release of the album. I list these stretch goals to let you know that 100% of the money raised in this campaign goes directly into promoting the music in the most effective ways possible.

story:
I am Bria Bueno. I am a singer/songwriter, rapper, musician, dancer, and published model. I am manly from Arlington, Texas. During my youth I moved homes so frequently that songwriting became one of my only and most important concrete relationships as a child.
At first I was skeptical to pursue music as a career due to my anxiety disorder, as well as the lack of sources and financial support I had available. In high school, I recorded vocals for the first time on a friends track. I decided to seriously pursue a career as a singer/songwriter after the song I was featured on became my friends most popular and requested track. I gained experience preforming at house parties as well as venues in Dallas, Texas. From then, I began developing music as a solo artist.
Just last year I started to used magazine publications and social media websites to promote my voice. I worked on accumulating followers as an audience to, one day, release my music too. I now have 43,100+ followers on Instagram, and growing daily! My fans push me towards fulfilling my aspirations as a professional singer, and also to be the voice, the good person I would hope to influence my them to be. I have worked with a local friend, Rewind Records, in releasing a single Rise Above. I have yet to release a music video for the song Rise Above as well! You can find them on Youtube under Bria Bueno.
My  next step is to record a professional EP. I have been presented with an amazing opportunity to produce my EP with a very experienced, successful, and well- sourced producer from Los Angeles, California. He is a former member of the band, Plus One, and has the sources to make my wildest dreams come true almost instantly. All I need is the financial support to make it there and fund my EP.
All proceeds will go towards the funding of 4 songs for my EP, travel, and hotel stay for myself, husband, and son during our short stay in California while recording. This is everything i have ever dreamed of, everything i have always wanted. Every single fiber of my being is quaking with excitment assuring me that this is what I am meant for. I have the talent, I have a special style, the fans, the motive, and a genuine yearn to make a print of positivity in this world. With my voice, i will do my best to abolish shaming and judgment, spread self- love, positivity, and modesty. I wil lead by example.
By donating, you can personally help to make my dreams come true! Even $5. If you can't donate, PLEASE help by spreading the word to family and friends! You can also support my music by following my websites and sharing my news/photos/videos!:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRvtPp6SRWiKdV-_VCVD_VQ
www.instagram.com/darth_bria
www.briabueno.com
www.facebook.com/darth-bria

This is everything i have ever dreamed of, everything i have always wanted. Every single fiber of my being is quaking with excitment assuring me that this is what I am meant for. I have the talent, I have a special style, the fans, the motive, and a genuine yearn to make a print of positivity in this world. With my voice, i will do my best to abolish shaming and judgment, spread self- love, positivity, and modesty. I wil lead by example.By donating, you can personally help to make my dreams come true! Even $5. If you can't donate, PLEASE help by spreading the word to family and friends! You can also support my music by following my websites and sharing my news/photos/videos!:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRvtPp6SRWiKdV-_VCVD_VQwww.instagram.com/darth_briawww.briabueno.comwww.facebook.com/darth-bria

story:
ABOUT ME

Hi all! My name is Lennon Cantwell, from the fun forests Southern New Jersey. If you can't tell already, my parents named me "Lennon" after John Lennon - so right from birth, I've been destined for music. Music always played a big role in my family. My dad was the first person to sit me down and teach me how to really listen to music and see it as an art. When I picked up a guitar for the first time, I felt a passionate connection to it immediately. After a few years of playing, I started to sing and write songs. From there, it became an eternal love and I know it's what I was born to do.

MY PROJECT

This project is raising funds for my first professionally produced album for my project, "Burned Out Still Glowing," with Mike Davidson, a super talented Producer in Boston, MA. Mike is helping me develop my songs and really achieve a greater vision for the album as a whole and I'm so excited about this opportunity. Together, Mike and I have already recorded 1 song available for free streaming (directly below) called, "The Clown." This song is a great example of the kind of album we'll be able to make if this campaign is successful. If we reach our goal, I'll be able to get back into the studio with Mike and record the rest of the album. 


The success of this campaign would be an absolute game changer for me.  While I've made some smaller budget recordings in the past, my collaboration with Mike is on a totally different level. From a business standpoint, having a professional, high quality recording is totally integral to my success as an independent artist. On a personal level, this is the opportunity of my dreams and I'm so excited at the chance to make an album I can be truly proud of, and to share with all the people I love.

MY COSTS

The expenses for a professional quality recording add up quickly. I have covered the costs of recording “The Clown” on my own, and now I need your support to make the rest of the album a reality.

Your donation through this campaign will go toward covering the following expenses:

1. Pre-production & producer fees

2. Studio time for recording, mixing, & mastering

3. CD pressing & promotion

FOR YOU

I am so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign, and in exchange for your generosity, I've created some awesome gifts available exclusively through your participation in our campaign. You can donate by selecting a "perk" on the right-hand side of this page and clicking the pink "contribute now" button. Remember, every penny counts! Thanks again for checking out my campaign and I can't wait to share more music with you soon!

story:
Some of you  remember me, while others may be meeting me for the first time. I am Bryan Fontenot; Country Music entertainer and singer/songwriter. I recently took a couple of years off to contemplate my future and approach to music. After much thought and prayer, I decided to go back to what first compelled me to choose this walk down music road. Creating genuine, soulful, and heartfelt music was my first love. Now, I'm going back to her, and I need your help to make it happen.

Starting a new business venture requires hard work, perseverance, unwavering commitment and monetary investment. Restarting a music career can be even more challenging, but I am committed to accomplishing this goal. For the first time ever, your contributions will help us release an independent album free from the customary restraints of a major record label.

We've written songs, some of which will be included on my next album, others will be released as singles or included on the following album. My song "To the Highway" is climbing the Texas Music Charts right now. If I seem confident of success, I am. However, as previously stated, I can't do this alone.

I ask you to do what you can to help us achieve this goal. We will be partners in the endeavor and share in its rewards. We will make great music together and write a new chapter in country music history.

Please visit the link and gallery page. Enjoy the videos and get to know more about me. Learn who I am and "Who I Ain't". 

Thank You

God Bless,

Bryan Fontenot

story:
My name is Hardy Mwana. I have been waiting on the Lord for all my life just to see and live in His almighty power through songs, preaching, prayer ... For sure God has been faithful to me in all my ways even though I wasn't totally obedient to His word  and messing up all the time, but He didn't forsake, He didn't deny me. He keeps calling me His son and proving His love to me wherever I stand, knowing that God  chose me and gave to me a big mission to accomplish in the world. I have come to the point of realizing that everything I have from Him must be freely given away.

In order to allow every gift to perform He has chose to give me some revelation, words, and prophecy to be able to share them with the world. However, I kept using some excuses just to run away from His calling. Then, He told me to be strong and courageous, to fear not, and to not be dismayed. Arise and work! (1 Chronicles 22:11-16)

My album will be just the start of God's calling in my life to bring people into His presence and minister his love to the nations. The Lord has seen my heart, my courage, and my desire to stand and reach the nations. So now I am allowing Him to do more than what I expect.

The album will feature 10 songs in 5 languages: English, French, Swahili, Lingala, Kiluba. I have chose to use all these languages in the way of being thankful for whatever He has gave me to be used for His glory.

After this I looked, and behold, a great multitude that no one could number, from every nation, from all tribes and peoples and languages, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed in white robes, with palm branches in their hands. (Revelation 7:9)

I bring a unique personal and global perspective on worship that is global, freeing, authentic, and uniting.

For investing in this mission, I want to give you something in return. Please take a look at the gifts I will give to you in return for your gift to me on the right hand side of the page.

Truthfully, I could really use more money that I am asking for to make all the perks happen, pay for travel expenses, for production, for others recording with me. Together we can make that happen. Please share the campaign through Facebook, Twitter, email, word of mouth, no matter how much or how little you can give.

Soon a video will be uploaded with one of my songs to help you better understand my vision. This is not only about songs, but the bigger ministry the Lord has been calling me to my whole life for the Gospel.

story:
On Wednesday, May 20th, 2015, Dr. Faustus will present its latest project, New Synchronisms, inspired by Mario Davidovsky’s eponymous compositions. The concert will feature five world premieres of works for solo instrument and electronic sounds by composers Elizabeth Adams, André Brégégère, Nicholas R. Nelson, Inés Thiebaut, and Red Wierenga, performed by Jen Baker (tbn), Steve Beck (pf), Karen Kim (vn), Liam Kinson (cl), and John Singer (perc); and a performance of Mario Davidovsky’s Synchronism No. 12, performed by Ben Ringer (cl).

We are holding this online fundraiser to help us finance the commissioning fees for our composers: writing music takes time and energy, and we want to make sure that our composers are adequately compensated for the intense work they are putting in this project! We need to reach our $1,500 goal in order to accomplish that. 

Note that Dr. Faustus will also provide a professional fee for our outstanding performers, who are also putting a lot of effort into this project. We are working hard to cover these performing fees, as well as the other production costs associated with the project through other means (grants, private funding), but we could still use help: any amount we raise in addition to the $1,200 goal of this campaign will go towards these additional costs.

Thank you for reading, and please consider contributing today! Dr. Faustus is a small, composer-run organization without institutional support: any donation, large or small, means a great deal to us.

story:
Thanks for coming by - I raised enough money last week to fund the recording, now I need to raise a bit more for a video and marketing/PR support to get the song to #1.

Please join this email list for updates about the release - http://eepurl.com/bjZrGr

facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lets-get-Fck-off-back-to-Eton-to-number-1/1608951279349849

twitter - https://twitter.com/rgrey


Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background - I am a musician with a ukulele.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you - This is not about me, it is about bringing to people's attention the outrageous actions of the Tories the last five years.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve - We will keep the Tories out of power and give people hope again.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution? - Hope so.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you- I already raised £1.2k to record, produce, mix and master the song, I now need £1.5k to make a video and for PR/marketing support for the campaign.
  • Tell people about your unique perks - The perks are are very perky
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal - Just do a less ambitious release.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world - It will make people smile and help them to see through Tory lies.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one) - I have successfully produced four albums of my songs.
  • Make it real for people and build trust - Would you trust someone with a ukulele who swears in public?

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles - I am a good jumper.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges - Cake, hugs and people power.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign - Tell your friends!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! - Will do!!

And that's all there is to it - Thanks, that was fun.

story:
OUR STORY

Hello! This is Ataraxia. We're a five member metal/Hard Rock band from Bangalore, India. We're all students, trying to follow our passion. There's not much scope for heavy, hardcore music in India. So, those who opt this genre of music have to make it on their own. All of us in the band are from different places, have different habits, different lifestyles. But there's one common interest that we share and that's what brought us together, MUSIC.

We formed ATARAXIA a year back and have been regularly practicing and performing ever since.The word ataraxia comes from ancient greek "ἀταραξία".It means emotional tranquility or peace of mind. We've participated in two 'Battle of the Bands' and won in one of them. But till now we only played cover songs on stage. When we started composing our own music, it was transcendental! We could not wait to share our music with the world. 



DEMO TRACKS

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our primary goal is to raise at least $500-$1000 to get going. Some part of the money will be used to buy some better equipment like cymbals,processors etc. Plus majority of the funds will be going to studio bookings,Song mastering fees, CD distribution and so on.
  • We also have amazing perks for you if you contribute for our album! Digital album downloads, Posters, T-shirts, Mention on our website as sponsors, A personal Thank you video from the band and lots more!
  • We hope for your generous support and if we are able to reach our goal, awesome music should be on its way soon!


About the album- Tomorrow's Pain

Our album Tomorrow's Pain is based about the present day problems and the impact they are having on the world. We will be addressing problems like war, pollution, deforestation etc. and how these problems should be brought to an end.

  • This is our first album ever. And since it is based around current issues, it will reach out to the people.
  • We believe our aggressive style of music combined with these serious problems at stake will make a really good and impacting album.
  • We wish to spread the message of peace throughout the world and achieve serenity, as our name suggests.

Risks & Challenges

There are various risks involved in the music industry. But none that can't be handled. Also one of the major challenge will be to reach out to people since this is our first venture and we have not much public support.

  • The major hurdle will be the money because studios are very expensive to record in. Plus then there's the matter of selling the album, getting the word out.
  • We wish to tackle all the problems with sheer dedication and get the word out about our album by aggressive marketing strategies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our band and our album.
  • Share the campaign as much as possible. Follow us on our facebook page!
  • www.facebook.com/ataraxiamuzik

story:
www.infonordest.it is an independent platform that was developed using tools for 90% open source.

 To make the videos I invested resources and time, even if I use amateur equipment there are many costs involved (the server where I post infonordest, technical equipment video, gasoline to move by car or by train to go shooting). So you understand that without economic support will be very difficult to develop infonordest. For this reason, if you think that my videos can give you useful information, if you want to help me improving infonordest you can make a donation (even 1 euro is a drop that can help me to develop this project).

If you want to help communication and free creativity, please help me in indiegogo



www.infonordest.it es una plataforma de desarrollo independiente que investigo utilizando herramientas de código abierto de 90%.
Código abierto no significa gratis, es sólo otra forma de ver la propiedad intelectual y la información. Para hacer los videos he invertido recursos y mucho tiempo, incluso si uso equipos para aficionados esto implica ciertos costos (el servidor donde posteo infonordest, equipo de vídeo, gasolina para moverse en coche, dinero para ir en tren, etc). Por esta razón, si quiere ayudarme a mejorar infonordest usted puede hacer una donación (incluso 1 euro puede ayudar a desarrollar este projecto creativo).
Si quiere ayudar a la comunicación fotografica y a la libre creatividad, elija uno de los modos disponibles que se publican a continuación.

story:
We are set to begin recording the full length follow up to En to Pan in September and the funds raised will help cover the costs of recording, mixing and mastering the album as well as the physical aspects (artwork, layout)


"Divination" is a historical fiction concept record following a lowly patrician during ancient roman times and his thirst for power. Through a series of dreams he encounters a symbol that guides him. By using this symbol at the forefront of his campaign, he gains a substantial amount of political and military support. Soon following, his immense power distorts his reality and all his supporters will suffer the consequences of putting their trust into one man.

Notes about delivery dates-for any orders of current merch stock, we will ship out ASAP.  So please give us an address to ship to, or contact us to arrange local pick-up. The earliest the album will be finished will be December 2015, however we may need to push this release date back to early 2016 in order to get the recording and layout perfect, and to get physical copies printed.  We do plan to release the album digitally as soon as it is 100% done.
story_txt: We are set to begin recording the full length follow up to En to Pan in September and the funds raised will help cover the costs of recording, mixing and mastering the album as well as the physical aspects (artwork, layout)"Divination" is a historical fiction concept record following a lowly patrician during ancient roman times and his thirst for power. Through a series of dreams he encounters a symbol that guides him. By using this symbol at the forefront of his campaign, he gains a substantial amount of political and military support. Soon following, his immense power distorts his reality and all his supporters will suffer the consequences of putting their trust into one man.Notes about delivery dates-for any orders of current merch stock, we will ship out ASAP.  So please give us an address to ship to, or contact us to arrange local pick-up. The earliest the album will be finished will be December 2015, however we may need to push this release date back to early 2016 in order to get the recording and layout perfect, and to get physical copies printed.  We do plan to release the album digitally as soon as it is 100% done.

story:
A Night of New Beginnings

The EHE’s Super Healing concert will be our first presentation as a team and the first of it’s kind in Vallejo. And, this will be EHE’s first concert as Kahil El’Zabar, Hamiet Bluiett & Craig Harris!!! This is an incredible opportunity for our community. We need your help to make this the beginning of many more.

What we want to do

We have an incredible opportunity to present the EHE concert, on Feb 3rd, 2016 and even though we have absolutely no budget, we just had to say YES, YES, YES!  It would be crazy to pass up a chance to present these internationally acclaimed musicians in our town. I mean, this group is outrageous! And, that’s where you come in (drum roll and applause for you)!

What We Need & Why

The $2,500 we raise will be used for the following:
• Pay this incredible band!
• Venue rental
• Sound engineer & PA
• Security rental
• Chair rental
• Printing costs for posters/postcards, flyers
• Food & drink at the concert

Anything beyond that will go toward the band to help their tour and our next project. If we don't reach our goal, all the funds we raise will go toward the cost of the concert. Each donation will help tremendously to offset our costs.

We are working very hard to make this a success. We sincerely feel it will be an ointment of love, and balm of healing to everyone who attends. 

We have some great perks for you (see them on the right), so please do what you can. We will greatly appreciate your help at any level.

The Impact / Why we want to do it

Vallejo has seen some very hard times over the last few years. It’s citizens are strong and resilient. They are seeking change, inspiration, positive vibes and long for something more.

  • Being able to bring a band of this caliber to our town will raise the bar in levels of artistry, inspire hope and shine a new light on what folks can access here.
  • This “Super Healing” concert will also provide an opportunity for folks from all over the Bay to gather, create community and make new friends.
  • It will provide a “remedy” for mainstream predictability, business as usual, the worries of daily life, and be a reminder of the healing, spiritual bond between humanity. 

This “Super Healing” concert is just what the doctor ordered for our town and  for us all, right now!

About the Band / The Ethnic Heritage Ensemble

Coming from Chicago and NYC, the ensemble features bandleader & multi-percussionist Kahil El’Zabar, bass saxophonist Hamiet Bluiett, and trombonist Craig Harris. This trio of internationally acclaimed masters of progressive jazz and world music, brings their unique blend of inspiring, uplifting rhythmic and harmonic creativity to their “Super Healing” tour. Collectively, they bring to life over 100 years of music dedication & performance.

Kahil El'Zabar is considered by his peers to be one of the most prolific innovators of his generation. He has recorded more than sixty well-received projects, and has won numerous international awards as a musician and composer. Kahil is also very much about helping community. He works tirelessly, giving of his time, energy and creative wisdom to inspire and uplift folks in his hometown of Chicago as well as across the globe. His willingness to hold their kickoff concert in Vallejo is an example of wanting to support our dreams.

El’Zabar has worked with such luminaries as Dizzy Gillespie, Cannonball Adderley, Stevie Wonder, Donnie Hathaway, Pharoah Sanders, Neneh Cherry, Nina Simone, Ntozake Shange, David Murray, Nona Hendryx and Lester Bowie, to name a few.

As a cultural events specialist, El’Zabar created and produced Underground Fest – an avant-garde jazz festival. He also created and curated Traffic, for Steppenwolf Theater (an inter-disciplinary arts series which also spawned the National Public Radio show also titled Traffic). He has been creating and curating events as Artist in Residence in Bordeaux, France for the last 11 years.

In 2012 President Barak Obama’s administration awarded him the International Ambassador’s Award in the Arts. In 2014, Dr. Kahil El’Zabar was knighted by the Counsel General of France, and christened as a “Chevalier Medal of Letters” for his contribution to art & music. El’Zabar’s belief is that art expressed first from the heart, into the higher mind, inspires the journey to the soul.

Hamiet Bluiett has combined the avant-garde with traditional jazz for more than four decades! Along the way, he’s redefined the role of the baritone saxophone and co-founded the World Saxophone Quartet, one of the most successful bands on the fringe of modern jazz. In 1976, when the World Saxophone Quartet played its first concert, it introduced a new sound to jazz. It was revolutionary: No bass. No drums. No piano. Just four saxophones: the late Julius Hemphill playing alto, with Oliver Lake on alto and soprano, David Murray on tenor, and Hamiet Bluiett on clarinet and baritone sax.

His primary instrument is the baritone saxophone, and he is considered one of the finest living players of this instrument. He also plays (and records with) the bass saxophone, E-flat alto clarinet, E-flat contra-alto clarinet, and wooden flute. Bluiett is widely regarded as the most prominent baritone saxophonist of his generation.

Craig Harris is a trombonist, composer, conceptualist and educator. When he exploded onto the jazz scene in 1976, he brought the entire history of the jazz trombone with him. From the growling gutbucket intensity of early New Orleans music through the refined, articulate improvisation of the modern era set forth by J.J. Johnson, and into the confrontational expressionism of the ’60s avant-garde, Craig handled the total vernacular the way a skilled orator utilizes the spoken word.

Harris has performed with a veritable Who’s Who of progressive jazz’ most important figures —including Sun Ra, Cecil Taylor, Sam Rivers, Abdullah Ibrahim, Jaki Byard, Muhal Richard Abrams, David Murray, Henry Threadgill, Lester Bowie, The WORLD Saxophone Quartet, The Roots, RAKIM and the list goes on and on... His own projects display both a unique sense of concept and a total command of the sweeping expanse of musical expression, bringing him far beyond the confines of the jazz world and into the sphere of multimedia and performance art.

See why we're so excited to have them perform in our town???

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support this project and cannot donate financially, there are plenty of other things you can do!
  • Spread the word! Tell all your friends, family, social media peeps, employers, doctors, grocery clerks, teachers, spiritual advisers, mail carriers and anyone you meet! The more folks who know, the better chance there is of having of a successful event.
  • Donate folding chairs
  • Donate sound equipment and/or your sound engineering services
  • Donate plates, napkins, cups
  • Donate security services
  • Ask your employer to be a sponsor
  • Volunteer to help out. There are all sorts of things that need doing and we can always use an extra set of hands

Who we are and what we dream

We are a group of artists, musicians & music lovers developing a non-profit organization. Our desire is to present high caliber creative music concerts, workshops, collaborations and a yearly festival that will enrich, educate and empower others to express art at the highest level, while providing an opportunity for folks to gather, be uplifted and celebrate the beauty of life and artistic soul in each of us. We’d love to make Vallejo a cultural destination for the East and North Bay areas.

The team

story:
A long time ago in a galaxy far far away...

...the Juilliard composition and percussion departments worked together to present a concert of new music for percussion.  The concert was a smash hit (pun intended), and led to more collaborative efforts within Juilliard.  Focal Point 2.0: New Music for Harp, is the result of this effort.  The Juilliard harp and composition departments have spent the past few months working together; each harpist paired with a composer to present a series of concerts featuring new solo and chamber compositions for the harp.  
Thanks to a grant from Juilliard, we are excited to announce that this concert, Focal Point 2.0, will in fact be performed 2.0 times!  The kickoff performance is at The Juilliard School, and the subsequent performance is at St Peters Church in Manhattan.  
Our grant provided us the resources for space rental, but as a thank you to the musicians who spent so much time preparing, we are asking for your help in raising funds to pay the performers.  Any amount is helpful, and all money goes directly to the players!  If you would like to help the development of new works for harp, please consider donating.  We are so grateful for your support!

story:
THE POCONO FOLK/PAGAN/VIKING METAL FESTIVAL NEEDS YOUR HELP!!

Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign!! My name is Jeff Addison and I am the founder and organizer of the Pocono Folk Metal Festival. What is this event you are probably asking yourself? This event attempts to bring the style of European music festivals such as PAGANFEST, DARK TROLL, HORNERFEST, RAGNAROK, INTO THE WOODS and many others to the US......incredible musicians playing folk, pagan, or viking styles of music plus amazing and talented vendors selling pagan and viking inspired wares from music and clothing to housewares to jewelry to weaponry and armor.  Here is the EPIC promotional video from last year's event created by Bill Gogel from GOG Productions (https://www.facebook.com/GOGproductions1) ......

The 1st installment last year featured 10 bands and a dozen vendors and for a first time try at it, it went extremely well.....exceeding my expectations and hopefully of those who were there! Now I am at the crossroads,,,,the next festival cannot be the same as last year and needs to grow larger and that requires additional funding to do so. The response of bands and vendors has been overwhelming.....I currently have a list of over 40 bands wanting to play the next installment plus more vendors......WOW!! Last year's event worked because of the scale and because I was basically able to pay for it all myself along with the proceeds of the ticket and shirt sales. Unfortunately that will probably not be enough to cover the expenses of growing the festival.....that is where your contributions come in!!

What would your contribution go to?? There are numerous possibilities but a few of the items that would need to be addressed would be:

LARGER VENUE (whether indoor or outdoor): We were lucky enough last year to have a partner with the Sherman Theater in Stroudsburg, PA and use their "Living Room" space for the show along with the lobby for the vendors.....possibly we would be there again and be able to afford the MAIN STAGE this time. If not an option, then I would look to secure another location somewhere in NE Pennsylvania.....

MUSIC BACKLINE: rental of a "house system" for the bands to perform with (drums, amplifiers, speakers, monitors, microphones, etc)....makes for quicker band switch over and allows for more bands to perform and/or have longer set times.....

LODGING: Most of the bands from last year were relatively close (within a few hours) of the festival. Now there are bands willing to travel from HUNDREDS or THOUSANDS of miles to play but will need a hotel stay to be able to participate....

FOOD/BEVERAGES: It would be nice to be able to feed the bands/crew/vendors as I did last year again....the least I could do for their participation!!

MARKETING: From printing of flyers and shirts to possibly doing print ads either in local newspapers or magazines or radio ads promote the show....Facebook and Twitter can only get you so far!!

Still not convinced to help?? Here are a couple of videos from the show......the first one is the first ever live performance of dark folk metallers DUSKMOURN.......

Pretty cool right?? How about a track from the mighty WINDFAERER???


Hopefully these are enough to convince you to help us!! Please spread the word even if this is not your cup of tea....maybe you have a friend or co-worker that is into heavy music? Or maybe your significant other? Everyone is welcome!! FAILURE IS NOT AN OPTION!! I will make this happen one way or the other but will certainly be more successful with your help!!! If we reach our goal, any left over monies will go towards next year's edition......Again many thanks for taking the time to check this out....HAIL!!!! STAY FOLKY AND STAY HEAVY!!!

Jeff Addison-----Pocono Folk/Pagan/Viking Metal Festival

story:
Please help American composer Eugene Magalif share his beautiful uplifting orchestral music with the world!

Eugene was a rising star pop music composer in Soviet Belarus - his music was constantly played on the radio, and he collaborated with top artists on albums and musicals. When he moved to the US in the early 1990s, his promising career was cut short, while he worked, like many immigrants, doing everything from carpet cleaning to perfume factory work! As he adjusted to life in the US, he worked for many years as a music teacher in an inner city environment, bringing his love of music to the most underprivileged in our society. While he kept composing occasional pop songs, composition was mainly on the back burner.

But life intervened! Inspiration came in the form of an unlikely muse - a middle-aged balding former army buddy (and a renowned flutist) asked him to compose something for his daughter's graduation from music college. What followed, in the span of only a few days was "Fairy Tale" - a whimsical nouveau-classical piece for piano and orchestra hailed as "great music with an elegant appearance - a real feast and a real fairy tale!" by the critics.


Shortly afterward, as Eugene sat in his kitchen in suburban New Jersey, he saw what would become the inspiration for a piece that conquered the flute world by storm and blazed a path for all future orchestral works - a lovely little fluttering hummingbird (colibri). Since then, "Colibri" has been performed in over 50 countries around the world, by various instrumental combinations from symphony orchestras to duets, featuring flute, piccolo, and, most recently, even balalaika (!!!) as the solo.

At the same time as "Colibri" took off, Eugene was diagnosed with cancer. With the help of fantastic doctors as well as family and friends, Eugene overcame it and continued composing. A flurry of compositions followed, and now, his orchestral pieces have been performed in over 75 countries and on all continents (except Antarctica!) at various philharmonics, opera houses, concert halls and even at the White House! The scores of the various pieces are published by music publishers in the US and the UK. His music have been described as "delightful, first of all in its professionalism, as well as quite amusing and witty" (Maestro Yuri Temirkanov, Chief Conductor of the St. Petersburg State Philharmonic Orchestra).


Eugene received various recordings of the performances, but they vary widely in instrumental combinations and quality of the recordings. So, we wanted to record a full album of his collected orchestral works collaborating a world class symphony orchestra and conductor, using professional sound engineers and equipment to bring his amazing new compositions to the world! Not everyone gets a second chance to do what they love and use their talents to benefit other human beings. As a music teacher in an inner city public school, Eugene was unable to afford making the recording. Now, with even more compositions under his belt and being able to focus on music full-time, it's the perfect time to make it happen. And he really needs your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording a professional quality classical album is time-consuming and expensive. You have to find an amazing symphony orchestra with fantastic instruments, a great conductor, and the time and ability to record.

We have identified and coordinated with a renowned European symphony orchestra and fantastic conductor who are already starting rehearsals. However, we need to fund payment for and international team of musicians, conductor, soloists, and audio and video staff, as well as equipment. Along with the audio CD recording, we will also give a Concert for Peace featuring the composer's works, and we need funding for the venue as well as travel and accommodations for several distinguished international soloists. After the recording, the audio CD and the Blu Ray of the Concert both need to be mixed, edited, designed, and produced, all of which requires funding.

Here's an approximate breakdown of how the funds will be used:

  • $10,000 - Orchestra, conductor, concert hall & recording venue
  • $5,000 - Recording, mixing & processing of audio & video
  • $3,500 - Flights and accommodations for the composer & soloists
  • $3,000 - CD and Blu Ray design and production
  • $2,500 - IndieGoGo, PayPal & credit card processing fees
  • $1,000 - Shipping costs (to deliver perks)
As thanks for your support of this monumental project, we have a number of amazing perks which all feature copies of the album.
We've named all the perks after birds as an homage to the tiny inspiration for Eugene's most famous piece "Colibri" (hummingbird). We hope you enjoy them as much as we do!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project with all your friends! We very much appreciate your help!!

Orchestra).

Eugene received various recordings of the performances, but they vary widely in instrumental combinations and quality of the recordings. So, we wanted to record a full album of his collected orchestral works collaborating a world class symphony orchestra and conductor, using professional sound engineers and equipment to bring his amazing new compositions to the world! Not everyone gets a second chance to do what they love and use their talents to benefit other human beings. As a music teacher in an inner city public school, Eugene was unable to afford making the recording. Now, with even more compositions under his belt and being able to focus on music full-time, it's the perfect time to make it happen. And he really needs your help!   What We Need & What You Get Recording a professional quality classical album is time-consuming and expensive. You have to find an amazing symphony orchestra with fantastic instruments, a great conductor, and the time and ability to record.
We have identified and coordinated with a renowned European symphony orchestra and fantastic conductor who are already starting rehearsals. However, we need to fund payment for and international team of musicians, conductor, soloists, and audio and video staff, as well as equipment. Along with the audio CD recording, we will also give a Concert for Peace featuring the composer's works, and we need funding for the venue as well as travel and accommodations for several distinguished international soloists. After the recording, the audio CD and the Blu Ray of the Concert both need to be mixed, edited, designed, and produced, all of which requires funding.
Here's an approximate breakdown of how the funds will be used:

$10,000 - Orchestra, conductor, concert hall & recording venue
$5,000 - Recording, mixing & processing of audio & video
$3,500 - Flights and accommodations for the composer & soloists
$3,000 - CD and Blu Ray design and production
$2,500 - IndieGoGo, PayPal & credit card processing fees
$1,000 - Shipping costs (to deliver perks)

As thanks for your support of this monumental project, we have a number of amazing perks which all feature copies of the album.
We've named all the perks after birds as an homage to the tiny inspiration for Eugene's most famous piece "Colibri" (hummingbird). We hope you enjoy them as much as we do!




    Other Ways You Can Help Please share this project with all your friends! We very much appreciate your help!!

story:
AM I A PRODUCT OF A BEAUTIFUL MIND OR A BEAUTIFUL MIND TURNED INTO A PRODUCT?

I'm here to raise the funds to break free from my music contract.

DOWNLOAD MY FREE EP HERE


Hey everybody!

I'm an italian/mexican rapper/singer/songwriter whose heart started beating where they eat spaghetti raised between Turin (north Italy) London and Los Angeles.

In 2009, while visiting a clothing store in Italy, I got introduced to a music producer owner of the shop but also funder of an upcoming italian record label. I got invited to the studio (which was located on the top floor) to show some skills. I clarified that I was a dancer and not a rapper but they kept on insisting (maybe I looked like one lol)

I dropped a freestyle (really not knowing where i was going with it) but I impressd him so much that he offered me to sign a RECORD DEAL with his label. (Awesome I though.. I never did this before and they offering me a contract for it?! Yeahh!!..)

I decided to sign the contract thinking I had nothing to loose. (I was young and naive and completely unaware of how the music business worked).

Few months after, I released my first EP with my first original work which didn't make any major impact. The production team, therefore, started not to follow me as an artist as before. My music (TRAP, HIP HOP) wasn't considered "commercial enough" to sell at that time (2009).

Anyhow I decided to dig deep into my capabilities, writing lyrics everyday and associating with people involved in the UNDERGROUND music scene.

WHAT DOES  UNDERGROUND MEANS???
1) A genre in music often characterised by its high levels of originality and experimentation, and does not conform to typical trends as set by the popular mainstream media.

So I started to release videos on YOUTUBE and getting good feedback

Since chemistry wasn't there anymore, I asked for a release from the contract in 2011 but the label asked me for 10.000 EUROS to let me go.

Unfortunately (as you can probably imagine) I didn't have that money. I had been told that my music wasn't sellable in Italy but  more suitable for a US market. So few months later they came up with a "brilliant" offer. They were going to pass my contract to a label from the US who had shown interest in me (like a pet at the pet store...or potatoes at the market ...You choose lol)

I didn't want to sign another exclusive deal and I asked to go independent

Their reply?

"YOU WILL NEVER MAKE IT AS AN INDEPENDENT ARTIST"

Not having much of a choice I ended up signing this other agreement which was, as the previous one, an EXCLUSIVE DEAL.

During the first year of the term I delivered 68 DEMO TRACKS to the label, having none of them released.

AN ALBUM was considered such ONLY IF the label retained the tracks in it were commercially satisfactory and I had signed 5 to them!!!

My music was defined as “UNDERGROUND S***” and the only thing the label did was releasing a mixtape in 2014 (thanks DATPIFF!) 

GOTTA LOVE IT MIXTAPE

I asked for a release many times but they asked me for 10.000 DOLLARS to be released.

In July 2014 I got contacted by multiplatinum italian rapper FEDEZ  who had seen my  UNDERGROUND videos on Youtube and asked me for a feature on his next album. The video went to 1 MILLION VIEWS ON YOUTUBE only after a week on air, gaining me much popularity and attention.


I asked the label for another release but unfortunately they weren't keen on letting me go (I guess I had turned from a  potatoe to a gold egg chicken )

Later that year, October 2014,  I got approached by UNIVERSAL MUSIC ITALY who was curious about my current artistic situation. 

I didn't tell anything to the label since no deal was on the table and they were just asking for more info about my projects. Unfortunately the label found out we were talking and later that month put me under a suspension clause for slanderous conduct. They assumed I was being shady trying to overstep them by signing with Universal.

WHAT DOES SUSPENSION CLAUSE MEANS???

2) The artist can't make music/write lyrics nor release/sell tracks to the public.


So ...

I've been under this clause from A YEAR and decided to go to NEW YORK to talk to my label face to face. She still wants money and % on my future works but I'm not keen to give up my rights to them. Especially after not helping me with my career.

She kept me under a suspension clause for 1 YEAR and now the only thing I'M ALLOWED TO DO is releasing music for free (obviously she wants me to be a starving artist)

SHE THINKS I HAVE MASSIVE DEALS ON THE TABLE AND IS ASKING ME 10.000 EUROS TO GET OUT OF THE CONTRACT

So I'm raising the funds to break free from my current music contract.

I decided to give it 30 DAYS because once she will see I'm doing this campaign she will probably put some legal pressure on me and threaten me with violation of contractual clauses only because I'm making this public. 

WE NEED MUSIC, WE NEED CREATIVITY and NOBOBY has the right to imprison somebody's intellectual rights and make them theirs for an illimitate amount of time. I'm also motivated by the big number of artists who have been shelved by record labels and ended their career taking drugs or going mentally insane because of what happened to them. All I ever did was "hustling" with everyday's HARD WORK which was starting to PAY OFF.  

I'm giving away a FREE ALBUM ( half english half italian) for your support DOWNLOAD AT www.freeluciouz.com and little "poetry" perks which can contribute to raise the funds. I hope you will back me up on this because all I need are my fans, my supporters and the people that enjoyed my music in the past and support freedom of expression. 

IF YOU CANT CONTRIBUTE WITH 1$ I WILL BE HAPPY IF YOU COULD SHARE MY SOCIAL MEDIA LINKS / WEBSITE / CAMPAIGN!!!! FIND THE TOOLS BELOW! ALSO MAKE SURE YOU DOWNLOAD THE ALBUM AND GIVE ME YOUR FEEDBACK!!! 

THANK YOUUUU!!!! 

LUCIOUZ

DOWNLOAD MY FREE EP HERE

story:
Odysseus Chamber Orchestra To Perform Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 in Frisco and McKinney with the Frisco Chorale.


We are an award-winning professional orchestra serving the communities of Frisco and McKinney. In 2014 the Odysseus Chamber Orchestra chose McKinney and Frisco to be its new home. The arts in these cities are booming with passionate citizens who love the arts, but neither city has a residential professional orchestra to call its own. The Odysseus Chamber Orchestra intends to foster and build the love for classical orchestral music in these cities. On April 24 and 25 the Odysseus Chamber Orchestra will team up with the Frisco Chorale to present the masterful Beethoven Symphony  No. 9. This is an historic event in Frisco and McKinney for it showcases the talent that the Frisco Arts Association and the McKinney Arts Commission has worked so hard to attract. It is our hope that this event will also foster a passion to help Frisco build its very own performing arts center.
Our goal is to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of the performance which include paying the talented musicians in our orchestra, renting the performance facilities and other program expenses. These funds will also be used to promote and publicize the event, an expense we expect to offset through increased ticket sales. We feel this is an important part of our mission in order for us to continue to provide high level and award winning music to the communities of Frisco and McKinney. 

Frisco has been one of the fastest-growing cities in the nation for the past several years. Beginning in 2016, it will be the new headquarters for the Dallas Cowboys in an area of development that has been called "the $5 billion mile" because of the scale of projects that are under construction. In 2014, McKinney was named the #1 "best place to live" by Money Magazine and has also been one of the fastest growing cities in Texas. The cultural arts not only provide a positive social and educational benefit to the community, they provide a critical input to the overall economic prosperity of the areas they serve. The Odysseus Chamber Orchestra is committed to providing this missing cultural link for Frisco and McKinney.

For such a young orchestra, we have accomplished much artistically, winning national awards two years in a row. However, an orchestra cannot be sustained on talent and awards alone. Your support will help us secure our future in Frisco and McKinney by assisting us with contributions that will enable us to continue providing exceptional programs while we expand our audience to become self-supporting. Your contribution will also provide encouragement to each of our talented musicians by letting them know that the public views the orchestra as playing an important role in improving the quality of life in the community.  

If you are able to make a financial contribution, it will be greatly appreciated. You can also help us by sharing this with friends who have an interest in the cultural arts and would love to have an award-winning professional orchestra performing in the local community. 

Share it on your facebook and help us spread the word.
