story:
Short Summary

Hey guys, my name is Aine and I'm a singer songwriter from Bowen Island/Vancouver BC. I've been passionate about music my entire life and have spent the last year and a half writing my debut album and playing shows around the lower mainland. I'm incredibly exited to record my album professionally, the only problem is I'm $4000 short of what I need to make this a reality. By contributing to my campaign, you'll allow me to finish this project that I've put so much time, effort, and love into. I cannot thank you enough for helping me with this. Whatever you can contribute will make a world of difference for me. 

Heres my website for more information about me.


What I Need & What You Get

The funds raised through this campaign will go towards paying session musicians to play the instruments I don't play, paying my producer to mix and master the album, and the cost of printing physical copies of the album. Theres lots of awesome perks for anyone who contributes, including albums, tickets, and an exclusive single recorded for contributors. Reaching the goal in 30 days will allow me to stay on schedule for the album release and help me get the perks to you guys as soon as possible. If the goal is not reached, I will honour all the funders contributions by sending the perks out when the album does eventually get released.      


The Impact

As many of you may know, I am only 17 years old. It's unusual for someone my age to have the opportunity to create a full studio album while still in highschool. I intend to follow this through and can assure you there will be more to come in the near future. By helping me with this project, you are helping me kickstart my career in music. I have poured my heart and soul into this album for the last year and a half and would love to be able to share it with the world as soon as possible. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot monetarily contribute, here's some other ways you can help:

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, email, and other social networking sites. Even if you can't contribute, maybe some of your friends can.

Listen to my acoustic single and share it with your friends. Currently my single is available on my soundcloud page for streaming and free download Here

You can also like my Facebook page and follow me on Twitter

story:
What We're Doing and Why We Need Help

Guitar Club started in a Brooklyn apartment to address a lack of music programs in the New York public school system. It evolved into a program that prepares students for success, by fostering respect through hands-on work, community, cooperation and self-reliance through peer-based teamwork that produces young leaders--and guitar enthusiasts.

Guitar Club provides musical enrichment to K through 12 students. It works because it is fun and empowers students to take responsibility for their own music-based education while giving them ownership of their after school enrichment.

The history of how we got there is simple: one teacher for six kids was a stretch. Then it happened. That first "class" of six friends in the Brooklyn apartment reached a tipping point. Things were moving slowly. Frustrated, the children spontaneously broke off into one-on-one sessions between a child who had mastered a skill and a child who hadn't. The tone was collaborative and respectful. The teacher was then free to help that process. The class moved to a local middle school where it was opened up to one 7th grade class, with eight students. A year later, there were more than 40 students from grades six through eight.

The lack of resources turned a group dynamic into a unique solution: with only two teachers for all those kids, the more advanced students in the group began teaching their peers. The process was organic, and had great results. Kids shared guitars, and progress was made.

While it is great to watch the kids teach each other, increasing demand for the program points to the need for next steps. It is time to create online curriculum and hire teachers to expand the program and make it scalable so that schools can offer Guitar Club no matter where they are located. 

Other schools are already expressing interest. We know this: When everyone teaches everyone, the children have fun and make a lot of progress.

We also know they need facilitators and a robust online curriculum. We can reach far more than the 40 children who have tapped into a new found passion for making music. Guitar Club is a place where children can make friends and learn a skill that will be with them their entire lives.

Since many children can't afford guitars, we've been working on a need-based model so that not having an instrument isn't an obstacle for membership. So, we need money to purchase instruments, and we need to put together a web site where learning materials--including lessons produced by Guitar Club students--can be found.

  • Guitar Club is scalable and easy to introduce to new schools.
  • Music enrichment is crucial to child development
  • A contribution of $150 buys a guitar.
  • We want to make Guitar Club available widely.

Guitar Club is about community, sharing and camaraderie. Through mentoring each other, children learn citizenship that will help in every walk of life.

What We Need

  • We need to buy guitars!
  • We need to create web-based curriculum.
  • Guitar Club is looking for new volunteers and new schools.
Contact: guitarclubofamerica@gmail.com

story:
Rare Gems: An Art of the Negro Spiritual Recording Project

Rare Gems is the working title for a project that has grown dear to my heart, and I am asking your support to make it happen. 

I have been singing all of my life--in fact, my mother says I sang in her womb!  And I've been singing the Negro Spiritual for as long as I can remember.  For more than 25 years, I have concentrated my studies on this music and shared it with others through performances, lectures and writings--even as part of my online radio station, Afrocentric Voices Radio.

Along the way, I've found songs composed from the Negro Spiritual by famed composers like William Grant Still, Robert Nathaniel Dett, Florence Price and others--that I believe have never or rarely been commercially recorded.  I want to gather these Rare Gems together onto a recording that would be available to all interested in this wonderful music.

For example, you have possibly heard me perform Margaret Bonds' beautiful song cycle, Five Creek-Freedmen Spirituals, in recital.  (If you haven't, there's a video of me singing a track available in the Gallery.)  Various songs have been commercially recorded separately, but not the cycle as a whole.  I want to make this happen so a wider audience can hear this lovely work as well as other songs like it.

Joining me on this project is collaborative pianist Marlys Grimm.  Marlys and I have only been working together for a couple of years, but she "gets" what I am doing when I am singing Negro Spirituals.  She has brought superb artistry and musicality  to our performances together.

Putting Rare Gems Together

Putting this recording together will be a labor of love for me.  Unfortunately, however, it will cost a bit more than love to see it through to completion.  I'm projecting expenses to reach $5,000 to cover these cost:

  • Music score purchase
  • Rehearsal time
  • Studio recording time (including paying pianist and engineer)
  • Acquisition of recording rights for copyrighted songs
  • Recording mastering and production

The recording would occur at Grinnell College in January, 2016, while the school is on Winter Break, with an expected release three months later in April. or early May

How You Can Help This Rare Gems Project

Your role as a benefactor in this 60-day campaign is crucial because Rare Gems can't happen without your support!  

Every dollar helps, and I appreciate whatever level of support you provide.  To say a more tangible "Thanks," however, there are gifts for donors at different levels.  All levels will be acknowledged in the program celebrating the release of Rare Gems.

I also plan to create a special Rare Gems  emblem--similar to the one pictured here but using the titles of the songs performed on the recording--that will be placed on limited edition, one-time only items as gifts to donors at specific levels.  The perks would look like this:

More details are listed on the right side of this page.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply can't contribute financially between now and the end of the 60-day campaign, you can still help me make Rare Gems a reality by:

  • Passing the word on social media and beyond about Rare Gems and ask folks to visit this site for information and to donate to the project.
  • Keeping me and those who are working with me in your thoughts and  prayers.
  • Purchasing the recording (available on CD and electronically) when it is released next Spring for $10.00.

Do you have any questions or comments?  Please use the "Contact" link above or email me at research@artofthenegrospiritual.com.

Thank you for considering the Rare Gems project campaign and for supporting my continued work with Negro Spirituals!!  

Randye Jones
story_txt:
Rare Gems: An Art of the Negro Spiritual Recording Project
Rare Gems is the working title for a project that has grown dear to my heart, and I am asking your support to make it happen.  
I have been singing all of my life--in fact, my mother says I sang in her womb!  And I've been singing the Negro Spiritual for as long as I can remember.  For more than 25 years, I have concentrated my studies on this music and shared it with others through performances, lectures and writings--even as part of my online radio station, Afrocentric Voices Radio.
Along the way, I've found songs composed from the Negro Spiritual by famed composers like William Grant Still, Robert Nathaniel Dett, Florence Price and others--that I believe have never or rarely been commercially recorded.  I want to gather these Rare Gems together onto a recording that would be available to all interested in this wonderful music.
For example, you have possibly heard me perform Margaret Bonds' beautiful song cycle, Five Creek-Freedmen Spirituals, in recital.  (If you haven't, there's a video of me singing a track available in the Gallery.)  Various songs have been commercially recorded separately, but not the cycle as a whole.  I want to make this happen so a wider audience can hear this lovely work as well as other songs like it.
Joining me on this project is collaborative pianist Marlys Grimm.  Marlys and I have only been working together for a couple of years, but she "gets" what I am doing when I am singing Negro Spirituals.  She has brought superb artistry and musicality  to our performances together.
  Putting Rare Gems Together
 Putting this recording together will be a labor of love for me.  Unfortunately, however, it will cost a bit more than love to see it through to completion.  I'm projecting expenses to reach $5,000 to cover these cost:

Music score purchase
Rehearsal time
Studio recording time (including paying pianist and engineer)

Acquisition of recording rights for copyrighted songs

Recording mastering and production


The recording would occur at Grinnell College in January, 2016, while the school is on Winter Break, with an expected release three months later in April. or early May 



How You Can Help This Rare Gems Project
Your role as a benefactor in this 60-day campaign is crucial because Rare Gems can't happen without your support!  Every dollar helps, and I appreciate whatever level of support you provide.  To say a more tangible "Thanks," however, there are gifts for donors at different levels.  All levels will be acknowledged in the program celebrating the release of Rare Gems.I also plan to create a special Rare Gems 
emblem--similar to the one pictured here but using the titles of the songs performed on the recording--that will be placed on limited edition, one-time only items as gifts to donors at specific levels.  The perks would look like this:

More details are listed on the right side of this page.
  Other Ways You Can Help If you simply can't contribute financially between now and the end of the 60-day campaign, you can still help me make Rare Gems a reality by:  Passing the word on social media and beyond about Rare Gems and ask folks to visit this site for information and to donate to the project.
Keeping me and those who are working with me in your thoughts and  prayers.
Purchasing the recording (available on CD and electronically) when it is released next Spring for $10.00.


Do you have any questions or comments?  Please use the "Contact" link above or email me at research@artofthenegrospiritual.com. 
Thank you for considering the Rare Gems project campaign and for supporting my continued work with Negro Spirituals!!  
Randye Jones

story:
THE IDEA

Help us create The Electric Guitar Show an exciting new WebTV series created by guitarists for guitarists.  Hosted by Stuart Bull, Tom Quayle and the fabulous Hayley Leggs TEGS is a fast moving format packed with guitar chat, features, interviews, gear reviews and star profiles. Above all TEGS is going to be fun with some great guitar playing from our hosts, our guests and our superb in house band.

All musicians share a special bond and TEGS wants to make that bond with the estimated 50 million guitar players out there across the world.  Witty, edgy and driven by the adrenaline of a live audience there’s something for everyone whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned pro.

We are looking for £30,000 to fund the first series of six 45 minute shows which will be available FREE on www.electricguitarshow.com, Youtube and Vimeo during the summer 2015. We hope to build a fan base which will enable further series of TEGS to build the global TV audience the electric guitar truly deserves.

THE SHOW

Throughout the series we will celebrate the style, sound and career of some of the world's greatest players. Each show will feature an artist and here the band really show their talent with some fantastic tributes. In My Guitar History we ask a guest how they came to chose their current axe and hear some of their embarrassing guitar stories of the past. Stu then guides them through the tricky Star with a Reasonably Priced Guitar challenge. You can also ask Stu about that difficult guitar part in Riffbusters.

Tom is not only a brilliant player but has that special gift to explain the technical side of guitars and guitar gear. Tom gives us some great tips on everything from guitar buying to equipment reviews to finding that elusive guitar tone. You can also contact him to solve your own guitar problem.

Hayley takes TEGS out on the road and is working on stories like Why Relic a Perfectly Nice Guitar?, Attack of the Cover Bands and Marshall: 50 Years of Glory. She also takes a regular peek at some of the Online Guitar Heads who inhabit the internet. We will also introduce Professor Rock – journalist Malcolm Dome is our very own walking talking encyclopedia of rock.

There’s also a chance for you to play a part in the programme.  We will be using the best comments and ideas from our social media site. There will also be competitions with some great gear prizes and giveaways.

Please visit www.electricguitarshow.com for more background on our presenters, guests, band as well as what’s coming up. You can also browse some of our exclusive merchandise.


THE HOSTS

TEGS is hosted by mega talented player Stuart Bull. His easy going charm has inspired thousands of guitar players through LickLibrary the video music tuition company he founded over 15 years ago. 


Tom Quayle is not only a superb player but possesses that special techno brain that helps us understand what’s under the bonnet of rock and roll. Tom takes us through some gear reviews and shows us how to get the best from the stuff we own.


Adding her own unique twist is musician and Total Rock Radio DJ Hayley Leggs. Hayley will be on the road bringing us some great guitar stories as well as some great music and gear giveaways.

TEGS our in house band not only top and tail the show but jam with visiting guests and help demo styles and equipment. Always cheery they suffer the endless brunt of Stu’s jokes.


THE PRODUCTION TEAM

Kim Waller is our executive producer. He is the co-founder and business brains behind LickLibrary.com Britain’s leading video music tuition company. Kim reckons there are 50 million guitar players out there that would love to see TEGS.

Stuart Bull is our hostand the musical talent behind LickLibrary.com. He has been a professional guitarist and drummer all his working life with years of gigging and many TV appearances behind him. Stu now has more than 20 years experience in front of the camera with LickLibrary.com.

Brian Marshall our producer is another guitar nut who recently produced and directed Play It Loud: The Story of Marshall for the BBC. Brian has 14 classic amplifiers in various states of repair.

Doug Smith is a widely experienced director who has worked with Roxy Music, Iron Maiden and Saxon. Doug also plays in his own 60’s tribute band.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Peter Graham,  a singer song writer and vocal coach in London, UK.

The tsunami in Northern Japan on March 11th 2011 was a huge disaster with 20,000 killed or missing and many more displaced. Even now 100s of thousands are still living in temporary concrete boxes. 

As children  grow up in this bleak atmosphere, it gets harder to see  hope for the future.

The suicide rate in these areas is much higher than the national average. Re-housing has become a complicated issue, Differences between residents and policy makers have delayed progress while other commitments for government funds get ever more pressing, most notably the 2020 Olympics.

These concerts will give moral support and also draw attention to the urgent need to bring people out of this 'temporary' state into a positive, self sustaining one.

The plan is to go into the high schools and community centres, putting on solo 'mini-concerts', mainly in Kesennuma, one of the worst hit towns.  I already have a lot of experience playng my songs with positive images of Japan around the country.

This will be for two weeks in October 2015, with the aim for gradually reaching other communities

The Kesennuma Reconstruction Association is helping to organise the schedule and keep us busy for the two weeks!

To see the video talk from Peter:-

http://www.mindsongs.us/hopedreams.html

For more about Kesennuma:-

http://www.mindsongs.us/kesennuma.html

http://www.worldcultureassociation.com/tsunami.html

http://www.economist.com/news/asia/21642216-rebuilding-north-eastern-region-tohoku-being-bungled-grinding

私の名前はピーター・グラハム、ロンドンを拠点に作詞作曲、歌手としての活動、およびボーカルコーチをしています。

2011年3月の東日本大震災では2万人以上の方が犠牲となり、多くの行方不明者を出しました。また、いまだに数万人の方々が仮設住宅で非難生活を余儀なくされています。そのような環境で育った子供たちにとっては、将来に夢や希望を持つことは、ますます困難になっているのが現状です。

また、避難者の自殺率は国の平均をはるかに越え、震災関連死は増え続けています。また、住宅事情の改善も、2020年のオリンピックの準備やその他の問題に政治的意識が向けられて、複雑な様相を呈しています。

今回計画しているコンサートは、そのような状況にある方々を励まし、楽しんでいただくとともに、今の現状から少しでもポジティブなコミュニティースピリットが生まれるようにと願って行うものです。そして同時に、産業や国のプライドよりも、被災者の方々の生活の復興が優先されるべきであることを訴えたいのです。

コンサートは、2015年10月の2週間、ソロのミニコンサートが中心で、主に気仙沼など震災で多くの被害にあった地域の学校やコミュニティーホールで行います。以降は毎年のコンサートを計画中で、今回は、気仙沼復興協会がコンサートのスケジュール調整の協力をしてくれています。

以上、皆様の暖かいご支援を心からお願い申し上げます。


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £6000 for flights from the UK, accommodation and expenses for two people, myself and a translator/assistant, also music equipment, car hire and publicity costs. There are a range of rewards for your contributions in the form of 'perks'. Free downloads, signed copies of the double CD/DVD set 'Paper Windows and private concerts for your friends or workplace, I can even write you a personal song with your own title and lyrics (optional), recorded onto CD with a 50/50 split in writing credits.

If we exceed our goal, this will go towards expanding the Hope and Dreams tour project and further the work of the World Culture Association. If we can't manage all, we will still go and do the best we can to encourage and support.
コンサートを実行するためには、約6,000ポンドが必要です。もし皆さんのご協力を得られるのであれば、歌の無料ダウンロード、無料CDやDVD、プライベートコンサートへのご招待、あるいは皆さんの詩に作曲したり、個人の歌を作詞作曲してCDを製作する（収益50/50）などを通してお返ししたいと思います。


The Impact

The concerts aim to show support for those people who are building themselves up from a situation of losing everything. They have tremendous courage and determination to go forward and we want to join in with this spirit, amplifying and helping it to grow and bear fruits for the future.

このコンサートは全てを失ってしまった被災者の方々を励まし、応援するものです。世界が忘れていないことを知ってもらうことによって、地域がより力強く、希望的未来に進んで行ってくれることを願っています。

＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊

story:
Hi!  Marilyn Rucker and Friends are raising money to record another set of quirky, fun tunes.  

Marilyn's tunes have been on The King of Queens (I Love Your Smell), The Dr. Demento Show (Email Legends, Happy Whatever You're Having, Grandma, Show Us Your Tattos),  The Today Show (I Love Your Smell) and in videogames like Space Station Sims (Leaving B).  
Past albums (Voyeur Princess, Teapot Lady, Somebody Else's Weirdo, and Interstellar Pirate Queen) have been interesting, fun, and full of the work of excellent musicians.  This new c.d. will be no exception to that rule, and will draw from a variety of great talent in the Austin area and beyond.   You can check out more about Marilyn and some of the other  musicians she plays with at www.marilynrucker.com.
  • We need at least $5000 to professionally record these fourteen or so songs, mix and master the recordings and make c.d.'s .    If the campaign falls short of that goal, we will at least  get the songs recorded in digital format (but without mastering) and make a limited run of physical c.d.s for donors.  And get digital distribution for the songs as well. 
  • With your donation, you can get a digital download of the c.d., a physical copy of the c.d. and various other perks.

The Impact

  • You'll be helping to add to the library of weird little c.d.'s we' ve already produced such as Voyeur Princess, Teapot Lady, Somebody Else's Weirdo and Interstellar Pirate Queen.   And don't we need more weird little songs?   We thought so!  
  • You'll be keeping another singer/songwriter from roaming the streets with a coffee can and a ukulele to raise funds.   Isn't that worth fighting for?  We thought so! 
  • Tunes to be recorded include:  Tree Goats of Morocco, We're Like This On Facebook, Don't Poke that Snake, Jim, Who Ran Away and Was Eaten By a Lion, My Apology,  Ode to Poultry, Venice is Sinking, The Earth Has A Fever, Nero Fiddles While Rome Burns,  You Are Family, and The Green Children.  Although songs may be added, subtracted, changed or rearranged as circumstances dictate.     All tunes will be quite tasty.  Really! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute money, , but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Every little bit helps, so contributing a dollar is a good start. 
  • Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter and anywhere else you can think of where folks might be interested!
